name: Payment for Successful Additional Weld Test
rule_text: Any welder who is required to do additional testing by the Employer, shall be paid for weld time of four (4) hours per successful test
summary: Welders who successfully complete an additional weld test required by the employer will be paid for four hours of weld time for that test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'ADDITIONAL_TEST' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(4_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule specifies a flat-rate payment for time spent on a work-related task (weld testing), which is a form of compensation for labor time.

name: Payment for Successful Single Plate Weld Test
rule_text: (excluding the boiler ¼ Down Hand Plate or other single ¼ plate test, will be paid two (2) hours).
summary: For specific single plate weld tests, such as the boiler ¼ Down Hand Plate test, a successful welder will be paid for two hours instead of the standard four hours for other additional tests.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) IN ['BOILER_1/4_DOWN_HAND_PLATE', 'SINGLE_1/4_PLATE_TEST'] AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines an exception to the general test payment, specifying a different flat-rate payment for specific types of tests, which is compensation for labor time.

name: Maximum Payment for Three-Plate Additional Test
rule_text: Additional test consists of three plates welded in the vertical, horizontal and overhead positions and will be paid a maximum of four (4) hours total, upon successful completion.
summary: An 'additional test' involving three plates (vertical, horizontal, overhead) has a maximum total payment of four hours upon successful completion.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'ADDITIONAL_TEST_3_PLATES' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(MAX(4_HOURS_TOTAL))
reasoning: This rule sets a cap on the payment for a specific work-related task, directly governing how labor time is compensated.

name: Payment for Abbreviated Plate Test
rule_text: Those requested to take an abbreviated version of the plate test will be compensated at one and a half (1.5) hours for each successful plate test.
summary: Welders who successfully complete an abbreviated plate test will be paid one and a half hours for each successful plate.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'ABBREVIATED_PLATE_TEST' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' -> PAY(1.5_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific flat-rate payment for a type of weld test, which is compensation for labor time.

name: No Payment for Failed Weld Tests
rule_text: In any event a welder will not be paid for a failed test.
summary: Welders are not entitled to any payment for a welding test that they fail.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> FORFEIT(PAYMENT)
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for payment related to a work activity, defining when compensation for labor time is withheld.

name: Option for Second Weld Test
rule_text: At the sole discretion of the Weld Test Examiner, the welder may be granted the opportunity to take a second test.
summary: If a welder fails a test, the Weld Test Examiner has the discretion to allow the welder to take the test a second time.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' AND weld_test_examiner_discretion (llm) == true -> ALLOW(SECOND_TEST_ATTEMPT)
reasoning: This rule outlines a condition that could lead to a paid work activity (a successful second test), making it relevant to how labor time and compensation are managed.

name: Travel Allowance for Job Site Testing
rule_text: If a welder is required to test at the job site, the welder shall be paid for any applicable travel allowance, but not for the failed test.
summary: Welders required to test at a job site are eligible for applicable travel allowances, regardless of whether they pass the test. However, they will not be paid for the test time itself if they fail.
logical_representation: IF test_location (llm) == 'JOB_SITE' -> PAY(APPLICABLE_TRAVEL_ALLOWANCE)
reasoning: This rule grants a specific monetary allowance for travel, which falls under the category of subsistence and travel-related entitlements.

name: Payment for Partial Success in Multiple Tests
rule_text: If an Employer is requesting more than three (3) tests per welder and a welder has successfully completed three (3) of four (4) tests, the Employer may retain the welder and pay for the three (3) successful weld test. If the Employer decides not to retain the welder, he or she will be paid for the three (3) successful weld tests.
summary: If an employer requests more than three tests and the welder passes three of them, the welder will be paid for the three successful tests, regardless of whether the employer chooses to hire them or not.
logical_representation: IF number_of_tests_requested (llm) > 3 AND number_of_tests_passed (llm) == 3 -> PAY(FOR_3_SUCCESSFUL_TESTS)
reasoning: This rule specifies payment conditions for a specific scenario of partial success in work-related testing, directly governing compensation for labor time.

name: Employer Responsibility for Testing Costs
rule_text: For every required test and any examiner permitted second test the Employer will pay the transfer fees, materials and inspector fees.
summary: The employer is responsible for paying all associated costs for required welding tests, including any permitted second attempts. These costs include transfer fees, materials, and inspector fees.
logical_representation: IF test_attempt (llm) IN ['INITIAL', 'EXAMINER_PERMITTED_SECOND_TEST'] -> EMPLOYER_PAYS(transfer_fees, materials, inspector_fees)
reasoning: This rule details the financial obligations of the employer related to a work activity (testing). While not a direct payment to the employee, it is a cost of labor and fits best within the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic as it's directly tied to the performance of a work-related test.

name: Payment for Secondary Test Time
rule_text: Should a secondary test be required by the Employer, the employee shall be paid for the time required to take such a test.
summary: If an employer requires an employee to take a secondary test, the employee must be paid for the actual time spent taking that test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'SECONDARY_TEST' -> PAY(ACTUAL_TIME_TAKEN)
reasoning: This rule dictates that time spent on a required test is compensable, directly addressing how worked time is calculated and paid.

name: Practice Material for Non-Standard Tests
rule_text: When a welder is required to perform a test of a type other than a standard Provincial test, the Employer shall, on request, make available suitable material to allow a brief period of practice prior to taking the actual test.
summary: For non-standard provincial tests, welders can request and must be provided with suitable materials for a brief practice session before the actual test.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) != 'STANDARD_PROVINCIAL_TEST' AND employee_request (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(PRACTICE_MATERIAL)
reasoning: This rule provides an entitlement (practice materials) directly related to the performance of a work activity (testing), and thus falls under the scope of rules governing labor and work conditions.

name: Travel Reimbursement for Out-of-Town Tests
rule_text: Any welder possessing a current Provincial Government welding certificate of qualification, who is instructed to proceed to take tests, necessitating their having to travel outside of the city limits of the city in which they reside or are employed, shall be reimbursed in an amount necessary to compensate them for travel allowance, transportation, travel expenses, subsistence allowance, if applicable.
summary: Certified welders who must travel outside their city of residence or employment for a required test will be reimbursed for travel allowance, transportation, travel expenses, and subsistence allowance if applicable.
logical_representation: IF has_provincial_welding_certificate (llm) == true AND test_location_outside_city_limits (llm) == true -> REIMBURSE(travel_allowance, transportation, travel_expenses, subsistence_allowance)
reasoning: This rule explicitly details entitlements for travel and subsistence allowances, which are the core focus of this topic.

name: Mutual Agreement on Test Costs and Location
rule_text: The Employer and the Local Lodge will communicate and mutually agree to related costs and test location(s) before proceeding with the testing.
summary: Before proceeding with out-of-town testing, the employer and the Local Lodge must communicate and mutually agree on the associated costs and the location of the test.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: Employer and union_local (Unsupported) must mutually agree on costs and location before testing proceeds.
reasoning: This rule is a procedural requirement directly linked to the provision of travel and subsistence allowances described in the same article, making it part of that topic.

name: Provision of Test Papers upon Passing
rule_text: Welders passing a test will be furnished a copy of the test papers from the Employer or party requiring the test within thirty (30) days, or upon completion of the job, whichever is sooner, provided they are available at that time; otherwise the Employer will provide a letter confirming the test and the results.
summary: Welders who pass a test must be given a copy of their test papers within 30 days or at the job's completion, whichever comes first. If papers are unavailable, a confirmation letter must be provided.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'PASS' -> PROVIDE(test_papers OR confirmation_letter)
reasoning: This rule describes an entitlement that is a direct outcome of a work-related activity (testing). It's a non-monetary benefit tied to labor performance, fitting within the broader category of work rules.

name: Fair Conditions for Provincial Certification Tests
rule_text: Where a welder is to take an official Provincial test on which the issuance or re-issuance of their certificate will depend, they shall not be required to do so under conditions which would unfairly affect their ability to perform the test.
summary: Welders taking an official Provincial certification test must be provided with fair testing conditions that do not negatively impact their performance.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'OFFICIAL_PROVINCIAL_CERTIFICATION' -> ENSURE(FAIR_TEST_CONDITIONS)
reasoning: This rule governs the conditions under which work (a test) is performed, which is a fundamental aspect of labor rules.

name: Test Conditions for Other Tests
rule_text: For other tests, the Employer may prescribe test conditions approximating, but not exceeding, conditions which may be encountered on the job.
summary: For tests other than official Provincial certifications, the employer can set test conditions that are similar to, but not more difficult than, actual job site conditions.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) != 'OFFICIAL_PROVINCIAL_CERTIFICATION' -> SET_TEST_CONDITIONS(APPROXIMATING_JOB_CONDITIONS, NOT_EXCEEDING_JOB_CONDITIONS)
reasoning: This rule sets parameters for working conditions during a specific work activity (testing), placing it within the scope of labor time and conditions.

name: Right to Complete a Test
rule_text: Welders required to take any test shall be allowed to complete the test.
summary: Once a welder begins a required test, they must be allowed to finish it.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'WELDING_TEST' -> ALLOW(COMPLETION_OF_TEST)
reasoning: This rule establishes a right for an employee during a work-related activity, directly relating to the rules governing labor performance.

name: Forfeiture of Pay for Failure to Report to Work
rule_text: Any welder who successfully completes the welding test, but fails to report for work as notified, without a bona fide reason acceptable to the Employer, will not be eligible for any payment, including testing time and other allowances, as set out in Article 7.00.
summary: A welder who passes a test but then fails to show up for work as scheduled, without an acceptable reason, will forfeit all payments and allowances related to the test.
logical_representation: IF test_result (Unsupported) == 'SUCCESS' AND employee_reports_to_work (llm) == false AND has_bona_fide_reason (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(ALL_PAYMENT_AND_ALLOWANCES)
reasoning: This rule outlines a condition that results in the forfeiture of payment for worked time and associated allowances, making it a critical rule for labor compensation.

name: Second Test Opportunity for Pre-Job Test Failure
rule_text: Any welder required to take a pre-job welding test for employment with an Employer and fails the required weld test, the welder may be granted the opportunity to take a second test.
summary: If a welder fails a required pre-employment welding test, they may be given a chance to take the test a second time.
logical_representation: IF test_type (llm) == 'PRE_JOB_WELDING_TEST' AND test_result (Unsupported) == 'FAIL' -> ALLOW(SECOND_TEST_ATTEMPT)
reasoning: This rule provides a condition for a potential re-test, which is a work-related activity that could lead to compensation, therefore it relates to the administration of labor time.

name: Alloy Welder Premium
rule_text: Alloy welders with a valid alloy welding certificate will be paid an additional premium of three dollars and twenty-five cents ($3.25) per hour worked if certification was a requirement for dispatch.
summary: A welder with a valid alloy welding certificate receives a premium of $3.25 per hour if that certification was a required condition for being dispatched to the job.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'ALLOY_WELDER' AND has_valid_alloy_certificate (llm) == true AND certification_required_for_dispatch (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($3.25)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific hourly premium based on certification and job requirements, which is a direct modification of the pay rate for worked time.

name: Reclassification and Premium for On-Site Alloy Welding
rule_text: If a welder on site who was not dispatched as an alloy welder, but has the certification, or is requested to be certified by the Employer and is requested to perform alloy welding, the employee will be reclassified as an alloy welder and paid the alloy welder premium from the date of re-classification.
summary: If a welder who was not originally dispatched as an alloy welder is asked to perform alloy welding on site, they will be reclassified as an alloy welder and will start receiving the alloy premium from the date of that reclassification.
logical_representation: IF is_performing_alloy_welding (llm) == true -> RECLASSIFY('ALLOY_WELDER') AND PAY(PREMIUM($3.25_FROM_RECLASSIFICATION_DATE))
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions for reclassification and the application of a wage premium based on the type of work performed, directly impacting the calculation of pay for labor time.

name: Alloy Premium Calculation Rules
rule_text: This premium shall not pyramid on an overtime hour; however, it will attract applicable Vacation and Statutory Holiday Pay.
summary: The alloy welder premium is not compounded on overtime hours, but it is included in the calculation for vacation and statutory holiday pay.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: ALLOY_PREMIUM does not pyramid on OT. CONSTRAINT: ALLOY_PREMIUM attracts Vacation and Statutory Holiday Pay.
reasoning: This rule provides specific instructions on how a wage premium interacts with other pay types like overtime and vacation pay, which is fundamental to the calculation of total compensation for worked time.

name: Work Guarantee Disclaimer
rule_text: The Employer does not guarantee to provide work to any employee for regularly assigned hours or any other hours, except as provided for in Article 18.00.
summary: The employer does not guarantee a set number of work hours for any employee, except as specified elsewhere in the agreement.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(work_hours_not_guaranteed)
reasoning: This rule establishes a fundamental condition regarding the guarantee of work hours, which is foundational to how worked time is considered. It is a constraint on work availability, thus falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Normal Work Schedule Definition (5x8)
rule_text: Eight (8) hours per day shall constitute a normal day of work. The normal hours of work shall be between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. for an eight (8) hour day with one-half (½) or one (1) hour for lunch at the midpoint of the shift. Forty (40) hours shall constitute a normal week's work, Monday through Friday inclusive.
summary: A normal workday is 8 hours, and a normal workweek is 40 hours from Monday to Friday. The standard workday occurs between 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. with a 30 or 60-minute unpaid lunch break around the middle of the shift.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' -> DEFINE(daily_hours=8, weekly_hours=40, days_of_week=['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'], work_window='07:00-18:00', lunch_break='0.5-1.0_UNPAID')
reasoning: This rule defines the baseline for a standard work schedule, including daily and weekly hours, which is the basis for calculating pay and overtime. Therefore, its primary topic is LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Schedule Window Variance by Mutual Agreement
rule_text: Variances beyond one (1) hour of 7:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. shall be agreed mutually between the Employer and the Local Lodge Business Manager/Secretary-Treasurer. The one (1) hour variance is conditional upon the Employer giving the Local Lodge and affected employees appropriate advance notice.
summary: Changes to the standard 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. work window of more than one hour require mutual agreement. Changes within one hour are permitted if the employer provides advance notice.
logical_representation: IF schedule_variance_hours (llm) > 1 -> REQUIRES(is_mutual_agreement (llm) == true) AND IF schedule_variance_hours (llm) <= 1 -> REQUIRES(is_advance_notice_given (llm) == true)
reasoning: This rule governs the conditions under which the standard working hours can be changed, directly impacting how work time is scheduled and compensated. It is classified as LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Overtime for Unilateral Schedule Change
rule_text: If the foregoing starting or quitting times are changed without mutual agreement, applicable overtime rates shall be paid for any time worked before or after the above hours as a result of the change of times.
summary: If the employer changes the start or end times of a shift without mutual agreement, any time worked outside the originally scheduled hours must be paid at overtime rates.
logical_representation: IF is_unilateral_schedule_change (llm) == true -> PAY(OT_RATE) for hours worked outside original schedule
reasoning: This rule defines a specific condition under which overtime rates are applied, which is a core component of categorizing and compensating worked hours. Therefore, it falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Compressed Work Week Alteration by Mutual Agreement
rule_text: The workdays may be altered (between Monday to Friday inclusive) on any project by mutual agreement in writing between the Local Lodge's Business Manager/Secretary-Treasurer or designate and the Employer. · The hours of work may be altered (between Monday to Friday inclusive) on any project by mutual agreement in writing between the Local Lodge's Business Manager/SecretaryTreasurer or designate and the Employer.
summary: On any project, the workdays and hours of work (Monday to Friday) can be changed from the standard schedule if both the employer and the union agree in writing.
logical_representation: IF is_mutual_agreement_written (llm) == true -> ALLOW(ALTER(schedule_type))
reasoning: This rule outlines the process for establishing non-standard work schedules (like a compressed work week), which directly relates to how hours of work are structured and managed. This makes it a LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: CWW Makeup Day Provision
rule_text: When working under the four (4) day work week schedule, Friday may be used as a make-up day when weather conditions have caused lost time during the regular work week. A make-up day will only be worked during the week in which the time is lost.
summary: Under a four-day compressed work week, Friday can be used as a make-up day to recover time lost due to weather during that same week.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND is_lost_time_due_to_weather (llm) == true in current week -> ALLOW(is_makeup_day (llm) = true)
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions for a specific type of workday (a make-up day), which affects the weekly work schedule and how hours are counted. It's classified as LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: CWW Makeup Day Pay at Straight Time
rule_text: Work performed on a make-up day shall be paid at the regular straight time rate for the first ten (10) hours to a maximum of forty (40) hours per week...
summary: Work on a make-up day is paid at the regular straight-time rate for the first 10 hours of the day, as long as the total weekly hours do not exceed 40.
logical_representation: IF is_makeup_day (llm) == true AND daily_hours <= 10 AND weekly_hours <= 40 -> PAY(ST)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for hours worked on a make-up day, defining the threshold for straight time. This is a core function of categorizing worked time for payment, so it is LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: CWW Makeup Day Overtime
rule_text: ...after which double time (2X) rates shall apply.
summary: On a make-up day, any hours worked beyond 10 in the day or 40 in the week are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF is_makeup_day (llm) == true AND (daily_hours > 10 OR weekly_hours > 40) -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions under which hours worked on a make-up day transition to double time. Classifying hours into pay buckets (ST, OT, DT) is a primary function of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: CWW Makeup Day Minimum Hours
rule_text: In no case shall the time scheduled on a make-up day be less than eight (8) hours except where weather conditions dictate otherwise.
summary: A make-up day must be scheduled for at least eight hours, unless bad weather prevents it.
logical_representation: IF is_makeup_day (llm) == true -> MIN(8_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule sets a minimum duration for a specific type of workday, which is a rule governing the scheduling and compensation of worked hours. This falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: CWW Makeup Day is Voluntary
rule_text: All time worked on a make-up day will be at the employee's choice.
summary: Working on a make-up day is optional for the employee.
logical_representation: IF is_makeup_day (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(employee_choice_to_work)
reasoning: This rule establishes a condition of employment for a specific workday (make-up day), defining it as voluntary. This is a rule about the conditions of worked time, thus fitting into LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: CWW Straight Time Hours in a Holiday Week
rule_text: Where a holiday occurs during the normal work week the maximum of thirty (30) hours per week shall form the basis of maximum straight time rate.
summary: If a recognized holiday falls within the work week, the weekly threshold for straight-time pay is reduced to 30 hours.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday_in_week == true -> SET(weekly_hours_ST_max=30)
reasoning: This rule adjusts the weekly overtime threshold based on the presence of a statutory holiday. Modifying the calculation for ST/OT bucketing is a core aspect of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Weekend and Holiday Overtime Premium
rule_text: Work performed on Saturday, Sunday, or Recognized Holidays shall be paid at the applicable overtime premium.
summary: All hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or a recognized holiday must be paid at the applicable overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true -> PAY(OT_PREMIUM)
reasoning: This rule specifies that certain days are inherently paid at a premium rate. This direct classification of worked hours into a premium pay category makes it a LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: Shift Length Guarantee (Other Trades)
rule_text: Employees will not be required to work less than the regular assigned hours because of the starting or quitting time of any other trade on the job.
summary: An employee's full shift hours are guaranteed and cannot be cut short due to the work schedules of other trades on the same job site.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(shift_hours_not_reduced_by_other_trades)
reasoning: This rule provides a guarantee of hours under specific circumstances, ensuring employees receive their full scheduled workday. This guarantee of worked time falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Penalty for Displaced Lunch Break
rule_text: An employee shall not be required to work during their regular lunch break except in emergency or special circumstances, in which case, they will receive a re-assigned one-half (½) hour lunch break. If this break falls outside the regular lunch break established on the job, they shall receive an additional allowance of one-half (½) hour of pay at straight time rates which shall be in addition to their regular straight time hours.
summary: If an employee works through their regular lunch break for an emergency, they get a rescheduled 30-minute break. If this rescheduled break is outside the normal lunch period, the employee receives an extra 30 minutes of pay at straight-time rates.
logical_representation: IF work_during_lunch (llm) == true AND reassigned_lunch_outside_normal_window (llm) == true -> PAY(0.5_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule provides a monetary compensation (an allowance of pay) for a disruption to the workday structure. Since it results in additional paid time, it is classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Rest Breaks on 8-Hour Shift
rule_text: When working eight (8) hour work shifts, two (2) rest or coffee breaks of ten (10) minutes each shall be established by the Employer.
summary: On an 8-hour shift, employees are entitled to two 10-minute rest breaks provided by the employer.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 8 -> PROVIDE(2 x 10_minute_breaks)
reasoning: This rule defines an entitlement to paid breaks as part of the structure of a standard workday. It is a condition of work that is part of the overall hours, so it's classified as LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Pre-Overtime Rest Break
rule_text: If overtime is to follow the regular eight (8) hour work shift, a further ten (10) minute rest or coffee break shall be established before commencing overtime.
summary: If overtime work is required immediately after a regular 8-hour shift, employees are entitled to an additional 10-minute rest break before starting the overtime.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 8 AND daily_overtime_hours > 0 -> PROVIDE(10_minute_break_before_OT)
reasoning: This rule provides an entitlement to a break based on working overtime hours. This is a condition related to the structure of the workday when it extends beyond normal hours, falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Rest Break Options on 10-Hour Shift
rule_text: At the sole discretion of the Employer, where a scheduled ten (10) hour workday is established, the rest or coffee breaks may be either three (3) breaks of ten (10) minutes each, (described above) or two (2) breaks of fifteen (15) minutes each.
summary: For scheduled 10-hour workdays, the employer can choose to provide either three 10-minute breaks or two 15-minute breaks.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 10 -> ALLOW(OPTION(3 x 10_minute_breaks) OR OPTION(2 x 15_minute_breaks))
reasoning: This rule defines the break entitlements for a specific shift length (10 hours). As breaks are a component of the paid workday, this rule pertains to the structure of worked time and is classified as LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Paid Breaks Option on 10-Hour Shift
rule_text: When working ten (10) hour shifts, in lieu of the work breaks and lunch breaks provided herein, the Employer shall have the option of scheduling two (2) breaks of one-half (½) hour each, both paid at the applicable rate, approximately equally spaced in the ten (10) hour shift.
summary: On 10-hour shifts, the employer has the option to replace the standard break schedule with two 30-minute paid breaks, spaced evenly throughout the shift.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 10 -> ALLOW(OPTION(2 x 0.5_hour_paid_breaks))
reasoning: This rule provides an alternative break schedule that explicitly involves paid breaks. Since it directly affects how break time is compensated and structured within the workday, it is a LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Break Schedule Change Notification
rule_text: A change in the scheduling of a break will normally be communicated to the affected employees prior to the end of the work cycle before the change.
summary: If the employer changes the break schedule, they are expected to notify the affected employees before the end of the work cycle preceding the change.
logical_representation: IF is_break_schedule_changed (llm) == true -> REQUIRES(advance_notification)
reasoning: This rule outlines a procedural requirement related to the scheduling of work and breaks. It is a condition governing the administration of the workday, placing it within the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Work Week Definition
rule_text: For the purpose of clarification and to define Saturday and Sunday work, the work shall be deemed to commence at the starting time of the regular day shift on Monday morning.
summary: The work week officially starts at the beginning of the regular day shift on Monday morning, which serves as the basis for identifying Saturday and Sunday work.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(work_week_start_time (llm) == 'MON_DAY_SHIFT_START')
reasoning: This rule establishes the temporal framework for the work week, which is fundamental to categorizing hours and determining weekend days. This falls under the definition and categorization of worked time.

name: Shift Start Day Flexibility
rule_text: Shifts may be commenced on any calendar day provided the appropriate requirements for shift premium and overtime as specified in this Agreement are met.
summary: Shifts can begin on any day of the week, provided that the agreement's rules for shift premium and overtime pay are correctly applied.
logical_representation: PERMITTED(shift_start_day == any day_of_week) IF (APPLY_PAY_RULES(shift_premium) AND APPLY_PAY_RULES(overtime))
reasoning: This rule governs the scheduling of work and links it directly to the application of pay rules like overtime and premiums, which is a core function of managing and categorizing worked time.

name: First Shift Definition and Variation
rule_text: For the purpose of defining the shifts, the 1st shift shall be the day shift which commences at 7:00 a.m. This starting time may be varied by mutual agreement to suit job requirements.
summary: The first shift is defined as the day shift, which normally starts at 7:00 a.m. However, this start time can be changed if both the employer and union agree it's necessary for the job.
logical_representation: DEFAULT(shift_number (llm) == 1 -> shift_type == 'DAY' AND shift_start_time (llm) == '07:00'); IF mutual_agreement_status (llm) == true -> PERMITTED(MODIFY(shift_start_time (llm)))
reasoning: This rule defines a fundamental component of the work schedule (the day shift and its start time) and the conditions under which it can be altered, directly impacting how work hours are categorized.

name: Second and Third Shift Definitions
rule_text: The second (2 nd ) shift shall be the afternoon shift and shall follow the first (1 st ) shift. The third (3 rd ) shift shall be the night shift and shall follow the second (2 nd ) shift.
summary: The second shift is the afternoon shift, which follows the first (day) shift. The third shift is the night shift, which follows the second (afternoon) shift.
logical_representation: IF shift_number (llm) == 2 -> shift_name (llm) == 'AFTERNOON' AND FOLLOWS(shift_number (llm) == 1); IF shift_number (llm) == 3 -> shift_type == 'NIGHT' AND FOLLOWS(shift_number (llm) == 2)
reasoning: This rule defines the structure and sequence of the shift system, which is essential for categorizing hours and applying correct pay rates or premiums based on the shift worked.

name: Maximum Time Between Shifts
rule_text: Second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts shall commence not later than one (1) hour after the completion of the preceding shift, except where this is prevented by conditions or requirements beyond the control of the Employer.
summary: The afternoon and night shifts must begin within one hour of the previous shift's end, unless this is made impossible by circumstances outside the employer's control.
logical_representation: IF uncontrollable_condition (llm) == false AND (shift_number (llm) == 2 OR shift_number (llm) == 3) -> CONSTRAINT(inter_shift_break_duration (llm) <= 1)
reasoning: This rule imposes a constraint on the scheduling of work hours, specifically the transition time between shifts, which is an element of managing and defining worked time.

name: Second and Third Shift Premium
rule_text:
A shift premium shall apply on all hours worked on second (2 nd ) and third (3 rd ) shifts at the rates as set out in the Wage and Benefit Schedule.

All shift premium hours will be paid at a rate of four dollars and fifty cents ($4.50) per hour.
summary: Employees working on the second (afternoon) or third (night) shift will receive an additional $4.50 per hour as a shift premium for all hours worked on those shifts.
logical_representation: IF shift_number (llm) == 2 OR shift_number (llm) == 3 -> PREMIUM($4.50)
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific monetary premium for hours worked during certain shifts. This is a direct rule for calculating pay based on the time work is performed, which is a core component of labor worked time.

name: Insufficient Rest Period Penalty
rule_text: When an employee is required to return to work without an eight (8) hour break, all work performed shall be paid for at the applicable overtime rates, until such time as the employee receives an eight (8) hour break.
summary: If an employee is required to work without having at least an eight-hour break since their last shift, all work performed will be paid at overtime rates until they are given an eight-hour break.
logical_representation: IF rest_period_duration_hours (llm) < 8 -> TRANSITION(OT) UNTIL rest_period_duration_hours (llm) >= 8
reasoning: This rule defines a condition (insufficient rest) that changes the pay categorization of worked hours to overtime. Re-categorizing time buckets is a fundamental aspect of labor worked time.

name: Shift Schedule Change by Mutual Consent
rule_text: The  Local  Lodge  agrees  to  discuss  the  flexibility  and  options  of  shift  schedules  as brought forward at the request of the Employer/Owner. No such changes will be implemented without the mutual consent of both parties.  Any and all other  Articles,  Terms and Conditions shall apply.
summary: The employer can propose changes to shift schedules, but no changes can be made without mutual agreement from the union. Any agreed-upon changes must still adhere to all other terms of the contract.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(MODIFY(schedule_type)) REQUIRES mutual_agreement_status (llm) == true
reasoning: This rule outlines the procedural requirements for altering work schedules. Since schedules are the foundation for how worked time is organized and calculated, this rule falls under the labor worked time topic.

name: Weekday Overtime, Time and a Half Rate
rule_text: When an employee is required to work in excess of the regular hours, Monday through Friday inclusive, they shall be paid overtime at the rate of time and one- half (1 ½) the regular rate of pay.
summary: For employees on a standard Monday to Friday schedule, hours worked beyond their regular daily hours are paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 8 AND daily_hours <= 10 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rate for the initial block of overtime hours worked on a weekday, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: Weekday Overtime, Double Time Threshold
rule_text: Double (2) time will be paid after ten (10) hours worked.
summary: On a regular Monday to Friday workday, any hours worked beyond the 10th hour are paid at double the regular rate.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the daily hour threshold after which overtime pay transitions to a higher rate (double time), directly relating to how worked time is categorized and paid.

name: Weekend and Holiday Overtime Rate
rule_text: Employees working on a Saturday, Sunday, and Recognized Holidays shall be paid an overtime rate at double (2) time the regular rate of pay.
summary: All hours worked on a Saturday, Sunday, or a recognized holiday are paid at double the regular rate.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for special days (weekends and holidays), which is a core component of classifying labor worked time.

name: 4x10 Schedule (Mon-Thu) Overtime
rule_text: (ii) Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Monday to Thursday: Double Time (2x) After 10 hours
summary: For employees on a 4x10 Monday to Thursday schedule, any hours worked beyond 10 on their regular workdays are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific daily overtime threshold for the 4x10 (Mon-Thu) schedule, categorizing hours worked beyond the regular shift.

name: 4x10 Schedule (Mon-Thu) Friday Overtime
rule_text: (ii) Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Monday to Thursday: Friday, Up to 10 hours at Time and One Half (1.5x), After 10 hours at Double Time (2x)
summary: For employees on a 4x10 Monday to Thursday schedule, all work on Friday is overtime. The first 10 hours are paid at time and a half, and any hours beyond that are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> (IF daily_hours <= 10 -> TRANSITION(OT) ELSE -> TRANSITION(DT))
reasoning: This rule specifies how worked time is categorized and paid on a scheduled day off (Friday) for a particular work schedule (4x10 Mon-Thu).

name: 4x10 Schedule (Tue-Fri) Overtime
rule_text: (iii)Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Tuesday to Friday: Double Time (2x) After 10 hours
summary: For employees on a 4x10 Tuesday to Friday schedule, any hours worked beyond 10 on their regular workdays are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' AND day_of_week IN ['TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific daily overtime threshold for the 4x10 (Tue-Fri) schedule, categorizing hours worked beyond the regular shift.

name: 4x10 Schedule (Tue-Fri) Monday Overtime
rule_text: (iii)Four Ten Hour Day Option (4x10) Tuesday to Friday: Monday, Up to 10 hours at Time and One Half (1.5x), After 10 hours at Double Time (2x)
summary: For employees on a 4x10 Tuesday to Friday schedule, all work on Monday is overtime. The first 10 hours are paid at time and a half, and any hours beyond that are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' AND day_of_week == 'MON' -> (IF daily_hours <= 10 -> TRANSITION(OT) ELSE -> TRANSITION(DT))
reasoning: This rule specifies how worked time is categorized and paid on a scheduled day off (Monday) for a particular work schedule (4x10 Tue-Fri).

name: Voluntary Unscheduled Overtime
rule_text: Any unscheduled overtime will be voluntary and worked at the employees' discretion.
summary: Employees are not required to work unscheduled overtime; it is their choice.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'UNSCHEDULED' -> CONSTRAINT(voluntary_for_employee)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition related to the obligation to work overtime hours, which is a facet of labor time management.

name: Shift Premium on Overtime
rule_text: Employees working overtime shall continue to receive their shift premium for all hours worked.
summary: Shift premiums continue to be paid for all overtime hours worked.
logical_representation: IF daily_overtime_hours > 0 -> APPLY(shift_premium)
reasoning: This rule dictates how shift premiums are applied during overtime, directly affecting the calculation of pay for worked time.

name: Shift Premium Compounding Prohibition
rule_text: The shift premium shall not be compounded for overtime hours worked.
summary: The shift premium amount is not included in the base rate when calculating overtime pay (i.e., it is not multiplied by the overtime rate).
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: shift_premium_is_not_compounded_for_overtime
reasoning: This is a calculation rule that specifies how overtime pay and shift premiums interact, which is a core part of defining labor worked time costs.

name: First Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: When an employee works beyond ten (10) hours per day, they shall be entitled to a meal break and meal supplied by the Company.
summary: An employee is entitled to a company-supplied meal and a meal break after working more than 10 hours in a day.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule establishes the primary condition (working beyond 10 hours) for an employee to receive a meal-related benefit, which is the core of the meal allowance topic.

name: Subsequent Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: The meal break will be provided after ten (10) hours of work and subsequent meal breaks each four (4) hours thereafter.
summary: After the first meal break (which occurs after 10 hours), an employee is entitled to another meal break for every additional four hours of continuous overtime worked.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 AND (daily_hours - 10) % 4 == 0 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule defines the recurring trigger (every 4 hours after the first) for meal entitlements during extended overtime, directly relating to meal allowances.

name: 4x10 Schedule Meal Break Extension
rule_text: When the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is worked, recognizing emergency situations will arise, if the Company has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift, the Company shall be granted a one (1) hour extension where a meal and meal break are not required.
summary: For employees on a 4x10 schedule, if unscheduled overtime is required in an emergency, the company can extend the shift by one hour (to 11 hours) without providing a meal and break.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type IN ['4x10_mon-thu', '4x10_tue-fri'] AND overtime_scheduled (llm) == false AND daily_hours > 10 AND daily_hours <= 11 -> FORFEIT(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific exception to a meal entitlement based on the work schedule and the nature of the overtime, thus it's a rule about meal allowances.

name: Scheduled Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: When an employee works Scheduled Overtime (work performed on Saturdays, Sundays and Holidays) they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds ten (10) hours).
summary: During scheduled overtime on weekends or holidays, an employee is entitled to a meal break once their work time on that day exceeds 10 hours.
logical_representation: IF (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) AND daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule specifies the meal entitlement trigger for a specific type of work (Scheduled Overtime), making it a rule within the meal allowance category.

name: Emergency Call-Out Meal Entitlement
rule_text: When an employee works Short Notice Emergency Call-Out Overtime (overtime work performed other than continuous with the regular work day or Scheduled Overtime) they shall be entitled to a meal break when overtime work exceeds four (4) hours.
summary: For emergency call-out overtime that is not continuous with a regular shift, an employee is entitled to a meal break after working more than four hours on that call-out.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'CALL_OUT' AND daily_overtime_hours > 4 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule defines a unique meal entitlement trigger based on a specific work scenario (emergency call-out), which falls under the topic of meal allowances.

name: Meal Break Duration
rule_text: All overtime meal breaks will be thirty (30) minutes in duration and will be paid for at straight time rates.
summary: All overtime meal breaks are 30 minutes long and are paid at the employee's straight time rate.
logical_representation: IF overtime_meal_break_provided (llm) == true -> DURATION(30_minutes) AND PAY(30_minutes_at_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the duration and pay for a meal break, which is a direct component of a meal-related entitlement. It also touches on how time is paid, but its primary purpose is defining the meal break itself.

name: Meal Break Calculation Exclusion
rule_text: However, in calculating entitlement to a meal, the thirty (30) minute break shall not count as overtime work.
summary: The 30-minute paid meal break does not count as work time when determining eligibility for the next meal break.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: meal_break_duration_excluded_from_subsequent_meal_entitlement_calculation
reasoning: This rule clarifies how meal entitlements are calculated, specifying what time is excluded, making it a rule primarily about meal allowances.

name: Supervisor Meal Break Exception
rule_text: When a supervisor is required to: a) Start up to one (1) hour earlier, or b) Finish up to one (1) hour later, or c) Start up to one-half (1/2) hour earlier and finish up to one-half (1/2) hour later than the foreperson's crews...the foreperson shall not be entitled to a meal or meal break as per article 13.02, unless those provisions are applicable to the rest of the crew
summary: A supervisor who works up to one extra hour before or after their crew for organizational purposes is not entitled to an overtime meal unless the rest of the crew also qualifies for one.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND daily_hours <= (regular_hours + 1) AND crew_meal_entitlement (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific job-role-based exception to the standard meal entitlement rules, placing it within the meal allowance topic.

name: Supervisor Meal Break Exception Override
rule_text: ...unless ... the supervisor works more than two (2) hours beyond the end of their scheduled shift.
summary: A supervisor becomes eligible for an overtime meal if they work more than two hours past their scheduled shift end, overriding the one-hour exception.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND daily_overtime_hours > 2 -> PROVIDE(meal_and_break)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition that restores a supervisor's meal entitlement, making it a rule about the triggers for meal allowances.

name: Scheduled Overtime Meal Allowance In Lieu
rule_text: Scheduled Overtime ... a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in lieu of the meal break, and a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If a meal cannot be provided during scheduled overtime, the employee receives 30 minutes of pay at their straight-time total package rate and a 15-minute paid rest break instead.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED' AND meal_provided (llm) == false -> PAY(30_minutes_at_ST_total_package) AND PROVIDE(15_minute_paid_break)
reasoning: This rule specifies the monetary and time-based compensation provided when a meal entitlement is met with an allowance instead of a meal, which is central to the meal allowance topic.

name: Unscheduled Overtime Meal Allowance In Lieu
rule_text: Unscheduled Overtime ... a payment of forty dollars ($40.00) as a meal allowance. a payment of thirty (30) minutes at the straight-time total package hourly rate in the lieu of meal break, and a fifteen (15) minute rest break at the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If a meal cannot be provided during unscheduled overtime, the employee receives a $40 meal allowance, plus 30 minutes of pay at their straight-time total package rate, and a 15-minute paid rest break.
logical_representation: IF overtime_type (llm) == 'UNSCHEDULED' AND meal_provided (llm) == false -> ALLOWANCE($40) AND PAY(30_minutes_at_ST_total_package) AND PROVIDE(15_minute_paid_break)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific monetary and time-based payments for when a meal is not provided during unscheduled overtime, making it a core rule of the meal allowance topic.

name: Subsistence and Meal Allowance Interaction
rule_text: There shall be no meal allowance applicable to those receiving subsistence, however any reduction to the current subsistence rates will attract a meal allowance payment equivalent to the reduction.
summary: Employees receiving subsistence payments are not eligible for the overtime meal allowance, unless their subsistence rate is reduced, in which case they will receive a meal allowance equal to the amount of the reduction.
logical_representation: IF subsistence_provided (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance) UNLESS subsistence_rate_reduced (llm) == true
reasoning: This rule directly links eligibility for a meal allowance to the receipt of subsistence, making it primarily about meal allowances but with a strong connection to subsistence.

name: Camp and Meal Allowance Interaction
rule_text: Where a camp is provided, employees will not receive the forty dollars ($40.00) meal allowance where they are able to receive a camp meal at the end of their shift.
summary: If an employee is staying in a camp and can get a meal there after their shift, they are not eligible for the $40 meal allowance for unscheduled overtime.
logical_representation: IF camp_provided (llm) == true AND camp_meal_available (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance_$40)
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition (availability of a camp meal) that negates a monetary meal allowance, clearly placing it under the meal allowance topic.

name: 12-Hour Shift Option Implementation
rule_text: Upon written notice to the Local Lodge, the Employer may implement a twelve (12) hour shift with three (3) half hour paid breaks
summary: The employer can implement a 12-hour shift schedule, which includes three paid half-hour breaks, provided they give written notice to the Local Lodge.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: Employer can implement '12_hour_shift' schedule with written_notice_to_union_local
reasoning: This rule establishes the conditions for implementing a special work schedule, which is a fundamental aspect of defining how labor time is structured.

name: 12-Hour Shift Breaks
rule_text: There are to be three (3) half hour paid breaks. ... All employees on this shift must observe three (3) half hour breaks.
summary: Employees working the 12-hour shift schedule must take three paid half-hour breaks.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift' -> PROVIDE(3_x_30_minute_paid_breaks)
reasoning: This rule defines the break structure within a specific workday schedule, which is a component of how worked time is organized and compensated.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay on 4x10 Base
rule_text: Four (4) x ten (10) Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday: Ten (10) hours @ straight time, two (2) hours @ doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour shift is based on a 4x10 schedule, the pay for each shift is 10 hours at straight time and 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift_4x10_base' AND daily_hours == 12 -> PAY(10_hours_ST) AND PAY(2_hours_DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines how the 12 hours of worked time are categorized into pay buckets (ST and DT) for a specific schedule, which is the core function of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay on 5x8 Base
rule_text: Five (5) x eight (8) Monday to Friday: Eight (8) hours @ straight time, two (2) hours at time and one half (1 ½), two (2) hours at doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour shift is based on a 5x8 schedule, the pay for each shift is 8 hours at straight time, 2 hours at time and a half, and 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_shift_5x8_base' AND daily_hours == 12 -> PAY(8_hours_ST) AND PAY(2_hours_OT) AND PAY(2_hours_DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines how the 12 hours of worked time are categorized into pay buckets (ST, OT, DT) for a specific schedule, making it a clear LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: Entitlement to Time Off for Recognized Holidays
rule_text: All employees covered by this Agreement shall be entitled to time off for the Recognized Holidays.
summary: All employees covered by this agreement have the right to take recognized holidays off from work.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> PROVIDE(paid_time_off)
reasoning: This rule establishes a fundamental entitlement to time off on specific days, which is a core concept of managing worked and non-worked labor time.

name: Holiday Pay Allowance Calculation
rule_text: The pay allowance as provided for in the appropriate Appendix shall be included in the employees' weekly pay. This pay allowance shall be in lieu of actual pay for any of the Recognized Holidays as specified herein. This pay allowance shall be applied to gross wages for all hours earned including: overtime and shift premium; and also to waiting and reporting time per Article 15.00; daily travel allowance per Article 16.01.
summary: Instead of direct pay for a holiday, employees receive a holiday pay allowance in their weekly check. This allowance is calculated based on their gross wages, which includes all hours earned (regular, overtime, shift premiums), waiting and reporting time, and daily travel allowances.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> PAY(holiday_pay_allowance) WHERE holiday_pay_allowance = rate * (gross_wages + overtime_pay + shift_premium + waiting_time_pay + reporting_time_pay + daily_travel_allowance)
reasoning: This rule defines the calculation method for holiday pay, which is a core component of how labor time is compensated.

name: 4x10 Daily Time Categorization
rule_text:
| 4 x 10's Schedule   | 4 x 10's Schedule        | 4 x 10's Schedule        | 4 x 10's Schedule        | 4 x 10's Schedule        | 4 x 10's Schedule        | 4 x 10's Schedule        | 4 x 10's Schedule        | 4 x 10's Schedule        |
|---------------------|--------------------------|--------------------------|--------------------------|--------------------------|--------------------------|--------------------------|--------------------------|--------------------------|
| Time                | Overtime Break is 15-min | Overtime Break is 15-min | Overtime Break is 15-min | Overtime Break is 15-min | Overtime Break is 30-min | Overtime Break is 30-min | Overtime Break is 30-min | Overtime Break is 30-min |
| on Site             | ST                       | OT                       | DT                       | Meal ST                  | ST                       | OT                       | DT                       | Meal ST                  |
| 10                  | 10                       | N/A                      | N/A                      | N/A                      | 10                       | N/A                      | N/A                      | N/A                      |
| 11                  | 10                       | N/A                      | 1                        | 0.5                      | 10                       | N/A                      | 1                        | N/A                      |
| 12                  | 10                       | N/A                      | 2                        | 0.5                      | 10                       | N/A                      | 2                        | N/A                      |
| 13                  | 10                       | N/A                      | 3                        | 0.5                      | 10                       | N/A                      | 3                        | N/A                      |
summary: On a 4x10 schedule, the first 10 hours are paid at straight time. All hours worked beyond 10 hours per day are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the threshold for transitioning from straight time to double time based on daily hours worked on a specific schedule.

name: 4x10 Paid Meal on Overtime (15-min break schedule)
summary: On a 4x10 schedule variant where the overtime break is 15 minutes, employees who work 11 or more hours receive a paid meal break of 0.5 hours at straight time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND overtime_break_duration (llm) == 15 AND daily_hours >= 11 -> PAY(0.5_HOURS_ST_FOR_MEAL)
reasoning: This rule defines the condition and entitlement for a paid meal period, which is a meal allowance rule.

name: List of Recognized Holidays
rule_text:
The following Recognized Holidays are observed by this Agreement:

| New Year's Day   | Family Day                                |
|------------------|-------------------------------------------|
| Good Friday      | Victoria Day                              |
| Canada Day       | Civic Day                                 |
| Labour Day       | National Day for Truth and Reconciliation |
| Thanksgiving Day | Remembrance Day                           |
| Christmas Day    | Boxing Day                                |

And any other Holiday(s) that may be proclaimed by Federal or Provincial Governments during the life of this Agreement.
summary: The agreement recognizes twelve specific holidays: New Year's Day, Family Day, Good Friday, Victoria Day, Canada Day, Civic Day, Labour Day, National Day for Truth and Reconciliation, Thanksgiving Day, Remembrance Day, Christmas Day, and Boxing Day. It also includes any other holidays officially proclaimed by federal or provincial governments.
logical_representation: SET is_stat_holiday = true FOR ('NEW_YEARS_DAY', 'FAMILY_DAY', 'GOOD_FRIDAY', 'VICTORIA_DAY', 'CANADA_DAY', 'CIVIC_DAY', 'LABOUR_DAY', 'NATIONAL_DAY_FOR_TRUTH_AND_RECONCILIATION', 'THANKSGIVING_DAY', 'REMEMBRANCE_DAY', 'CHRISTMAS_DAY', 'BOXING_DAY') OR any_proclaimed_holiday
reasoning: This rule defines which days are considered statutory holidays, a critical input for applying special pay rules for worked time.

name: Pay Rate for Working on a Recognized Holiday
rule_text: Employees working on a Recognized Holiday shall be paid an overtime rate at double (2) time the regular rate of pay.
summary: If an employee works on a recognized holiday, they will be paid at double their regular rate of pay for all hours worked.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule sets the pay premium for hours worked on a specific type of day (a holiday), which is a core worked time rule.

name: Weekend Holiday Observance (General Rule)
rule_text: Should any of the above listed holidays (Article 14.02) occur on a Saturday or Sunday, such  holiday  shall  be  observed  on  the  preceding  Friday  or  on  the  Monday  following  unless changed by mutual agreement between the Employer and the Local Lodge Representative.
summary: If a recognized holiday falls on a Saturday or Sunday, it will generally be observed on the preceding Friday or the following Monday, unless a different day is mutually agreed upon.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true AND (day_of_week == 'SAT' OR day_of_week == 'SUN') -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('PREVIOUS_FRI') OR OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('FOLLOWING_MON') UNLESS agreement_to_change
reasoning: This rule determines the actual date a holiday is observed, which directly impacts which day receives holiday pay premiums, a key aspect of managing worked time.

name: 4x10 Weekly Straight Time Maximum in a Holiday Week
rule_text: When the four (4) ten (10) hour day option is being worked and a Holiday falls during the normal work week the maximum of thirty (30) hours per week shall form the basis of maximum straight time.
summary: For employees on a 4x10 schedule, if a recognized holiday falls within their normal work week, the weekly straight-time limit is reduced to 30 hours, after which overtime rates apply.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND is_stat_holiday_in_work_week == true -> SET weekly_overtime_threshold = 30
reasoning: This rule modifies the weekly overtime threshold based on the presence of a holiday, directly impacting how worked hours are categorized and paid.

name: 5x8 Holiday Observance
rule_text: When working the five (5) x eight (8) hour work week and the recognized holiday falls in the  work  week the holiday is observed on the day it falls.  If the holiday falls  on Saturday or Sunday, it is moved to the preceding Friday or the following Monday.
summary: On a 5x8 schedule, a holiday is observed on the day it actually falls. If it falls on a Saturday or Sunday, it is observed on the preceding Friday or the following Monday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND is_stat_holiday == true AND day_of_week IN ('MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI') -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY(day_of_week). IF schedule_type == '5x8' AND is_stat_holiday == true AND day_of_week IN ('SAT', 'SUN') -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('PREVIOUS_FRI') OR OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('FOLLOWING_MON')
reasoning: This rule defines the specific day on which holiday pay rules apply for a 5x8 schedule, impacting labor cost calculation.

name: 4x10 Holiday Observance (Weekday)
rule_text: When working the four (4) x ten (10) hour work week and the recognized holiday falls in the work week it will be observed on the day it falls.
summary: On a 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on a normal workday for that schedule, it is observed on that actual day.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10' AND is_stat_holiday == true AND is_day_in_work_week == true -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY(current_day)
reasoning: This rule specifies the observation day for a holiday, which is crucial for applying the correct pay rates for worked time.

name: 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Friday Holiday Observance
rule_text: When working  the  four  (4)  x  ten  (10)  hour  work  week  Monday  to  Thursday  and  the recognized holiday falls on the Friday it will be moved to the preceding Thursday. Thursday is the double time day and Friday is the time and one-half day.
summary: For employees on a Monday-Thursday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on Friday, the holiday is observed on the preceding Thursday. For that week, any hours worked on Thursday are paid at double time, and any hours worked on Friday are paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND is_stat_holiday_on_friday == true -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('THU'). SET PAY_RATE('THU') = PREMIUM(2.0). SET PAY_RATE('FRI') = PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule re-assigns the holiday and sets specific premium pay rates for two different days of the week, directly governing labor pay calculation.

name: 4x10 Mon-Thu Schedule, Weekend Holiday Observance
rule_text: If the holiday falls on Saturday or Sunday, it is moved to the following Monday.
summary: For employees on a Monday-Thursday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on a Saturday or Sunday, it is observed on the following Monday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_mon-thu' AND is_stat_holiday == true AND day_of_week IN ('SAT', 'SUN') -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('FOLLOWING_MON')
reasoning: This rule determines the specific observation day for a holiday based on schedule and day of the week, which is essential for applying correct pay rates.

name: 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Monday Holiday Observance
rule_text: When working the four (4) x ten (10) hour work week Tuesday to Friday and the holiday falls  on  the  Monday  it  is  observed  on  the  Tuesday.
summary: For employees on a Tuesday-Friday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on Monday, it is observed on Tuesday instead.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' AND is_stat_holiday_on_monday == true -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('TUE')
reasoning: This rule shifts the holiday observance day based on the work schedule, directly affecting pay calculations for that day.

name: 4x10 Tue-Fri Schedule, Weekend Holiday Observance
rule_text: If it falls on Saturday or Sunday, it is observed on the preceding Friday or on the following Tuesday.
summary: For employees on a Tuesday-Friday 4x10 schedule, if a holiday falls on a weekend, it is observed on either the preceding Friday or the following Tuesday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '4x10_tue-fri' AND is_stat_holiday == true AND day_of_week IN ('SAT', 'SUN') -> OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('PREVIOUS_FRI') OR OBSERVE_HOLIDAY('FOLLOWING_TUE')
reasoning: The rule provides options for observing a holiday, which determines which day gets holiday pay treatment, impacting worked time calculations.

name: Employer Obligation to Post Holiday Observance Date
rule_text: Employers  will  post  the  date  to  be  observed  no  later  than  seven  (7)  days  prior  to  the holiday.
summary: The employer is required to post a notice indicating the specific date a holiday will be observed at least seven days in advance.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: Employer must PROVIDE(notice_of_holiday_observance) WHERE notice_period_days (llm) >= 7
reasoning: While administrative, this rule is a precondition for the application of holiday pay rules, ensuring clarity on which day is affected, and is thus most closely related to worked time management.

name: Exception for Harmonized Holiday Observance
rule_text: In  order  to  harmonize  (Client,  multi-Employer)  observance  on  maintenance  sites  the Employer may make a request to the Local Lodge within fourteen (14) days of the holiday to establish another day to be observed other than those noted above.
summary: On maintenance sites, to align with clients or other employers, the Employer can request to change the observed holiday date by submitting a request to the Union at least 14 days before the holiday.
logical_representation: IF site_type (llm) == 'MAINTENANCE' -> Employer MAY REQUEST_CHANGE(holiday_observance) WITH union_agreement IF notice_period_days (llm) >= 14
reasoning: This rule provides a mechanism to alter the date a holiday is observed, which directly affects which day is subject to holiday pay rules, making it a worked time rule.

name: Waiting Time Pay - First Two Days
rule_text: When an employee, on initial hire or transfer to a project, is instructed by the Employer to report to a job location on a certain day but is not placed to work until a later date, they shall be  entitled  to  two  (2)  hours  pay...for  each  of  the  first  two  (2) regular working days they are kept waiting.
summary: Upon initial hire or transfer, if an employee is told to report to a job but is not put to work, they receive 2 hours of pay for each of the first two regular working days they are kept waiting.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_day_count <= 2 -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment for non-productive waiting time, which is a form of labor compensation and falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Waiting Time Pay - After Two Days
rule_text: Thereafter the waiting pay shall be increased to a full day of pay (i.e. eight (8) hours) for each regular working day. This waiting pay shall continue until the employee is given work or released from the job...
summary: If an employee on initial hire or transfer is kept waiting for work for more than two regular working days, their waiting pay increases to a full 8 hours for each subsequent waiting day until they start work or are released.
logical_representation: IF (employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status == 'TRANSFER') AND waiting_day_count > 2 -> PAY(8_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule defines the amount of pay for a specific non-productive time scenario (extended waiting), which is a core component of labor time compensation.

name: Reporting Pay - Inclement Weather, No Work Started
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and cannot work because of inclement weather they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and the employee must remain on the job for the two (2) hour period, unless otherwise instructed by the Employer's supervisor.
summary: If an employee reports to work but cannot start due to bad weather, they receive 2 hours of reporting pay. They must stay on the job for these two hours unless told otherwise by a supervisor.
logical_representation: IF work_commenced == false AND reason_for_no_work == 'INCLEMENT_WEATHER' -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule specifies a minimum payment for reporting to work even if no work is performed, categorizing it as a rule for compensating an employee's time and availability.

name: Minimum Pay - Inclement Weather, Work Started
rule_text: When an employee has commenced work and is instructed to stop due to inclement weather, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall an employee receive less than two (2) hours of pay.
summary: If an employee starts work and is then stopped due to bad weather, they are paid for the hours they actually worked, with a guaranteed minimum of 2 hours' pay for the day.
logical_representation: IF work_commenced == true AND reason_for_work_stoppage == 'INCLEMENT_WEATHER' -> PAY(MAX(daily_hours, 2))
reasoning: This rule sets a minimum pay guarantee for a workday shortened by a specific event (weather), which is a fundamental aspect of worked time calculation.

name: Reporting Pay - Work Not Available
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and is not given the opportunity to work because none is available or was not advised before the completion of the previous day of work, they shall be paid two (2) hours of reporting time and allowed to leave the job immediately.
summary: If an employee reports to work as scheduled and there is no work for them, and they were not told the previous day not to come in, they receive 2 hours of reporting pay and can leave immediately.
logical_representation: IF work_available == false AND prior_notice_given == false -> PAY(2_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule guarantees payment for an employee's time and effort in reporting to a worksite, which is a form of compensation for labor time.

name: Minimum Pay - General Work Stoppage
rule_text: When an employee has started to work on their regular shift and is instructed to stop, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall the employee receive less than two (2) hours of pay.
summary: If an employee starts their regular shift and is later told to stop working by the employer, they will be paid for the time they worked, with a minimum guarantee of 2 hours' pay.
logical_representation: IF work_commenced == true AND work_stopped_by_employer == true -> PAY(MAX(daily_hours, 2))
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum pay guarantee for any day where work is started but not completed at the employer's direction, making it a rule about how worked time is compensated.

name: Forfeiture of Minimum Pay on Voluntary Stop
rule_text: If an employee stops work for reasons of their own, and without the approval of the Employer, they shall be entitled to pay only for the hours actually worked in the day and minimum conditions shall not apply.
summary: If an employee chooses to stop working on their own without the employer's permission, they will only be paid for the hours they actually worked and will not receive any minimum reporting or daily pay.
logical_representation: IF voluntary_work_stoppage == true -> FORFEIT(MINIMUM_PAY) AND PAY(daily_hours)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition under which minimum pay guarantees are forfeited. This directly impacts the calculation of daily pay, classifying it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Subsistence for Waiting or Reporting Time
rule_text: An employee who is affected by the Conditions set out above shall be entitled to subsistence in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.
summary: An employee who qualifies for waiting or reporting time pay is also entitled to receive subsistence pay as defined elsewhere in the agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_eligible_for_waiting_time == true OR is_eligible_for_reporting_time == true -> ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: This rule explicitly grants a subsistence allowance based on waiting or reporting time conditions, making its primary topic LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Shift Premium on Waiting and Reporting Time
rule_text: When an employee qualifies for reporting or waiting time, such time shall include the regular shift premium when applicable.
summary: If an employee is entitled to waiting or reporting time pay, that pay will also include any applicable shift premium they would have normally received.
logical_representation: IF is_eligible_for_waiting_time == true OR is_eligible_for_reporting_time == true -> APPLY_PREMIUM(SHIFT_PREMIUM)
reasoning: This rule modifies the rate of pay for waiting or reporting hours by adding a premium, which is a core function of labor time and pay calculation.

name: Reporting Pay Exception - 8-Hour Notice
rule_text: When an employee is notified eight (8) hours prior to the commencement of the scheduled starting time not to report for work, then such employee will not be entitled to any reporting time.
summary: An employee is not eligible for reporting pay if the employer gives them at least 8 hours' notice before their shift starts not to come to work.
logical_representation: IF notice_period_hours >= 8 -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule provides a specific condition (sufficient notice) under which the entitlement to reporting pay is nullified, making it a rule governing labor time compensation.

name: Reporting Pay Exception - 1-Hour Notice on Camp Jobs
rule_text: On camp jobs, the notice time may be reduced to one (1) hour prior to starting time.
summary: For employees on camp jobs, the required notice from the employer to cancel a shift without paying reporting time is reduced from 8 hours to just 1 hour.
logical_representation: IF project_location == 'CAMP_JOB' AND notice_period_hours >= 1 -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule is a location-based modification of the conditions for reporting pay entitlement, directly affecting how labor time is compensated.

name: Layoff Option for Frequent Cancellations
rule_text: If this occurs more than twice in any one week, Monday through Friday, then the employee shall, at their option, be entitled to a layoff, however, this does not pertain to the normal Christmas break (i.e. two (2) weeks).
summary: If an employee is told not to report to work more than twice in a single week (Monday to Friday), they have the option to accept a layoff. This rule does not apply during the two-week Christmas break.
logical_representation: IF notice_not_to_work_count_weekly > 2 AND is_christmas_break == false -> ENTITLEMENT(LAYOFF_OPTION)
reasoning: This rule provides an entitlement related to work availability and continuity. While not a direct pay rule, it governs the employment state based on patterns of scheduled time, thus falling under the broader category of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Reporting Pay Exception - Strike or Work Stoppage
rule_text: When an employee is unable to report for work due to a strike or work stoppage on the project where they are employed, such employee will not be entitled to any reporting time.
summary: If an employee cannot work because of a strike or work stoppage at their job site, they are not entitled to receive reporting pay.
logical_representation: IF reason_for_no_work == 'STRIKE_OR_WORK_STOPPAGE' -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule outlines a specific circumstance (strike) that negates the reporting pay entitlement, thereby defining the boundaries of this labor time compensation.

name: Compensation for Work-Related Accident
rule_text: If an employee meets with an accident during working hours and available medical advice or proper medical considerations deem it unsafe for them to continue work, they shall be paid those amounts as compensation as prescribed in the Workers' Compensation Act and shall also receive any other applicable daily allowances until such time that the employee is no longer in Employer's care.
summary: If an employee has a work-related accident and cannot continue working for medical reasons, they will receive compensation as determined by the Workers' Compensation Act, plus any other daily allowances, until they are no longer in the employer's care.
logical_representation: IF is_workplace_accident == true AND is_medically_unfit_to_work == true -> PAY(WCB_COMPENSATION) AND ALLOWANCE(DAILY_ALLOWANCES)
reasoning: This rule specifies the compensation process for time lost due to a workplace injury, which is directly related to how an employee is paid for their scheduled or interrupted work time.

name: Pay for Remainder of Shift - Non-Lost-Time Accident
rule_text: If it is not a lost time accident covered by Workers' Compensation, they shall also be paid for the remaining unworked normal daily hours for that day (e.g. eight (8) hours, or in case of a compressed work day ten (10) hours) at the applicable rate.
summary: If a workplace accident is not a 'lost time' incident under Workers' Compensation, the injured employee will be paid for the rest of their normal shift for that day (e.g., the remaining hours of an 8 or 10-hour day).
logical_representation: IF is_workplace_accident == true AND is_lost_time_accident == false -> PAY(REMAINING_SHIFT_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule guarantees full pay for a scheduled shift interrupted by a minor injury, making it a rule about the calculation and guarantee of daily worked time compensation.

name: Pay for Camp Room Move
rule_text: Should an employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the Clients' designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they are to do it during work hours and will be paid at appropriate rates or the employee shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate to carry out the move, if done outside work hours.
summary: If an employee in camp is asked to move rooms, the move should happen during paid work hours. If the move is done outside of regular work hours, the employee will be paid for 2 hours at their straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF project_location == 'CAMP_JOB' AND camp_move_timing == 'OUTSIDE_WORK_HOURS' -> PAY(2_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines payment for a specific, employer-directed activity (moving rooms), treating it as compensable work time. Therefore, it falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Exception to Camp Room Move Pay
