rule_text: This provision will not apply where employees are required to pack their room at the end of a work cycle or to facilitate a move that will occur during the employees furlough.
summary: Employees will not be paid for moving rooms if the move is part of the normal packing process at the end of a work cycle or if the move happens while they are on furlough.
logical_representation: IF project_location == 'CAMP_JOB' AND (reason_for_camp_move == 'END_OF_CYCLE' OR reason_for_camp_move == 'DURING_FURLOUGH') -> FORFEIT(CAMP_MOVE_PAY)
reasoning: This rule specifies conditions under which the camp move payment is forfeited. As it directly relates to a pay entitlement for a work-related activity, it is classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Transportation for Camp Move
rule_text: Transportation will be supplied if required.
summary: If an employee is required to move camps, transportation will be provided by the employer if needed.
logical_representation: IF project_location == 'CAMP_JOB' AND is_transportation_required == true -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION)
reasoning: This rule provides a non-monetary benefit related to a work requirement (moving camps). While not a direct pay rule, it's a condition of employment related to work activities, placing it within the scope of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Daily Travel - Employer Provided Transportation
rule_text: On those projects that are located between forty-five (45) radius kilometers to one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from Edmonton and/or Calgary City Hall(s) or other Hiring Hall locations, the Employer shall supply suitable transportation to and from the project and mutually agreed to pick-up points.
summary: The employer must provide transportation for projects located between 45 and 120 radius kilometers from a city hall or hiring hall.
logical_representation: IF (project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 120) OR (project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 45 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) <= 120) -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION)
reasoning: The rule describes an entitlement for employer-provided transportation based on project distance, which is a form of travel allowance and is therefore categorized under LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Daily Travel - Kilometer Allowance
rule_text: Alternatively, the Employer shall pay to each employee a transportation cost at the rate of sixty-nine cents ($0.69) per road kilometer for each day worked or reported for work, from the edge of the forty-five (45) radius kilometer free zone to the project and return.
summary: As an alternative to providing transportation, the employer can pay a daily travel allowance of $0.69 per kilometer for the distance from the 45km free zone to the project and back for projects between 45 and 120 km from a designated center.
logical_representation: IF ((project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 120) OR (project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 45 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) <= 120)) AND transportation_provided (llm) == false -> PAY(0.69 * road_kilometers_from_free_zone_return (llm))
reasoning: This rule specifies a monetary allowance for travel, which is a core component of subsistence and travel-related entitlements, thus fitting into the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Subsistence or Camp Eligibility
rule_text: Subsistence will be paid or camp provided on projects which are more than one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from the City Hall(s) of Edmonton and Calgary or other Hiring Hall locations.
summary: For projects over 120 radius kilometers from a city hall or hiring hall, the employer must either pay a subsistence allowance or provide a camp.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 120 OR project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 120 -> ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE) OR PROVIDE(CAMP)
reasoning: This rule establishes the primary distance-based condition for subsistence eligibility, which is the definition of the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Standard Subsistence Daily Rate
rule_text: Subsistence will be paid at a rate of one hundred and fifty dollars ($150.00) per day worked or reported for.
summary: The standard daily subsistence rate is $150.00, paid for each day an employee works or reports for work.
logical_representation: IF is_eligible_for_subsistence (llm) == true AND is_location_specific_rate (llm) == false -> ALLOWANCE($150.00)
reasoning: The rule defines a specific monetary amount for a subsistence allowance, directly fitting the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Location-Specific Subsistence Daily Rates
summary: In certain specified locations, a different daily subsistence rate applies, overriding the standard $150.00 rate. Rates range from $125 to $205 depending on the area.
logical_representation: IF is_eligible_for_subsistence (llm) == true -> LOOKUP(project_location (Unsupported), {'Athabasca': 170.00, 'Bonnyville': 180.00, 'Calgary': 180.00, 'Camrose': 185.00, 'Caroline': 125.00, 'Canmore/Exshaw': 195.00, 'Cold Lake': 165.00, 'Drumheller': 180.00, 'Edmonton': 180.00, 'Edson': 175.00, 'Forestburg': 130.00, 'Fox Creek': 170.00, 'Fort McMurray': 200.00, 'Grande Cache': 160.00, 'Grande Prairie': 205.00, 'Hanna': 185.00, 'Hardisty/Wainwright': 170.00, 'High Level': 185.00, 'Hinton': 160.00, 'Lethbridge': 185.00, 'Lloydminster': 180.00, 'Medicine Hat': 170.00, 'Peace River': 185.00, 'Pincher Creek/Waterton': 160.00, 'Red Deer': 165.00, 'Rocky Mountain House': 190.00, 'Stettler': 190.00, 'Swan Hills': 150.00, 'Valley View': 165.00, 'Vermillion': 180.00, 'Wabasca': 200.00, 'Whitecourt': 155.00}) -> ALLOWANCE(lookup_result)
reasoning: This rule provides a list of exceptions and specific monetary amounts for subsistence allowances based on geography, which is a key aspect of defining subsistence entitlements.

name: Seven-Day Subsistence for Remote Projects
rule_text: On sites which are four hundred and seventy-five (475) radius kilometers plus as noted above, subsistence will be paid on a seven (7) day per week basis.
summary: For projects located 475 radius kilometers or more from a designated center, subsistence is paid for all seven days of the week, not just days worked.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) >= 475 OR project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) >= 475 -> PAY_FREQUENCY(SUBSISTENCE, '7_DAYS_PER_WEEK')
reasoning: This rule modifies the payment frequency of the subsistence allowance based on project distance, which is a core component of the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Subsistence Forfeiture and Waiver for Absenteeism
rule_text: Forfeiture of subsistence allowance due to absenteeism may be waived if the reason for absence is acceptable to the Employer.
summary: An employee will lose their subsistence allowance if they are absent, but this forfeiture can be waived if the employer accepts the reason for the absence.
logical_representation: IF is_absent (llm) == true AND employer_accepts_reason (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(SUBSISTENCE); IF is_absent (llm) == true AND employer_accepts_reason (llm) == true -> WAIVE(FORFEITURE)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition (absenteeism) under which the subsistence allowance is forfeited or retained, a critical part of the rules governing the entitlement.

name: Additional Subsistence Day for Travel
rule_text: On a subsistence project, employees not residing in the area where the project is located will be eligible to receive one additional day of subsistence for either the day before commencing work or the day after completing the work assignment, where the project is greater than two hundred (200) road kilometers from the City Hall(s) of Edmonton and Calgary, or other Hiring Hall locations. This payment will be made for the preceding or succeeding day where substantiated by verifiable proof that accommodation was used (e.g., receipt or registration verification).
summary: Non-local employees on projects more than 200 road kilometers away can receive one extra day of subsistence for a travel day, either before starting or after finishing the job, provided they show proof of accommodation.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == false AND (project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 200 OR project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 200) AND claim_type (Unsupported) == 'RECEIPT_PROVIDED' -> ALLOWANCE(1_ADDITIONAL_DAY_SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: This rule provides for an additional subsistence payment under specific travel and documentation conditions, making it a clear LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE rule.

name: Initial and Terminal Travel Allowance Tiers (Effective June 1, 2025)
rule_text:
Effective June 1, 2025 (second Sunday following ratification), there is a scheduled increase to initial and terminal travel which will be paid as follows from the above:

| One Hundred and Twenty (120) - Two Hundred (200) Radius Kilometers                           | $   | One Hundred and Sixteen ($116.00) each way,      |
|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----|--------------------------------------------------|
| Two Hundred (200) - Three Hundred (300) Radius Kilometers                                    | $   | One Hundred and Sixty-Six ($166.00) each way,    |
| Three Hundred (300) - Three Hundred and Seventy-Five (375) Radius Kilometers                 | $   | Two Hundred ($200.00) each way,                  |
| Three Hundred and Seventy-Five (375) - Four Hundred and Seventy-Five (475) Radius Kilometers | $   | Two Hundred and Ninety-Seven ($297.00) each way, |
summary: Effective June 1, 2025, employees will receive a tiered initial and terminal travel allowance based on the project's radius distance, ranging from $116 to $297 each way.
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2025-06-01' -> IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) >= 120 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) < 200 -> PAY(116.00); IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) >= 200 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) < 300 -> PAY(166.00); IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) >= 300 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) < 375 -> PAY(200.00); IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) >= 375 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) < 475 -> PAY(297.00)
reasoning: This rule defines specific monetary travel allowances based on distance, which is a key component of the broader subsistence and travel topic.

name: Travel Allowance - Airfare Alternative
rule_text: or actual airfare if suitable proof of air transport is provided to the Employer.
summary: As an alternative to the set travel allowance amounts, an employee can be reimbursed for the actual cost of their airfare if they provide proof of air travel.
logical_representation: IF travel_mode (llm) == 'AIR' AND claim_type (Unsupported) == 'RECEIPT_PROVIDED' -> PAY(ACTUAL_AIRFARE)
reasoning: This specifies an alternative form of reimbursement for travel costs, which is directly related to the subsistence and travel allowance topic.

name: Fort McMurray Initial and Terminal Travel Allowance
rule_text: Initial and Terminal travel for any project which falls within one- hundred (100) radius kilometers of Ft. McMurray city hall will be two hundred and ninety-seven dollars ($297.00).
summary: For projects within a 100km radius of Fort McMurray City Hall, the initial and terminal travel allowance is a flat $297.00.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'FT_MCMURRAY_AREA' AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) < 100 -> PAY(297.00)
reasoning: This is a location-specific monetary travel allowance, fitting under the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Travel Allowance Forfeiture - Client Provided Transport
rule_text: No travel shall be payable under this Article if the Client provides transportation to the work site and return.
summary: If the client provides transportation to and from the worksite, no travel allowance will be paid to the employee.
logical_representation: IF client_provides_transport (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(TRAVEL_ALLOWANCE)
reasoning: This rule outlines a condition for the forfeiture of a travel allowance, which is an integral part of defining the entitlement.

name: Initial and Terminal Travel for Very Remote Projects (>475km)
rule_text: On jobs beyond the four hundred and seventy-five (475) radius kilometers initial and terminal travel amounts will be mutually agreed between the Local Lodge and the Employer to a maximum of four hundred and fifty-five dollars ($455.00) each way or airfare if suitable proof of air transport is provided to the Employer.
summary: For projects more than 475km away, initial and terminal travel will be a mutually agreed amount up to $455.00 each way, or the actual cost of airfare with proof.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 OR project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 475 -> PAY(MUTUALLY_AGREED_AMOUNT, MAX(455.00)) OR PAY(ACTUAL_AIRFARE)
reasoning: This rule defines the travel allowance for exceptionally distant projects, a key part of the subsistence and travel framework.

name: Payment Timing for Initial and Terminal Travel
rule_text: Initial travel amounts will be paid after fifteen (15) calendar days on the job or at lay- off. Terminal travel will be paid at lay-off.
summary: The initial travel allowance is paid after 15 calendar days of work or at layoff, whichever comes first. The terminal travel allowance is paid at layoff.
logical_representation: IF days_on_job (llm) >= 15 OR employee_status (Unsupported) == 'LAID_OFF' -> TRIGGER_PAYMENT(INITIAL_TRAVEL_ALLOWANCE); IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'LAID_OFF' -> TRIGGER_PAYMENT(TERMINAL_TRAVEL_ALLOWANCE)
reasoning: This rule governs the conditions and timing of payment for travel allowances, which is an administrative but crucial aspect of the entitlement.

name: Travel Allowance Forfeiture upon Quit or Termination
rule_text: Employees who quit or are terminated for cause prior to the entitlement payment of either initial or terminal amounts are not entitled to any travel payments outstanding.
summary: If an employee quits or is fired for cause before their travel allowances are due to be paid, they forfeit any outstanding travel payments.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED_FOR_CAUSE' OR employee_status (Unsupported) == 'QUIT' -> FORFEIT(OUTSTANDING_TRAVEL_PAYMENTS)
reasoning: This rule specifies conditions related to employment status that lead to the forfeiture of the travel allowance, defining the limits of the entitlement.

name: Subsistence Eligibility Documentation Requirement
rule_text:
To qualify for the subsistence allowance under Article 16.01, the member, will supply two (2) of the following documents as verification of their name and current address. It is understood that the Employer will ensure any copies of such documents will be handled in accordance with PIPA regulations.
- Any government issued identification
- Utility Bill
- Bank Statement
- Vehicle Registration
- Housing Rental Agreement
- Mortgage Documentation
- Land Title
- Credit Card Statement
- Income Tax Assessment
- Property Tax Assessment
- Employment Insurance
summary: To be eligible for subsistence allowance, an employee must provide two specific forms of documentation from a provided list to verify their name and current address.
logical_representation: IF documentation_provided (llm) < 2_VALID_DOCS -> INELIGIBLE(SUBSISTENCE)
reasoning: This rule sets a non-monetary condition (documentation) for receiving the subsistence allowance, which is a fundamental part of the entitlement's rules.

name: Local Resident Entitlements on Subsistence Projects
rule_text: On a subsistence project, employees residing in the area where the project is located will not be eligible for Accommodation Allowance and initial/terminal travel but will receive daily travel payments pursuant to Article 16.01 (a) if they reside outside a forty-five (45) radius kilometer free zone around the project.
summary: On a subsistence project, local residents do not get subsistence or initial/terminal travel pay. However, they do receive daily travel pay if they live more than 45km from the project site.
logical_representation: IF project_is_subsistence (llm) == true AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true -> FORFEIT(SUBSISTENCE) AND FORFEIT(INITIAL_TERMINAL_TRAVEL); IF project_is_subsistence (llm) == true AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND employee_residence_distance_from_project (llm) > 45 -> ELIGIBLE(DAILY_TRAVEL_AS_PER_16.01a)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific allowances available or unavailable to a certain class of employee (local residents) on a subsistence project, making it a core subsistence rule.

name: Daily Travel for Non-Local Employees on Subsistence Projects
rule_text: On a subsistence project, employees domiciled outside a forty-five (45) radius kilometer zone around the job will be provided transportation to and from the job or paid sixty-nine cents ($0.69) per road kilometer for each day worked or reported for work, from the edge of the free zone to the temporary domicile and return.
summary: On a subsistence project, non-local employees living in temporary housing more than 45km from the job site will either be given transportation or paid $0.69/km for daily travel between their temporary residence and the site.
logical_representation: IF project_is_subsistence (llm) == true AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == false AND employee_temp_domicile_distance_from_project (llm) > 45 -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION) OR PAY(0.69 * road_kilometers_from_free_zone_return (llm))
reasoning: This rule covers daily travel entitlements for non-local employees already receiving subsistence, which is an extension of the subsistence and travel allowance framework.

name: Fort McMurray Daily Transportation on Subsistence Projects
rule_text: In Ft. McMurray, subsistence employees will be provided transportation to and from the job site as per current arrangements under the Agreement.
summary: In Fort McMurray, employees receiving subsistence will be provided with transportation to and from the job site according to existing arrangements.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'FT_MCMURRAY' AND project_is_subsistence (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(TRANSPORTATION)
reasoning: This is a location-specific rule about transportation provided in conjunction with subsistence, placing it within the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Pay Frequency and Day
rule_text: Employees shall be paid weekly during working hours, not later than Thursday.
summary: Employees are paid weekly, on or before Thursday, during their working hours.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(PAY_FREQUENCY('WEEKLY') AND PAY_DAY <= 'THU')
reasoning: This rule establishes the fundamental frequency and timing of employee payment, which is a core component of labor compensation.

name: Pay Holdback Limit
rule_text: In no case shall more than five (5) regular working days be held back in any one payroll period.
summary: The employer cannot hold back more than five regular working days of pay in any payroll period.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(pay_holdback_days (llm) <= 5)
reasoning: This rule sets a maximum limit on the time between work performed and payment, directly governing the payment process.

name: Final Pay Entitlement on Layoff or Discharge
rule_text: Employees who are laid off or discharged from the service of the Employer shall receive their wages and all monies owing and their Employment Insurance Contribution Certificate.
summary: Upon layoff or discharge, employees are entitled to receive all wages and money owed, along with their Employment Insurance documents.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] -> PROVIDE(FINAL_PAY, EI_CERTIFICATE)
reasoning: This rule defines the payment obligations of the employer upon termination of employment, which is a specific case of labor compensation rules.

name: Termination Slip Information Requirement
rule_text: the employee shall receive an Employer termination slip which shall show either their net pay and deductions, or the basic factors from which their pay will be calculated including: total pay hours, travel allowance and transportation allowances, subsistence, etc.
summary: Laid off or discharged employees must receive a termination slip detailing either their net pay and deductions or the factors used to calculate it, such as hours and allowances.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] -> PROVIDE(TERMINATION_SLIP_WITH_PAY_DETAILS)
reasoning: This rule specifies the documentation and transparency required for final pay calculations, which is an administrative aspect of labor compensation.

name: Final Pay Method on Termination
rule_text: Pay shall be by direct deposit.
summary: When an employee is laid off or discharged, their final pay must be issued via direct deposit.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] -> CONSTRAINT(PAYMENT_METHOD('DIRECT_DEPOSIT'))
reasoning: This rule defines the method of payment for terminated employees, a procedural part of the labor compensation process.

name: Final Pay and ROE Deadline on Layoff or Discharge
rule_text: and the Employer shall direct deposit monies owing and file electronically the Record of Employment by the next regular scheduled pay period for the pay period in question, exclusive of Saturday, Sunday, and Recognized Holidays.
summary: For laid off or discharged employees, the employer must issue final pay and the Record of Employment by the next regular payday for that pay period, excluding weekends and holidays.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] -> CONSTRAINT(FINAL_PAY_DUE_BY('NEXT_REGULAR_PAYDAY'))
reasoning: This rule sets the deadline for final payment upon termination, a critical timing aspect of labor compensation.

name: Late Final Pay Penalty on Layoff or Discharge
rule_text: Should the Employer fail to comply with this provision (excluding the reference to the Record of Employment), the employee shall receive an additional sum equivalent to eight (8) hours of pay at straight time rates for each day they are kept waiting exclusive of Saturday, Sunday and Statutory Holidays up to a maximum of forty (40) hours of pay.
summary: If an employer is late with the final payment for a laid off or discharged employee, they must pay a penalty of 8 hours of straight-time pay for each waiting day (excluding weekends/holidays), up to a maximum of 40 hours.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) IN ['LAID_OFF', 'DISCHARGED'] AND final_pay_is_late (llm) == true -> PAY(8_HOURS_ST * days_late (llm), MAX=40_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines a financial penalty for failing to meet payment deadlines, which is directly related to labor compensation.

name: Final Pay and ROE Deadline on Quitting
rule_text: When an employee quits of their own volition, the Employer shall direct deposit all monies owing and file electronically the Record of Employment by the next regular scheduled pay period for the pay period in question, exclusive of Saturday, Sunday and Recognized Holidays.
summary: When an employee quits, the employer must issue their final pay and Record of Employment by the next regular payday for that pay period, excluding weekends and holidays.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED' -> CONSTRAINT(FINAL_PAY_DUE_BY('NEXT_REGULAR_PAYDAY'))
reasoning: This rule sets the deadline for final payment for employees who resign, a critical timing aspect of labor compensation.

name: Late Final Pay Penalty on Quitting
rule_text: If the Employer fails to comply with this requirement within five (5) working days after the specified pay day, the employee shall receive an additional sum equivalent to eight (8) hours of pay at straight time rates.
summary: If an employer is more than five working days late with the final pay for an employee who has quit, the employee is entitled to a one-time penalty payment of 8 hours of straight-time pay.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED' AND days_late (llm) > 5 -> PAY(8_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines a financial penalty for failing to meet payment deadlines for employees who quit, which is directly related to labor compensation.

name: Employee Obligation to Report Pay Shortage
rule_text: If on an employee's weekly paycheck, they are shorted pay, the employee is required to notify the Employer immediately in writing.
summary: Employees who are shorted on their paycheck must notify the employer immediately and in writing.
logical_representation: IF pay_is_short (llm) == true -> REQUIRE(EMPLOYEE_WRITTEN_NOTIFICATION)
reasoning: This rule establishes the required process for an employee to initiate a pay correction, which is an administrative rule governing labor compensation.

name: Pay Shortage Correction Deadline
rule_text: The Employer shall provide an adjustment on a subsequent pay date but not later than ten (10) days exclusive of Saturdays, Sundays, and Recognized Holidays after receiving the notification of the shortage in writing.
summary: After receiving a written notice of a pay shortage, the employer must correct the error within 10 days, excluding weekends and holidays.
logical_representation: IF pay_shortage_notified (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(CORRECTION_DUE_DAYS <= 10)
reasoning: This rule sets a deadline for the employer to rectify pay errors, a key timing aspect of ensuring correct labor compensation.

name: Penalty for Late Pay Shortage Correction
rule_text: Should this payment not be made within the allotted ten (10) days, the Employer will pay one hundred dollars ($100.00) per day the employee is kept waiting from the date the notification of shortage was received in writing by the Employer to a maximum of seven hundred dollars ($700.00).
summary: If the employer fails to correct a pay shortage within the 10-day limit, they must pay a penalty of $100 for each day of delay, starting from the original notification date, up to a maximum of $700.
logical_representation: IF days_since_notification (llm) > 10 -> PAY($100 * days_since_notification (llm), MAX=$700)
reasoning: This rule defines a financial penalty for failing to correct pay errors on time, directly related to enforcing labor compensation rules.

name: Bereavement Pay Entitlement
rule_text: For those employees with more than three (3) years of continuous service with one (1) Employer, the employee will be entitled to bereavement pay benefits of eight (8) hours multiplied by the employees' base wage rate for up to three (3) days of lost work incurred as a results of the employee's attendance at a funeral or memorial service upon the death of an employee's Spouse, Child, Parent, Parent -in-Law, Grandparent or Sibling. Bereavement Pay Benefits shall be paid at the straight time rate.
summary: Employees with over 3 years of continuous service are entitled to up to 3 days of bereavement pay (8 hours per day at straight-time rate) for lost work to attend a funeral for a close family member. This service requirement is subject to change in 2026 and 2027.
logical_representation: IF continuous_service_years (llm) > 3 AND bereavement_relationship (llm) IN ['SPOUSE', 'CHILD', 'PARENT', 'PARENT_IN_LAW', 'GRANDPARENT', 'SIBLING'] -> PAY(8_HOURS_ST * lost_work_days (llm), MAX_DAYS=3)
reasoning: This rule establishes an entitlement to paid leave under specific circumstances, defining eligibility and calculation method, which falls under labor compensation rules.

name: Bereavement Service Requirement Change (2026)
rule_text: January 1, 2026, continuous employment transitions to thirty (30) months.
summary: Effective January 1, 2026, the service requirement for bereavement pay is reduced to be greater than 30 months.
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2026-01-01' -> AMEND(bereavement_eligibility, continuous_service_months (llm) > 30)
reasoning: This rule modifies an eligibility condition for a paid leave benefit based on a specific date, representing an update to a labor compensation rule.

name: Bereavement Service Requirement Change (2027)
rule_text: January 1, 2027, continuous employment transitions to twenty-four (24) months.
summary: Effective January 1, 2027, the service requirement for bereavement pay is reduced to be greater than 24 months.
logical_representation: IF validity_start_date >= '2027-01-01' -> AMEND(bereavement_eligibility, continuous_service_months (llm) > 24)
reasoning: This rule modifies an eligibility condition for a paid leave benefit based on a specific date, representing an update to a labor compensation rule.

name: Reporting Time, Inclement Weather
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and cannot work because of inclement weather they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and the employee must remain on the job for the two (2) hour period, unless otherwise instructed by the Employer's supervisor.
summary: If an employee reports to work but cannot start due to bad weather, they receive 2 hours of pay. They must stay on site for those 2 hours unless told otherwise by a supervisor.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'NOT_STARTED' AND cause_of_work_stoppage (llm) == 'INCLEMENT_WEATHER' -> PAY(2_HOURS_ST) AND REQUIRE(REMAIN_ON_SITE(2))
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment guarantee (reporting time) when work is not performed, which falls under the category of how labor time is compensated.

name: Minimum Pay, Work Stopped Due to Inclement Weather
rule_text: When an employee has commenced work and is instructed to stop due to inclement weather, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall an employee receive less than two (2) hours pay.
summary: If work starts but is then stopped because of bad weather, the employee is paid for the hours they actually worked, with a minimum guarantee of 2 hours' pay.
logical_representation: IF work_commenced (Unsupported) == true AND cause_of_work_stoppage (llm) == 'INCLEMENT_WEATHER' -> PAY(MAX(daily_hours, 2))
reasoning: This rule defines the minimum payment an employee is entitled to for a day where work was started but not completed, which is a core component of labor time and pay calculation.

name: Reporting Time, Work Not Available
rule_text: When an employee reports to work and is not given the opportunity to work because none is available or was not advised before the completion of the previous day's work, they shall be paid two (2) hours reporting time and allowed to leave the job immediately.
summary: If an employee reports for duty and there is no work available for them, and they were not notified the previous day, they are entitled to 2 hours of reporting pay and can leave the site immediately.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'NOT_STARTED' AND (cause_of_work_stoppage (llm) == 'WORK_UNAVAILABLE' OR prior_day_notification (llm) == false) -> PAY(2_HOURS_ST) AND ALLOW(LEAVE_IMMEDIATELY)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum payment guarantee (reporting time) when scheduled work is cancelled without proper notice, which falls under how labor time is compensated.

name: Minimum Pay, Work Stopped by Employer
rule_text: When an employee has started to work on their regular shift and is instructed to stop, they shall be paid for the actual time worked. In no case shall the employee receive less than two (2) hours pay.
summary: If an employee starts their shift and is then told to stop working by the employer for any reason, they are paid for the hours they worked, with a minimum guarantee of 2 hours' pay.
logical_representation: IF work_commenced (Unsupported) == true AND cause_of_work_stoppage (llm) == 'EMPLOYER_INSTRUCTION' -> PAY(MAX(daily_hours, 2))
reasoning: This rule defines a general minimum payment for any day where work was started but not completed due to the employer's decision, which is a core component of labor time and pay calculation.

name: Pay Forfeiture, Employee Stops Work
rule_text: If an employee stops work for reasons of their own, and without the approval of the Employer, they shall be entitled to pay only for the hours actually worked in the day and minimum conditions shall not apply.
summary: If an employee decides to stop working on their own without the employer's permission, they are only paid for the hours they actually worked and are not eligible for any minimum pay guarantees.
logical_representation: IF cause_of_work_stoppage (llm) == 'EMPLOYEE_DECISION' AND employer_approval (llm) == false -> PAY(daily_hours) AND FORFEIT(MINIMUM_PAY_GUARANTEE)
reasoning: This rule defines a condition under which standard pay guarantees are forfeited. It's an exception to the normal calculation of worked time and pay, thus belonging to LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Subsistence Reimbursement Receipt Requirements
rule_text:
The following information must appear on all receipts:

1. Date
2. Name of Establishment and Name of Contact Person if appropriate (see examples below) ABC Motel -Company letterhead receipt -Name of Contact Person not required B & B or Relative (non-registered) -Name of Contact Person required
3. Complete Address and Phone Number of the Establishment
4. Employee's Full Name
5. Reason/Description of Cost (including dates)
6. Total Cost
summary: To receive subsistence reimbursement, a receipt must contain specific information: the date, establishment name, its full address and phone number, the employee's full name, a description of the cost including dates, and the total cost.
logical_representation: IF claim_type (Unsupported) == 'SUBSISTENCE' AND (receipt_has_date (llm) == false OR receipt_has_establishment_name (llm) == false OR receipt_has_establishment_address (llm) == false OR receipt_has_establishment_phone (llm) == false OR receipt_has_employee_name (llm) == false OR receipt_has_cost_description (llm) == false OR receipt_has_total_cost (llm) == false) -> FORFEIT(ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE))
reasoning: This rule outlines the mandatory fields required on a receipt for an employee to be reimbursed for subsistence. It is a core administrative requirement for the subsistence allowance benefit.

name: Subsistence Receipt Contact Person Requirement
rule_text: Name of Contact Person if appropriate (see examples below) ABC Motel -Company letterhead receipt -Name of Contact Person not required B & B or Relative (non-registered) -Name of Contact Person required
summary: For subsistence reimbursement, a receipt from a non-registered establishment (like a B&B or a relative's home) must include a contact person's name. This is not required for receipts from registered establishments like motels.
logical_representation: IF claim_type (Unsupported) == 'SUBSISTENCE' AND establishment_type (llm) == 'NON-REGISTERED' AND receipt_has_contact_person (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE))
reasoning: This rule specifies a conditional requirement for subsistence reimbursement based on the type of accommodation (registered vs. non-registered), which directly affects the validity of the claim.

name: Rejection of Incomplete Subsistence Receipts
rule_text: A receipt without complete or required information will not be considered.
summary: A claim for subsistence reimbursement will be rejected if the submitted receipt is missing any of the required information.
logical_representation: IF claim_type (Unsupported) == 'SUBSISTENCE' AND is_receipt_complete (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(ALLOWANCE(SUBSISTENCE))
reasoning: This rule states the direct consequence of failing to meet the informational requirements for a subsistence receipt, making it a critical enforcement clause for the allowance.

name: Compressed Work Week, Normal Day
rule_text: The parties to this Agreement agree that the maximum of nine (9) hours shall constitute a normal days work beginning at 7:30 a.m. and ending at 5:00 p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew employees.
summary: For Long Term Base Crew employees, a normal workday under the Compressed Work Week is a maximum of 9 hours, from 7:30 AM to 5:00 PM, with a 30-minute unpaid lunch break.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> SET(schedule_type='COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK', daily_hours=9)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard daily hours for a specific work schedule and employee type, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: Compressed Work Week, Normal Week
rule_text: the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m.
summary: The maximum normal work week for employees on the Compressed Work Week schedule is 45 hours, running from Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> SET(schedule_type='COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK', weekly_hours=45, work_days=['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'])
reasoning: This rule establishes the standard weekly hours and days for a specific work arrangement, which is core to calculating straight time and overtime.

name: EDO Allocation
rule_text: Of the twentysix (26) EDO's, eighteen (18) will be scheduled by Suncor and the remaining eight (8) will be designated as flex EDO's to be taken as mutually agreed between the employee and the supervisor.
summary: Out of 26 annual Earned Days Off (EDOs), 18 are scheduled by the company (Suncor), and the remaining 8 are flexible EDOs to be scheduled by mutual agreement between the employee and supervisor.
logical_representation: IF earned_days_off (llm) == 26 -> ALLOCATE(18, edo_type (llm)='SCHEDULED_BY_COMPANY') AND ALLOCATE(8, edo_type (llm)='FLEX')
reasoning: This rule outlines the entitlement and administration of paid days off, which is an integral part of managing and compensating labor time.

name: Long Term Employee Definition
rule_text: It is understood that when an employee is hired with the intentions of an employment term of more than a six (6) week period, that employee will be automatically on the aforementioned Compressed Work Week arrangements and be considered as a Long Term Base Crew employee.
summary: An employee hired with the expectation of working for more than six weeks is automatically classified as a Long Term Base Crew employee and placed on the Compressed Work Week schedule.
logical_representation: IF employment_term_weeks (llm) > 6 -> SET(employee_type (llm)='LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW') AND APPLY_PAY_RULES('COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK')
reasoning: This rule defines the criteria for employee classification, which directly determines the applicable work schedule and pay rules for their worked hours.

name: Early Termination Pay Adjustment
rule_text: Should an employee be terminated prior to working six (6) weeks, an adjustment shall be made in accordance with the terms of Clause b).
summary: If a long-term employee is terminated before working for six weeks, their pay will be recalculated based on the rules for short-term employees (Clause b).
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED' AND employment_duration_weeks (llm) < 6 -> ADJUST_PAY(clause_b_rules)
reasoning: This rule dictates a retroactive pay calculation based on employment duration and status, which is a direct rule for processing labor time and wages.

name: Short Term Employee, 9th Hour Pay
rule_text: It is understood that when employees are hired with the intentions of short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.
summary: Employees hired for a short-term period (less than six weeks) will be paid at time and a half for the ninth hour worked in a day.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' AND employment_term_weeks (llm) < 6 AND daily_hours > 8 -> PAY(1.5, hours=1)
reasoning: This rule specifies an overtime rate for a specific hour of work for a defined class of employee, which is a direct instruction for calculating labor cost.

name: Transition to Long Term Crew Status
rule_text: Should the employee be employed onsite after six (6) weeks on the job, that employee will then be considered part of the Long Term Crew and paid in in accordance with the Compressed Work Week payment terms
summary: If a short-term employee works for more than six weeks, they are reclassified as a Long Term Crew member and will be paid according to the Compressed Work Week terms from that point forward.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' AND employment_duration_weeks (llm) > 6 -> SET(employee_type (llm)='LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW') AND APPLY_PAY_RULES('COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK')
reasoning: This rule defines the trigger for changing an employee's classification and their corresponding pay rules, directly impacting how their worked time is billed.

name: Overtime, Scheduled EDO
rule_text: Overtime payments for work on the scheduled eighteen (18) days off will be at time and one half (1 ½) for the first twelve (12) hours and double-time (2) paid thereafter.
summary: When working on a company-scheduled Earned Day Off, employees receive time and a half for the first 12 hours and double time for all hours worked after that.
logical_representation: IF day_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED_EDO' AND daily_hours <= 12 -> PREMIUM(1.5) AND IF day_type (llm) == 'SCHEDULED_EDO' AND daily_hours > 12 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule establishes specific overtime rates for work on a particular type of non-working day, directly impacting labor cost calculation.

name: Overtime, Sunday and Statutory Holiday
rule_text: Double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked on Sundays and Statutory Holidays.
summary: All hours worked on Sundays and Statutory Holidays are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SUN' OR is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This is a standard overtime rule based on the day of the week or holiday status, which is a core function of categorizing and billing worked time.

name: Overtime, Flex EDO with Short Notice
rule_text: If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without being given forty- eight (48) hours notice, then the employee will be paid overtime at time and one half (1 ½) for up to twelve (12) hours except on Sundays and Statutory Holidays where double-time (2) will be paid for all hours worked.
summary: If an employee is required to work on a scheduled flex day with less than 48 hours' notice, they are paid time and a half for up to 12 hours. However, if that flex day falls on a Sunday or Statutory Holiday, all hours worked are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF day_type (llm) == 'FLEX_EDO' AND notice_period_hours (llm) < 48 -> IF day_of_week == 'SUN' OR is_stat_holiday == true THEN PREMIUM(2.0) ELSE IF daily_hours <= 12 THEN PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific overtime condition based on the type of day off and the notice given, which is a complex but direct rule for calculating labor worked time.

name: Flex EDO Work Request Condition
rule_text: Once scheduled, requests for employees to work on flex days will only be made a last resort, after all reasonable options are made to find alternate arrangements.
summary: The company may only request an employee to work on a scheduled flex day as a last resort, after all other reasonable staffing options have been exhausted.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: Request to work on day_type (llm) == 'FLEX_EDO' must be a last resort.
reasoning: This rule sets an operational constraint on scheduling work on days off, which is related to managing labor time and availability.

name: Termination Pay Adjustment, No Recent Flex EDO
rule_text: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.
summary: If a long-term employee is terminated and has not taken a flex EDO in the prior six weeks, any regular hours they worked above 240 during that six-week period will be retroactively paid at the overtime rate.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED' AND employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' AND flex_edo_taken_in_lookback (llm) == false AND lookback_period_weeks (llm) == 6 AND hours_in_lookback_period (llm) > 240 -> PAY(OT_RATE, hours = hours_in_lookback_period (llm) - 240)
reasoning: This rule dictates a specific pay adjustment upon termination based on hours worked and time off taken, making it a worked time calculation rule.

name: Flex EDO Request Notice Period
rule_text: The employee will provide a minimum of seven (7) days notice when requesting flex. EDO's.
summary: Employees must give at least seven days' notice when requesting to use a flexible Earned Day Off (EDO).
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: To request day_type (llm) == 'FLEX_EDO', notice_period_days (llm) >= 7
reasoning: This rule governs the procedure for taking time off, which is a component of managing labor time and scheduling.

name: Flex EDO Request Notice Exception
rule_text: Special circumstances will be considered by the supervisor wherein a shorter notice period may be allowed.
summary: A supervisor can approve a flexible EDO request with less than seven days' notice under special circumstances.
logical_representation: IF special_circumstances (llm) == true -> ALLOW(request(day_type (llm)='FLEX_EDO') with notice_period_days (llm) < 7)
reasoning: This rule provides an exception to the standard procedure for requesting time off, which is related to managing labor worked time.

name: Flex EDO Request Responsibility
rule_text: It is understood that: the onus is on the employee to request the flex EDO's;
summary: It is the employee's responsibility to request and schedule their flexible Earned Days Off.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: Employee is responsible for requesting day_type (llm) == 'FLEX_EDO'
reasoning: This rule clarifies responsibility for scheduling time off, which is a part of labor time management.

name: No Payout for Unused Flex EDO
rule_text: overtime payment will not be made for flex days not taken by the employee with the exception of those circumstances outlined in items b) and c) above
summary: Employees will not receive an overtime payout for any unused flexible EDOs, unless specific conditions related to termination or other pay adjustments (as outlined in clauses b and c) are met.
logical_representation: IF day_type (llm) == 'FLEX_EDO' AND is_unused == true -> FORFEIT(overtime_payment) UNLESS condition in (clause_b OR clause_c)
reasoning: This rule defines the financial treatment of unused time off, which is a core labor billing rule concerning compensation for time not worked.

name: Plant Shutdown, Short Term Employee Schedule
rule_text: During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of short- term employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday.
summary: During a Plant Shutdown, short-term employees will be paid based on either a 5-day, 8-hour/day week (Mon-Fri) or a 4-day, 10-hour/day week (Mon-Thu or Tue-Fri).
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES(schedule_type='5x8' OR schedule_type='4x10_mon-thu' OR schedule_type='4x10_tue-fri')
reasoning: This rule specifies the work schedules applicable during a specific event, which defines how straight time and overtime are calculated.

name: Plant Shutdown, Extended Short Term Status
rule_text: Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than six (6) weeks.
summary: Employees hired specifically for a Plant Shutdown will be paid as short-term employees for the entire duration of the shutdown work, even if it lasts longer than six weeks.
logical_representation: IF hired_for_event (llm) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' -> SET(employee_type (llm)='SHORT_TERM') for DURATION(event (Unsupported)='PLANT_SHUTDOWN') REGARDLESS of employment_duration_weeks (llm) > 6
reasoning: This rule creates an exception to the standard reclassification of employees based on a specific project event, which directly impacts their pay structure and how their time is billed.

name: Plant Shutdown, Long Term Crew Compensation
rule_text: All Long Term Base Crew employees shall remain on the compensation terms of the Compressed Work Week arrangements where applicable overtime payments will be made for work on a scheduled day off as per Clause c).
summary: During a Plant Shutdown, Long Term Base Crew employees continue to be paid under their normal Compressed Work Week terms, and any work on a scheduled day off is paid as overtime according to standard rules.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK')
reasoning: This rule confirms that the standard pay rules for a specific employee class remain in effect during a special event, which is an important clarification for labor time billing.

name: 9/80 Schedule Approved Worksites
rule_text:
## APPROVED WORKSITES FOR THE 9/80 SCHEDULE

- □ Shell Scotford, Ft. Saskatchewan, Alberta
- □ Nutrien Redwater Fertilizer, Redwater, Alberta
- □ Northwest Redwater, Alberta
summary: The 9/80 work schedule is only applicable at specific worksites: Shell Scotford, Nutrien Redwater Fertilizer, and Northwest Redwater.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' -> CONSTRAINT(project_location (Unsupported) IN ['Shell Scotford, Ft. Saskatchewan, Alberta', 'Nutrien Redwater Fertilizer, Redwater, Alberta', 'Northwest Redwater, Alberta'])
reasoning: This rule defines the specific locations where the 9/80 schedule and its associated pay rules are valid, which is a primary condition for how time is categorized and paid.

name: 9/80 Schedule Definition
rule_text: This work week averages to forty (40) hours straight time over a two-week period and is generally known as the 9/80 schedule.
summary: The 9/80 schedule is a two-week cycle that averages 40 straight-time hours per week.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('9/80')
reasoning: This rule defines the fundamental structure of the 9/80 schedule, which is essential for categorizing all work hours under this plan.

name: 9/80 Schedule Applicability for On-going Work
rule_text: It is intended for on-going work and does not operate in 'major shutdown' situations.
summary: The 9/80 schedule is used for ongoing work and is not applicable during major shutdown periods.
logical_representation: IF is_major_shutdown (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(schedule_type != '9/80')
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for when the 9/80 schedule and its pay rules are not valid, directly impacting how time is categorized.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Regular Hours, Mon-Thu
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday ... in the first week.
summary: In the first week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular workday from Monday to Thursday is 9 hours at straight time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the straight-time hour threshold for specific days within the 9/80 schedule, which is a core component of categorizing worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Regular Hours, Fri
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of ... one (1) eight (8) hour straight time day on Friday in the first week.
summary: In the first week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular workday on Friday is 8 hours at straight time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> MAX(8_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the straight-time hour threshold for a specific day within the 9/80 schedule.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 Regular Hours, Mon-Thu
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday in the second week.
summary: In the second week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular workday from Monday to Thursday is 9 hours at straight time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the straight-time hour threshold for specific days within the second week of the 9/80 schedule.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 Day Off
rule_text: Friday is a day off.
summary: On a 9/80 schedule, Friday of the second week is a scheduled day off.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('EDO')
reasoning: This rule defines a scheduled day off, which has specific pay implications if worked, making it a rule about time categorization.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Overtime, Mon-Thu
rule_text: Week 1 Time and one half (1 ½) will be paid for the first three (3) hours worked before or after the regular nine (9) hour days. ... Double-time will be paid thereafter.
summary: On a 9/80 schedule in week 1, Monday to Thursday, the first 3 hours of overtime after 9 regular hours are paid at time and a half, and all subsequent hours are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_hours > 9 -> PAY(1.5x) FOR_MAX(3_HOURS_OT) AND AFTER(12_HOURS, TRANSITION(DT))
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines overtime rates and thresholds for specific workdays, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Overtime, Fri
rule_text: Time and one half (1 ½) will be paid for the first (4) hours worked before or after the regular eight (8) hour days. Double-time will be paid thereafter.
summary: On a 9/80 schedule in week 1, Friday, the first 4 hours of overtime after 8 regular hours are paid at time and a half, and all subsequent hours are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours > 8 -> PAY(1.5x) FOR_MAX(4_HOURS_OT) AND AFTER(12_HOURS, TRANSITION(DT))
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines overtime rates and thresholds for a specific workday, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 Overtime, Mon-Thu
rule_text: Week 2 Time and one half (1 ½) will be paid for the first three (3) hours worked before or after the regular nine (9) hour days. Double-time will be paid thereafter.
summary: On a 9/80 schedule in week 2, Monday to Thursday, the first 3 hours of overtime after 9 regular hours are paid at time and a half, and all subsequent hours are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_hours > 9 -> PAY(1.5x) FOR_MAX(3_HOURS_OT) AND AFTER(12_HOURS, TRANSITION(DT))
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines overtime rates and thresholds for specific workdays in the second week of the cycle, which is a core function of categorizing worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Overtime on Earned Friday Off
rule_text: Time and one half (1 ½) will be paid for the first twelve (12) hours worked on the earned Friday off. Double-time will be paid thereafter.
summary: On a 9/80 schedule, work performed on the scheduled Friday off (in week 2) is paid at time and a half for the first 12 hours and double time thereafter.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> PAY(1.5x) FOR_MAX(12_HOURS) AND AFTER(12_HOURS, TRANSITION(DT))
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rates for working on a scheduled day off, a key aspect of time categorization.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Saturday Overtime
rule_text:
| Sat     | Sat     |
|         |         |
| Off     | Off     |
| 12 hrs  | 12 hrs  |
| 1 ½     | 1 ½     |
summary: On a 9/80 schedule, work performed on a Saturday is paid at time and a half for the first 12 hours. Any hours worked beyond 12 are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND day_of_week == 'SAT' -> PAY(1.5x) FOR_MAX(12_HOURS) AND AFTER(12_HOURS, TRANSITION(DT))
reasoning: This rule, derived from the clarifying chart, defines the pay rates for working on a Saturday, a regularly scheduled day off. This is a core rule for time categorization.

name: Sunday and Statutory Holiday Pay
rule_text: Double-time will be paid on Sundays and Statutory Holidays for all hours worked
summary: All hours worked on Sundays and Statutory Holidays are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SUN' OR is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule sets a premium pay rate for specific, non-regular workdays (Sundays and holidays), which is a clear rule for categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: It is understood that those required to work more than ten (10) hours on this shift are entitled to an overtime meal and break pursuant to the overtime meal articles in the agreement.
summary: Employees working more than 10 hours on a 9/80 shift are entitled to an overtime meal and break.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE('overtime_meal_and_break')
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions (hours worked) under which an employee becomes eligible for a meal allowance due to extended work hours.

name: Standard Workday, IOL Strathcona
rule_text: Those employees working long-term maintenance at the Imperial Oil Strathcona site will work eight and sixth tenths (8.6) hours at straight time Monday to Friday.
summary: At the IOL Strathcona site, long-term maintenance employees work a standard day of 8.6 hours at straight time from Monday to Friday. This schedule is designed to compensate for scheduled Earned Days Off (EDOs).
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'IOL_STRATHCONA' AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] -> MAX(8.6_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard working hours and the pay rate (straight time) for those hours on specific days of the week, which is a core function of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Daily Overtime, IOL Strathcona
rule_text: All additional hours after the eight and sixth tenths (8.6) will be performed at the regular overtime provisions as indicated in the Maintenance Agreement.
summary: For employees on the IOL Strathcona work week alteration, any hours worked beyond 8.6 in a single day are considered overtime and paid according to the main agreement's overtime rules.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'IOL_STRATHCONA' AND daily_hours > 8.6 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the daily threshold (8.6 hours) after which straight time transitions to overtime, which is a fundamental aspect of classifying worked time under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Overtime Meal Break, IOL Strathcona
rule_text: It is understood that those required to work more than ten (10) hours on this shift are entitled to an overtime meal break at the ten hour mark (10) pursuant to the overtime meal articles in this agreement.
summary: Employees working at the IOL Strathcona site are entitled to an overtime meal break after working more than 10 hours in a single shift.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'IOL_STRATHCONA' AND daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule specifies the condition (working more than 10 hours) that triggers an entitlement related to a meal, which falls directly under the LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: EDO Work Pay Rate, IOL Strathcona
rule_text: Overtime payments for work on the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's will be paid at double (2x).
summary: For employees on the IOL Strathcona schedule, any work performed on a scheduled Earned Day Off (EDO) must be paid at double the regular rate.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'IOL_STRATHCONA' AND day_type (llm) == 'EDO' -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific pay rate (double time) for work performed on a special type of day (EDO), which is a key component of classifying and calculating pay for worked time, fitting the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Compressed Work Week Minimum Duration
rule_text: A "Compressed Work Week" system may be established when it is intended to operate the system in excess of fourteen (14) calendar days.
summary: A Compressed Work Week (CWW) schedule can only be used if it is planned to last for more than 14 calendar days.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' -> CONSTRAINT(schedule_duration_days (llm) > 14)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions under which a specific work schedule (Compressed Work Week) can be established, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: Compressed Work Week 40-Hour Exception
rule_text: The fourteen (14) calendar day requirement does not apply to those compressed work week schedules that average forty (40) hours per week, Monday to Friday. In this case, the schedule must be established for a minimum of one (1) week timeframe, Monday to Friday.
summary: The 14-day minimum duration for a Compressed Work Week does not apply to schedules that average 40 hours per week (Monday to Friday), but these schedules must last for at least one full week.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' AND weekly_hours == 40 AND day_of_week IN ['MON','TUE','WED','THU','FRI'] -> OVERRIDE(schedule_duration_days (llm) > 14) AND CONSTRAINT(schedule_duration_days (llm) >= 7)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule provides an exception to the standard duration requirement for a specific type of work schedule, directly impacting how work time is structured and paid.

name: CWW Penalty for Not Meeting Duration
rule_text: In the event that the fourteen (14) day conditions are not met, pay conditions will be adjusted to pay eight (8) hours per day Monday through Friday at the straight time hourly rate, plus applicable shift premium, and all hours worked after the eight (8) hours per day, Monday through Friday and all hours worked on Saturday and Sunday at the applicable overtime rates.
summary: If a Compressed Work Week schedule does not last the required 14 days, all hours worked will be recalculated and paid as if the employee worked a standard 5x8 schedule (8 hours/day, Mon-Fri at straight time, with overtime for extra hours and weekends).
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' AND schedule_duration_days (llm) < 14 -> RECALCULATE_PAY(schedule_type='5x8')
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule outlines a financial penalty by specifying how worked time must be re-categorized and paid if schedule conditions are not met, making it a core rule for worked time.

name: CWW Transfer Penalty
rule_text: When an employee is transferred from one Compressed Work Week schedule to another Compressed Work Week schedule and either schedule does not last fourteen (14) days, pay conditions will be adjusted in accordance with Article 1.102 for that cycle.
summary: If an employee is transferred between two Compressed Work Week schedules and either the old or new schedule lasts less than 14 days, their pay for that cycle will be recalculated as if they worked a standard 5x8 schedule.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER' AND schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' AND (initial_schedule_duration_days (llm) < 14 OR new_schedule_duration_days (llm) < 14) -> RECALCULATE_PAY(schedule_type='5x8')
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule specifies pay recalculation based on schedule duration and employee transfers, directly affecting how worked time is categorized and compensated.

name: CWW Standard Work Day
rule_text: The standard work day shall be up to twelve (12) hours of continuous employment including lunch breaks except those breaks provided for in Article 1.506.
summary: On a Compressed Work Week schedule, a standard workday can be up to 12 continuous hours, which includes lunch breaks (unless specified otherwise).
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' -> MAX(12_daily_hours)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines the maximum length of a standard workday under a specific schedule, which is a primary determinant of how daily hours are structured.

name: CWW Overtime Trigger
rule_text: All overtime worked in excess of a regularly scheduled twelve (12), ten (10) or eight (8) hour shift and all hours worked on regularly scheduled days off shall be paid at the applicable overtime provisions in accordance with the established Compressed Work Week rates.
summary: Overtime on a Compressed Work Week is paid for any hours worked beyond the regular shift length (e.g., 8, 10, or 12 hours) and for all hours worked on a regularly scheduled day off.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' AND (daily_hours > scheduled_daily_hours (llm) OR is_edo (llm) == true) -> TRANSITION(OT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the triggers for overtime pay (hours beyond the scheduled shift or work on days off), making it a core LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: EDO Pay on 12-Hour Day
rule_text: On the twelve (12) hour day, all Earned Days Off (EDO's) will be compensated as follows: The first three (3) hours worked at double-time (2x) The next six (6) hours worked at time and one half (1½x) The last three (3) hours worked at double-time (2x).
summary: When working on a scheduled Earned Day Off (EDO) that would normally be a 12-hour shift, pay is calculated as: the first 3 hours at double time, the next 6 hours at time and a half, and the final 3 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF is_edo (llm) == true AND scheduled_daily_hours (llm) == 12 -> PAY(HOURS_1_TO_3=DT, HOURS_4_TO_9=OT, HOURS_10_TO_12=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule specifies a complex pay structure with multiple overtime rates for hours worked on a scheduled day off, which is a detailed rule for categorizing worked time.

name: EDO Pay on 10-Hour Day
rule_text: On the ten (10) hour day, all EDO's will be compensated as follows: The first two and one half (2 ½) hours worked at double-time (2x) The next five (5) hours worked at time and one half (1 ½x) The last two and one half (2 ½) hours worked at double-time (2x)
summary: When working on a scheduled Earned Day Off (EDO) that would normally be a 10-hour shift, pay is calculated as: the first 2.5 hours at double time, the next 5 hours at time and a half, and the final 2.5 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF is_edo (llm) == true AND scheduled_daily_hours (llm) == 10 -> PAY(HOURS_1_TO_2.5=DT, HOURS_2.5_TO_7.5=OT, HOURS_7.5_TO_10=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule details a specific pay calculation with mixed overtime rates for hours worked on a scheduled day off, directly governing the categorization and payment of worked time.

name: EDO Pay on 8-Hour Day
rule_text:
On the eight (8) hour day, all EDO's will be compensated as follows:

The first two (2) hours worked at double-time (2x)

The next four (4) hours worked at time and one half (1 ½x)

The last two (2) hours at double-time (2x)
summary: When working on a scheduled Earned Day Off (EDO) that would normally be an 8-hour shift, pay is calculated as: the first 2 hours at double time, the next 4 hours at time and a half, and the final 2 hours at double time.
logical_representation: IF is_edo (llm) == true AND scheduled_daily_hours (llm) == 8 -> PAY(HOURS_1_TO_2=DT, HOURS_3_TO_6=OT, HOURS_7_TO_8=DT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule provides a specific, multi-tiered overtime calculation for hours worked on a scheduled day off, making it a key rule for categorizing worked time.

name: Statutory Holiday Pay Rate
rule_text: All hours worked on Statutory Holidays will be paid at double-time (2x) in accordance with Compressed Work Week rates.
summary: Any hours worked on a statutory holiday are paid at double the employee's regular hourly rate.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule sets the pay rate for a special day (statutory holiday), which is a classic example of a rule for categorizing and paying for worked time.

name: Statutory Holiday List
rule_text: Payment for statutory holidays, listed below: New Year's Day Labour Day Family Day National Day of Truth and Reconciliation Good Friday Thanksgiving Day Victoria Day Remembrance Day Canada Day Christmas Day Civic Holiday Boxing Day Shall be subject to the following:
summary: This rule lists the specific calendar days that are recognized as paid statutory holidays: New Year's Day, Labour Day, Family Day, National Day of Truth and Reconciliation, Good Friday, Thanksgiving Day, Victoria Day, Remembrance Day, Canada Day, Christmas Day, Civic Holiday, and Boxing Day.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(statutory_holidays_list=['NEW_YEARS_DAY', 'LABOUR_DAY', 'FAMILY_DAY', 'TRUTH_AND_RECONCILIATION', 'GOOD_FRIDAY', 'THANKSGIVING', 'VICTORIA_DAY', 'REMEMBRANCE_DAY', 'CANADA_DAY', 'CHRISTMAS', 'CIVIC_HOLIDAY', 'BOXING_DAY'])
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines which days are considered statutory holidays, a necessary condition for applying special pay rules, thus it is integral to categorizing worked time.

name: CWW Cancellation to Avoid Holiday Pay
rule_text: A Compressed Work Week shift schedule will not be cancelled and reinstituted within a cycle if the intention is to avoid payment for statutory holidays. If this occurs all time worked on the first cycle after reinstitution up to a maximum of fourteen (14) days will be in accordance with Day Work Conditions.
summary: An employer cannot cancel and then restart a Compressed Work Week schedule just to avoid paying for a statutory holiday. If they do, employees will be paid under standard Day Work rules for up to 14 days after the schedule restarts.
logical_representation: IF schedule_cancelled_to_avoid_stat_holiday (llm) == true -> RECALCULATE_PAY(schedule_type='DAY_WORK') FOR MAX(14_DAYS)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule imposes a penalty by changing the pay calculation method if a schedule is manipulated, which directly affects how worked time is categorized and compensated.

name: CWW Night Shift Premium
rule_text: The shift premium on all compressed work week night shifts will be three dollars and fifty cents ($3.50) per hour for all straight time hours worked on shift.
summary: Employees working a night shift on a Compressed Work Week schedule receive an extra $3.50 for every straight-time hour worked.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED_WORK_WEEK (llm)' AND shift_type == 'NIGHT' -> PREMIUM($3.50) FOR ST_HOURS
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule specifies a monetary premium for working under specific conditions (night shift), which is a key component of calculating total pay for worked time.

name: Unpaid Lunch on 10-Hour Day Shifts
rule_text: When working ten (10) hours with two (2) fifteen (15) minute paid breaks and a half (1/2) hour lunch, the midday lunch period of one-half (1/2) hour on workdays of ten (10) hours or less between the hours of 7:30 a.m. and 7:30 p.m. will be unpaid.
summary: On day shifts of 10 hours or less, the 30-minute midday lunch break is unpaid. The two 15-minute breaks are paid.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours <= 10 AND shift_type == 'DAY' -> PAY(LUNCH_BREAK_30_MIN=UNPAID)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines whether a specific period (a lunch break) is paid or unpaid, which directly affects the calculation of total paid hours for the day.

name: Paid Breaks on 12-Hour Shifts
rule_text: In all other instances there shall be three (3) half hour (1/2) paid breaks per twelve (12) hour shifts.
summary: On 12-hour shifts, employees are entitled to three paid 30-minute breaks.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours == 12 -> PROVIDE(3_x_30_MIN_PAID_BREAKS)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule establishes an entitlement to paid breaks during the workday, which is a component of the total paid time for the shift.

name: Penalty for Insufficient Shift Change Notice
rule_text: An employee will be given twenty-four (24) hours advance notice prior to the start of their new shift and if not then they shall be paid their first shift at time and one-half (1 ½x).
summary: If an employee is not given at least 24 hours' notice before a shift change, their entire first shift on the new schedule must be paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF shift_change_notice_hours (llm) < 24 -> PAY(FIRST_SHIFT=OT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule imposes a premium pay rate (time and a half) as a penalty for insufficient notice, directly altering the pay calculation for worked time.

name: Shift Change Pay Protection (Missed EDO)
rule_text: If an employee has started work during a normal work week Monday through Sunday, is then changed to a Compressed Work Week schedule and not given the required earned days off, they shall be paid straight time for the first forty (40) hours worked in the week at the applicable rate and overtime thereafter until the completion of the normal work week.
summary: If an employee is switched to a Compressed Work Week and misses their earned days off as a result, their pay for that week is calculated as straight time for the first 40 hours and overtime for all subsequent hours.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER_TO_CWW' AND missed_edo (llm) == true -> PAY(WEEKLY_HOURS_UP_TO_40=ST, WEEKLY_HOURS_AFTER_40=OT)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule dictates how to categorize hours into straight time and overtime under a specific shift change scenario, making it a rule for processing worked time.

name: Shift Change Pay for Lost Hours
rule_text: If an employee loses time on their initial Compressed Work Week schedule due to having their Compressed Work Week schedule changed to a new Compressed Work Week schedule, they shall be paid for those hours they would have worked on their initial schedule up to the start of their new schedule.
summary: If a shift change between two Compressed Work Week schedules causes an employee to lose scheduled work hours, they must be paid for the hours they missed on their original schedule.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER' AND lost_hours (llm) > 0 -> PAY(lost_hours (llm))
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule provides for payment of hours not actually worked due to a schedule change, which is a form of guaranteed pay and falls under the topic of worked time compensation.

name: Lost Hours Pay Cap
rule_text: In no case will missed hours be paid if the employee works forty (40) or more straight time hours in the calendar week. If less than forty (40) hours is worked in the calendar week, missed hours on the initial schedule will be paid but only to the extent that straight time hours on the new schedule in the calendar week plus hours worked on the old schedule in the calendar week plus missed hours on the initial schedule does not exceed forty (40).
summary: Payment for lost hours due to a shift change is capped. An employee will not be paid for missed hours if they already worked 40 or more straight-time hours that week. If they worked less than 40 hours, they will only be paid for enough missed hours to bring their total straight-time hours for the week up to a maximum of 40.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER' AND lost_hours (llm) > 0 -> CONSTRAINT(PAID_MISSED_HOURS_PLUS_WORKED_HOURS <= 40)
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule places a limit on a pay entitlement (lost hours pay), directly affecting the final calculation of compensation for the work week.

name: Prorated Earned Days Off
rule_text: If a fraction of the regular work days are worked the same fraction of the immediately following regular days off are earned. Any fraction of a day shall be considered one day when calculating earned days off.
summary: If an employee only works part of their scheduled work days before their days off, they earn a proportional amount of those days off. When calculating this, any fraction of a day off earned is rounded up to a full day.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(earned_days_off = CEILING(days_worked_in_cycle (llm) / total_work_days_in_cycle (llm) * total_days_off_in_cycle (llm)))
hierarchy: Boilermaker Contractors Association>IBB Local 146>Maintenance Agreement Addendum
reasoning: This rule defines the calculation for an entitlement (earned days off) based on time worked, which is fundamental to scheduling and pay.

name: 5x8 Schedule, Mon-Fri Overtime
rule_text:
| Day of Week   | Straight Time   | TimeandOneHalf (1.5x)   | DoubleTime (2x)   |
|---------------|-----------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| Monday        | 8 hours         | Up to 2 hours           | After 10 hours    |
summary: On a 5x8 schedule, for Monday through Friday, the first 8 hours are paid at straight time, hours 9 and 10 are at time and a half, and any hours after 10 are at double time.
