rule_text: All hours worked beyond the minimum two (2) hour threshold will be paid at double (2x) the straight time total package hourly rate.
summary: On a call-out, any hours worked beyond the two-hour minimum are also paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'CALL_OUT' AND daily_hours > 2 -> PAY(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the pay rate for hours worked during a call-out, directly impacting how that time is compensated.

name: Minimum Rest Between Shifts
rule_text: It is not intended that an employee shall work more than sixteen (16) hours in any given twenty-four (24) hour period therefore it is established that the employee must have eight (8) continuous hours off between regular shifts or they will be paid overtime rates for all hours worked in excess of the first eight (8) until such times as they have eight (8) continuous hours off.
summary: Employees must have at least 8 consecutive hours off between shifts. If they don't, any hours worked on the next shift beyond the first eight will be paid at overtime rates until they get their 8-hour break.
logical_representation: IF rest_period_hours < 8 -> PAY(OT) FOR hours_worked AFTER 8 UNTIL rest_period_hours >= 8
reasoning: This rule imposes a premium pay rate as a penalty for insufficient rest, which is a condition affecting the calculation of worked time.

name: No Loss of Pay for Rest Rule
rule_text: It is the intent of this clause that no employee shall lose pay on a normal shift due to taking the required eight (8) hour break rule.
summary: An employee will not lose pay from their normal shift if its start time is pushed back to ensure they receive their required 8-hour break.
logical_representation: IF shift_start_delayed_for_rest_rule == true -> CONSTRAINT(NO_PAY_LOSS_ON_NORMAL_SHIFT)
reasoning: This rule protects an employee's regular earnings when the rest rule is applied, making it a condition related to the calculation of worked time and pay.

name: 12-Hour Turnaround Shift Option
rule_text: Employers may implement a twelve (12) hour shift with three (3) half hour paid breaks for turnaround activities within the province of Alberta.
summary: For turnaround work in Alberta, employers can use a 12-hour shift schedule that includes three paid 30-minute breaks.
logical_representation: IF activity_type == 'TURNAROUND' AND project_location == 'ALBERTA' -> PERMIT(schedule_type='12_hour_shift')
reasoning: This rule introduces a special work schedule under specific conditions, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay on 4x10 Base
rule_text: 4 x 10 Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday: 10 hours @ straight time, 2 hours @ doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour turnaround shift is based on a 4x10 schedule, it is paid as 10 hours of straight time and 2 hours of double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_turnaround' AND base_schedule == '4x10' -> PAY(10_hours_ST, 2_hours_DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines how hours are categorized into pay buckets (ST, DT) for a specific shift type, which is the definition of a worked time rule.

name: 12-Hour Shift Pay on 5x8 Base
rule_text: 5 x 8 Monday to Friday: 8 hours @ straight time, 2 hours at time and one half (1 ½), 2 hours at doubletime (2x)
summary: When a 12-hour turnaround shift is based on a 5x8 schedule, it is paid as 8 hours of straight time, 2 hours of time and a half, and 2 hours of double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_turnaround' AND base_schedule == '5x8' -> PAY(8_hours_ST, 2_hours_OT, 2_hours_DT)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines how hours are categorized into pay buckets (ST, OT, DT) for a specific shift type, which is the definition of a worked time rule.

name: 12-Hour Shift Weekend & Holiday Pay
rule_text: Any hours worked on Saturday, Sunday or Holidays will be paid at the applicable overtime rates, as per the General Presidents' Maintenance Agreement (GPMA).
summary: On a 12-hour turnaround shift, any work on a Saturday, Sunday, or Holiday is paid at the overtime rates defined in the GPMA.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '12_hour_turnaround' AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> PAY(applicable_GPMA_overtime_rate)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for work on special days (weekends, holidays) for a particular shift type, classifying it under worked time.

name: Employer Online Orientation Pay
rule_text: The Employer shall pay an allowance for completing the course(s)  equal  to  that  time  estimate,  to  a  maximum  of  eight  (8)  hours,  at  the  straight  time  total package hourly rate.
summary: Employees are paid for employer-required online orientation and onboarding. The pay is based on the employer's reasonable time estimate, up to a maximum of 8 hours, at the straight-time total package rate.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) IN ['ONBOARDING', 'ORIENTATION'] AND required_by_employer (llm) == true -> PAY(MIN(time_estimate (llm), max_hours_payable (llm) = 8) * ST_rate)
reasoning: This rule establishes payment for a work-related activity (onboarding) at a specified rate and with a maximum cap, which falls under the category of how labor time is compensated.

name: Client Online Orientation Pay
rule_text: Employees will be compensated for the prescribed amount of time, at the straight time total package hourly rate, for completing any Owner / Client online orientation, onboarding or basic training courses required of an employee.
summary: Employees receive compensation for the prescribed time spent on required Owner/Client online orientation, onboarding, or training, paid at the straight-time total package hourly rate.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) IN ['ONBOARDING', 'ORIENTATION', 'TRAINING'] AND required_by_client (llm) == true -> PAY(prescribed_time (llm) * ST_rate)
reasoning: This rule dictates payment for time spent on mandatory training/onboarding, classifying it as compensable time, which is a core function of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Orientation Pay on Job Cancellation
rule_text: When a job call is cancelled, and employees at the direction of the Employer have completed the required  course(s),  this  Article  shall  apply  and  those  affected  shall  be  compensated.
summary: If a job is cancelled after an employee has completed the required orientation/training at the employer's direction, they must still be compensated for that time.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) IN ['ONBOARDING', 'ORIENTATION', 'TRAINING'] AND work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'CANCELLED' -> PAY(prescribed_time (llm) * ST_rate)
reasoning: This rule ensures compensation for pre-work activities even if the main work is cancelled, making it a rule about when time is considered worked and payable.

name: Forfeiture of Orientation Pay (No-Show)
rule_text: Alternatively, compensation will not be provided to employees who complete the required course(s) but fail to report for duty.
summary: Employees who complete the required orientation/training but then fail to report to work are not entitled to compensation for that training time.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) IN ['ONBOARDING', 'ORIENTATION', 'TRAINING'] AND work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'NO_SHOW' -> FORFEIT(PAY)
reasoning: This is a condition for payment of worked time, specifying a scenario (failing to report) where an entitlement is forfeited. It directly relates to the rules governing compensable time.

name: No Initial/Terminal Travel Pay on Transfer
rule_text: Transfer from one site to another will not trigger additional initial and terminal travel payments...
summary: When an employee transfers from one site to another, they are not entitled to additional initial or terminal travel payments.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER' -> FORFEIT(initial_and_terminal_travel_payments (llm))
reasoning: Travel payments are a form of allowance provided to compensate for the costs and time of traveling to remote sites, which falls under the broader category of subsistence allowances. This rule negates that allowance under a specific circumstance.

name: Camp Move Payment on Transfer
rule_text: ...should an employee be required to move from one camp to another, they will be entitled to a payment of two (2) hours at the straight time rate should this occur outside of regular scheduled work hours
summary: If an employee is required to move from one camp to another outside of their regular work hours as part of a transfer, they will be paid for 2 hours at the straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'CAMP_MOVE' AND timing_of_activity (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_REGULAR_HOURS' -> PAY(2 * ST_rate)
reasoning: The rule provides a specific payment (2 hours at ST) for an activity performed outside normal hours. This is a direct compensation rule for time spent on a required task, fitting squarely within LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Show-Up Pay for Cancelled Call (Non-Local)
rule_text: Employees who cannot be contacted will receive eight (8) hours pay at the straight time  total  package  hourly  rate  for  reporting  for  work,  and  must  be,  at  the  Company's  discretion, prepared to remain on the job. This provision does not apply to local hires.
summary: If a job is cancelled after a non-local employee has been dispatched, and the company cannot contact them, the employee will receive 8 hours of pay at the straight-time total package rate upon reporting to work. They may be required to remain on the job.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'CANCELLED_AFTER_DISPATCH' AND contact_attempt_successful (llm) == false AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == false -> PAY(8 * ST_rate)
reasoning: This is a 'reporting pay' or 'show-up pay' rule, which guarantees a minimum amount of pay when an employee reports for work as scheduled, even if no work is available. This is a fundamental type of rule within LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Camp/Room Move Pay
rule_text: Should an employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the Clients' designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they are to do it during work hours and will be paid at appropriate rates or the employee shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate to carry out the move, if done outside work hours.
summary: If an employee in camp is required to move to another room or camp, the move should be done during paid work hours. If the move is done outside of work hours, the employee receives 2 hours of pay at the straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) IN ['ROOM_MOVE', 'CAMP_MOVE'] AND timing_of_activity (llm) == 'OUTSIDE_REGULAR_HOURS' -> PAY(2 * ST_rate)
reasoning: This rule defines compensation for a specific, required activity (moving rooms). When performed outside regular hours, it dictates a specific payment, making it a rule about how labor time is categorized and paid.

name: Exclusion to Camp/Room Move Pay
rule_text: This provision will not apply where employees are required to pack their room at the end of a work cycle or to facilitate a move that will occur during the employees furlough.
summary: Employees are not paid for moving rooms if the move is part of packing up at the end of a work cycle or takes place during their furlough (time off).
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) IN ['ROOM_MOVE', 'CAMP_MOVE'] AND timing_of_activity (llm) IN ['END_OF_CYCLE', 'DURING_FURLOUGH'] -> FORFEIT(PAY)
reasoning: This rule acts as a direct exclusion to a payment rule, defining circumstances where an otherwise compensable activity is not paid. This is an integral part of defining the boundaries of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: CWW Normal Work Day and Week
rule_text: The  parties  to  this  Agreement  agree  that  the  maximum  of  nine  (9)  hours  shall constitute  a  normal  days  work  beginning  at  7:30  a.m.  and  ending  at  5:00  p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew Employees. ... the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m.
summary: For Long Term Base Crew Employees on the Compressed Work Week, a normal workday is 9 hours and a normal workweek is 45 hours, Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> SET(schedule_type='5x9_mon-fri') AND SET(daily_hours_ST=9) AND SET(weekly_hours_ST=45)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule defines the standard straight-time hours for a specific work schedule and employee group, which is a core component of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: CWW Earned Days Off (EDO) Entitlement
rule_text: Of the twenty-six (26) EDO's, eighteen (18) will be scheduled by Suncor and the remaining eight (8) will be designated as flex EDO's to be taken as mutually agreed between the employee and the supervisor.
summary: Long Term Base Crew Employees are entitled to 26 Earned Days Off (EDOs) per year. 18 are scheduled by Suncor, and 8 are flexible EDOs to be scheduled by mutual agreement.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> PROVIDE(annual_edo_entitlement (llm)=26) WHERE (edo_type (llm)='SCHEDULED' COUNT=18) AND (edo_type (llm)='FLEX' COUNT=8)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule establishes an entitlement to paid days off, which is a form of compensated labor time, falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Long Term Base Crew Employee Definition
rule_text: It is understood that when an employee is hired with the intentions of an employment term of more than a six (6) week period, that employee will be automatically on the aforementioned Compressed Work Week arrangements and be considered as a Long Term Base Crew Employee.
summary: An employee hired with the intent to work for more than six weeks is automatically classified as a Long Term Base Crew Employee and placed on the Compressed Work Week schedule.
logical_representation: IF employment_term_weeks (llm) > 6 -> SET(employee_type (llm)='LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW') AND APPLY_PAY_RULES('CWW')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule defines the criteria for an employee classification that determines which pay and schedule rules apply, directly impacting LABOR_WORKED_TIME calculations.

name: Short-Term Employee Pay for 9th Hour
rule_text: It  is  understood  that  when  employees  are  hired  with  the  intentions  of  short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid in the following manner. During this six (6) week period, employees will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.
summary: Employees hired for short-term employment (less than six weeks) are paid time and a half for the ninth hour worked each day.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' AND employment_term_weeks (llm) < 6 AND daily_hours > 8 -> PAY(1.5x) FOR daily_hours BETWEEN 8 AND 9
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule specifies an overtime condition (pay at time and a half) based on daily hours worked for a specific employee category, which is a fundamental aspect of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Transition from Short-Term to Long-Term Status
rule_text: Should the employee be employed onsite after six (6) weeks on the job, that employee will then be considered part of the Long Term Crew and paid in accordance with the Compressed Work Week payment terms (except as outlined in item (e) below).
summary: If a short-term employee works for more than six weeks, they become a Long Term Crew member and are paid under the Compressed Work Week terms, unless they are working on a Plant Shutdown.
logical_representation: IF employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' AND employment_duration_weeks (llm) > 6 AND event (Unsupported) != 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' -> SET(employee_type (llm)='LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW') AND APPLY_PAY_RULES('CWW')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule governs the change in an employee's classification based on their employment duration, which directly alters their applicable pay and time calculation rules, classifying it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Overtime on Scheduled EDO
rule_text: Overtime  payments  for  work  on  the  scheduled  eighteen  (18)  days  off  will  be  at doubletime (2x).
summary: Work performed on one of the 18 company-scheduled Earned Days Off is paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF is_scheduled_edo (llm) == true -> PAY(2.0x)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule defines a premium pay rate (double time) for working on a specific type of scheduled day off, which is a core rule of categorizing worked time.

name: Overtime on Flex EDO with Short Notice
rule_text: If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without being given forty-eight (48) hours notice, then the employee will be paid overtime at doubletime (2x).
summary: If an employee is required to work on their scheduled flex EDO with less than 48 hours' notice, the work is paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF is_flex_edo (llm) == true AND work_notice_hours (llm) < 48 -> PAY(2.0x)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule establishes a premium pay rate (double time) based on the condition of working on a specific day type with insufficient notice, falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Termination Pay Adjustment for Unused Flex EDO
rule_text: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.
summary: Upon termination, if a long-term employee has not taken a flex EDO in the preceding six weeks, any regular hours worked beyond 240 in that period will be retroactively paid as overtime.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED' AND employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' AND flex_edo_taken_in_last_6_weeks (llm) == false -> PAY(OT_RATE) FOR regular_hours_in_lookback_period (llm) > 240 OVER lookback_period_weeks (llm)=6
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule defines a specific pay calculation that converts straight time hours into overtime hours upon termination under certain conditions. This is a rule about how time is categorized and paid.

name: Employee Notice for Flex EDO Request
rule_text: The employee will provide a minimum of seven (7) days notice when requesting flex. EDO's. Special circumstances will be considered by the supervisor wherein a shorter notice period may be allowed.
summary: Employees must give at least seven days' notice when requesting a flex EDO, although supervisors may permit shorter notice in special circumstances.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(Employee must provide flex_edo_request_notice_days (llm) >= 7, unless exception is granted)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule establishes a procedural requirement for accessing a time-off entitlement (EDO), which is part of managing and compensating labor time.

name: Forfeiture of Unused Flex EDOs
rule_text: that overtime payment will not be made for flex days not taken by the employee with the exception of those circumstances outlined in items b) and c) above
summary: Employees are generally not paid out for unused flex EDOs, unless specific conditions related to termination or employment status changes are met.
logical_representation: IF is_flex_edo (llm) == true AND flex_edo_is_not_taken (llm) == true AND employee_status (Unsupported) != 'TERMINATED' -> FORFEIT(PAYOUT)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule dictates the conditions under which a time-based entitlement (pay for an EDO) is forfeited, making it a rule about the final disposition of worked or earned time.

name: Plant Shutdown Schedule for Short-Term Employees
rule_text: During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of shortterm employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday.
summary: During a Plant Shutdown, short-term employees will work either a 5x8 (Mon-Fri) schedule or a 4x10 (Mon-Thu or Tue-Fri) schedule.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employee_type (llm) == 'SHORT_TERM' -> APPLY_SCHEDULE(schedule_type = '5x8' OR schedule_type = '4x10_mon-thu' OR schedule_type = '4x10_tue-fri')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule defines the specific work schedules applicable to a group of employees during a special event, which is a primary determinant of how worked time is calculated.

name: Plant Shutdown Extends Short-Term Status
rule_text: Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than  six  (6)  weeks.
summary: Employees hired specifically for a Plant Shutdown will remain classified and paid as short-term employees for the entire duration of the shutdown, regardless of whether it exceeds six weeks.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employment_duration_weeks (llm) > 6 -> MAINTAIN(employee_type (llm)='SHORT_TERM')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule creates an exception to the standard employee classification change based on duration, directly impacting which pay rules apply for an extended period. This is a LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: Plant Shutdown Pay for Long-Term Employees
rule_text: All  Long  Term  Base  Crew  employees  shall  remain  on  the compensation terms of the Compressed Work Week arrangements where applicable overtime payments will be made for work on a scheduled day off as per Clause c).
summary: During a Plant Shutdown, Long Term Base Crew employees continue to be paid under their standard Compressed Work Week agreement, including any applicable overtime for working on scheduled days off.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN' AND employee_type (llm) == 'LONG_TERM_BASE_CREW' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('CWW')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule confirms that the standard pay and time calculation rules for a specific employee group remain in effect during a special event, thus classifying it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Coker Shift Rotation Grandfathering
rule_text: The parties  agree  to  "grandfather"  the  current  coker  shift  rotation  that  is  in  place  and operating  at  the  site  under  the  current  arrangements  and  rules.  This  would  apply  to members of Labourers Local 92 currently involved in this rotation.
summary: The existing coker shift rotation for members of Labourers Local 92 is grandfathered and continues to operate under its current rules.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'LABOURER' AND union_local (Unsupported) == '92' AND site_area (llm) == 'COKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('EXISTING_COKER_SHIFT')
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule mandates the continued application of a specific set of work schedule and pay rules for a defined group of employees, making it a LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: Coker Shift Change Approval Process
rule_text: Should the Owner require a change to existing arrangements or additional people, the matter will be referred to the Labourers Union and the National Maintenance Council for review and acceptance prior to implementation.
summary: Any changes to the coker shift rotation or the number of people on it must be reviewed and accepted by the Labourers Union and the National Maintenance Council before being implemented.
logical_representation: IF change_is_required_to_schedule(site_area (llm)='COKER') -> REQUIRE(Union_and_Council_review_and_acceptance)
hierarchy: Suncor Refinery, Edmonton, Alberta>Edmonton Exchanger>National Maintenance Agreement for Alberta
reasoning: This rule outlines the mandatory process for altering a work schedule, which directly governs how labor time is managed and structured. It is a procedural rule within LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Approved Work Week Alterations Locations
rule_text:
SHELL SCOTFORD, FT. SASKATCHEWAN, ALBERTA

IOL STRATHCONA
summary: Specific approved work week alterations are applicable at the Shell Scotford (Fort Saskatchewan) and IOL Strathcona project locations.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) IN ['SHELL_SCOTFORD', 'IOL_STRATHCONA'] -> APPLY_RULES('APPENDIX_D')
reasoning: This rule establishes the specific project locations where the work week alteration rules apply. Since work week schedules are fundamental to how worked time is categorized and paid, the primary topic is LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: 9/80 Schedule Overtime Reference
rule_text: (See overtime provisions below for the 9/80 Schedule)
summary: For the specified locations (Shell Scotford and IOL Strathcona), the overtime provisions for the 9/80 schedule, as detailed elsewhere, must be applied.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND project_location (Unsupported) IN ['SHELL_SCOTFORD', 'IOL_STRATHCONA'] -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('9/80_OVERTIME')
reasoning: This rule directs that specific overtime provisions are to be used for the 9/80 schedule. Overtime calculations are a core function of categorizing worked time, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the correct topic.

name: 9/80 Schedule Definition and Scope
rule_text: This work week averages to forty (40) hours straight time over a two-week period and is generally known as the 9/80 schedule. It is intended for on-going work and does not operate in 'major shutdown' situations.
summary: The 9/80 schedule is a two-week work cycle averaging 40 hours per week. This schedule is intended for ongoing work and is not applicable during major shutdowns.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' -> CONSTRAINT(event (Unsupported) != 'PLANT_SHUTDOWN')
reasoning: This rule defines the work schedule and its operational constraints, which are foundational to categorizing and calculating work time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Regular Hours
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday and one (1) eight (8) hour straight time day on Friday in the first week.
summary: In the first week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular work day consists of 9 straight-time hours from Monday to Thursday, and 8 straight-time hours on Friday.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> MAX(8_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule establishes the daily straight time hour limits for the first week of the schedule, which is a core component of worked time calculation.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 Regular Hours
rule_text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday in the second week. Friday is a day off.
summary: In the second week of a 9/80 schedule, the regular work day consists of 9 straight-time hours from Monday to Thursday. Friday is a scheduled day off.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] -> MAX(9_HOURS_ST) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' -> EDO
reasoning: This rule establishes the daily straight time hour limits and the earned day off for the second week of the schedule, directly impacting time categorization.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 1 Weekday Overtime
rule_text: Week 1 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first two hours (2) worked before or after the regular nine (9) or eight (8) hours day Monday to Friday-doubletime (2x) will be paid thereafter.
summary: During Week 1 of a 9/80 schedule (Monday-Friday), the first two overtime hours beyond the regular daily hours are paid at time and a half. All subsequent overtime hours are paid at double time.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_overtime_hours <= 2 -> PREMIUM(1.5) AND IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_overtime_hours > 2 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the pay rates for overtime hours worked on specific days within the schedule, a key aspect of time-based labor calculation.

name: 9/80 Schedule, Week 2 EDO Overtime
rule_text: Week 2 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first ten (10) hours worked on the earned Friday off...
summary: On the earned Friday off in Week 2 of a 9/80 schedule, the first 10 hours of work are paid at time and a half.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours <= 10 -> PREMIUM(1.5)
reasoning: This rule sets a specific overtime rate for working on a scheduled day off, which is a rule for categorizing and paying for worked time.

name: 9/80 Schedule, General Double Time Overtime
rule_text: ...all other overtime is doubletime (2x).
summary: All overtime not otherwise specified is paid at double time. This applies to work on Saturdays and Sundays in both weeks, all overtime on Week 2 Mondays to Thursdays, and any hours worked beyond the first 10 on the earned Friday off in Week 2.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == '9/80' AND ((week_number (Unsupported) == 1 AND day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN']) OR (week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU'] AND daily_overtime_hours > 0) OR (week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week == 'FRI' AND daily_hours > 10) OR (week_number (Unsupported) == 2 AND day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'])) -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This is a catch-all rule that defines the pay rate for all remaining overtime scenarios, which is a fundamental part of worked time calculation.

name: Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: It should be noted that those employees working more than ten (10) hours are entitled to an overtime meal and break at the ten (10) hour mark pursuant to the overtime meal articles in the agreement.
summary: Employees who work more than 10 hours in a single day are entitled to receive an overtime meal and a break at the 10-hour mark.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_AND_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule describes a condition based on hours worked that triggers a meal-related entitlement, which falls under the category of meal allowances.

name: Regular Workday, 5x8.6 Schedule
rule_text: Those employees working long-term maintenance at the Imperial Oil Strathcona site will work eight and six tenths (8 .6) hours at straight-time Monday to Friday.
summary: The standard work schedule for long-term maintenance employees is 8.6 hours per day at straight-time rates, from Monday to Friday.
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND schedule_type == '5x8.6' -> MAX(8.6_HOURS_ST)
reasoning: This rule defines the standard working hours and days, which is a core concept of categorizing worked time.

name: Weekday Overtime, First Tier (1.5x)
rule_text: 1.4 hrs 1 ½
summary: On Monday through Friday, the first 1.4 hours of overtime worked after the regular 8.6 hours (i.e., hours from 8.6 up to 10) are paid at time and a half (1.5x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 8.6 AND daily_hours <= 10 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule establishes the first overtime threshold and pay rate for a standard workday, a key function of time categorization.

name: Weekday Overtime, Second Tier (2x)
rule_text: DT After Ten (10)
summary: On Monday through Friday, all hours worked after 10 hours in a single day are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week IN ['MON', 'TUE', 'WED', 'THU', 'FRI'] AND daily_hours > 10 -> TRANSITION(DT)
reasoning: This rule defines the second overtime threshold and pay rate for a standard workday, which is a core part of time categorization.

name: Saturday Work Pay Rate
rule_text: DT (x2)
summary: All hours worked on a Saturday are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SAT' -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for a specific day of the week (Saturday), which is a rule for categorizing worked time.

name: Sunday Work Pay Rate
rule_text: DT (x2)
summary: All hours worked on a Sunday are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF day_of_week == 'SUN' -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for a specific day of the week (Sunday), which is a rule for categorizing worked time.

name: EDO Work Pay Rate
rule_text: Overtime payments for work on the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's will be paid at double-time (2x).
summary: All hours worked on a scheduled Earned Day Off (EDO) are paid at double time (2x).
logical_representation: IF is_scheduled_edo (llm) == true -> PREMIUM(2.0)
reasoning: This rule specifies the pay rate for working on a special day type (EDO), directly relating to how worked time is categorized and paid.

name: Overtime Meal Break Entitlement
rule_text: It  is  understood  that  those  required  to  work  more  than  ten  hours  (10)  on  this  shift  are  entitled  to  an overtime meal break at the ten-hour mark (10) pursuant to the overtime meal provisions in the collective agreement.
summary: An employee is entitled to an overtime meal break after working more than 10 hours in a single shift.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(MEAL_BREAK)
reasoning: This rule explicitly defines the trigger (hours worked) for an overtime meal entitlement, which is the primary function of the LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Subsistence Assistance - Room Guarantee/Payment Option
rule_text: (i) guarantee or pay for the room with the lodging in place at an amount not to exceed the daily subsistence rate, until the employee receives their first pay cheque or completes the assignment, whichever occurs first.
summary: Upon a joint request from an employee and their Union Business Manager, an employer may guarantee or directly pay for the employee's lodging. This payment is capped at the daily subsistence rate and continues until the employee receives their first paycheck or finishes the job, whichever happens first.
logical_representation: IF is_joint_request_made (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(LODGING_PAYMENT_MAX(daily_subsistence_rate)) UNTIL MIN(subsistence_end_condition (llm) == 'FIRST_PAYCHEQUE', subsistence_end_condition (llm) == 'ASSIGNMENT_COMPLETE')
reasoning: This rule outlines a specific form of monetary assistance for lodging, which is a core component of a subsistence allowance policy. It defines the conditions, limits, and duration of this benefit.

name: Subsistence Assistance - Cash Advance Option
rule_text: (ii) provide the employee with "an advance", based on the subsistence allowance for the time period stated in (i), which will be deducted from the first pay cheque.
summary: As an alternative to direct lodging payment, upon a joint request, an employer may provide an employee with a cash advance for subsistence. This advance covers the period until the first paycheck or job completion and is deducted from that first paycheck.
logical_representation: IF is_joint_request_made (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(SUBSISTENCE_ADVANCE) AND DEDUCT_FROM(first_paycheque)
reasoning: This rule describes a cash advance against subsistence, which is a financial mechanism directly related to the administration and provision of subsistence allowance.

name: Subsistence Assistance - Request Protocol
rule_text: All requests for subsistence advances shall be confirmed in writing by the Local Union Business Manager or their designee at the time of referral. It is acknowledged that the Business Manager will only make this request where they are aware of a legitimate need for such advances.
summary: Any request for subsistence assistance must be formally confirmed in writing by the local Union Business Manager (or their representative) at the time of the employee's referral. The manager is expected to vet these requests for legitimate need.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: PROVIDE(SUBSISTENCE_ASSISTANCE) requires subsistence_request_confirmation_method (llm) == 'WRITTEN_UNION_CONFIRMATION'
reasoning: This rule establishes the mandatory procedure for requesting the subsistence benefit. Since it governs the process of obtaining the allowance, it falls under the LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Subsistence Assistance - Camp Exclusion
rule_text: This arrangement does not apply where a camp is available.
summary: The subsistence assistance arrangement (either direct lodging payment or a cash advance) is not available to employees if the employer provides a work camp for lodging.
logical_representation: IF is_camp_available (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(SUBSISTENCE_ASSISTANCE)
reasoning: This rule defines a critical eligibility condition for the subsistence assistance. The availability of a camp negates the entitlement, making it a rule that directly governs the application of the subsistence allowance.

name: Subsistence Assistance - Non-Grievable Clause
rule_text: It is understood that a request herein shall not be subject to either grievance or arbitration.
summary: Decisions regarding requests for subsistence assistance cannot be challenged through the formal grievance or arbitration processes outlined in the collective agreement.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT: is_grievable (llm) == false FOR SUBSISTENCE_ASSISTANCE_REQUESTS
reasoning: This rule sets a procedural boundary on the subsistence allowance policy by defining the dispute resolution mechanism (or lack thereof). It is a meta-rule governing the administration of the allowance, thus categorized under LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Agreement Validity Period
rule_text: The following formula will be used for the determination of Long and Short Term Maintenance Base Rates and Benefits for the duration of the Agreement: January 1, 2025December 31, 2028.
summary: The wage and benefit formulas described are valid from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2028.
logical_representation: APPLY_PAY_RULES('This Agreement') WHERE current_date >= '2025-01-01' AND current_date <= '2028-12-31'
reasoning: This rule establishes the effective date range for the wage and benefit formulas, which is a fundamental condition for calculating pay for time worked.

name: Maintenance Base Rate, Fort McMurray
rule_text: Fort McMurray only:  Maintenance Base Rates will be set at 100% of Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.
summary: In Fort McMurray, the maintenance base wage rate is 100% of the construction base rate, plus all applicable benefits.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) == 'Fort McMurray' -> PAY(maintenance_base_rate = construction_base_rate * 1.0) AND PROVIDE(benefits * 1.0)
reasoning: This rule directly specifies how the base wage rate for worked time is calculated in a specific location, a core component of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Maintenance Base Rate, Outside Fort McMurray
rule_text: Outside of Fort McMurray: Long & Short Term Maintenance Base Rates will be set at $0.75 under Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.
summary: Outside of Fort McMurray, the maintenance base wage rate is the construction base rate minus $0.75, plus all applicable benefits.
logical_representation: IF project_location (Unsupported) != 'Fort McMurray' -> PAY(maintenance_base_rate = construction_base_rate - 0.75) AND PROVIDE(benefits * 1.0)
reasoning: This rule establishes the formula for calculating the base wage rate for worked time in a specific geographical area, fitting squarely under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Apprentice Rate Calculation
rule_text: Apprentice rates are calculated at the percentages provided in the Local Construction Agreement applied to Maintenance Journeyperson Rate.
summary: Apprentice wages are determined by applying the percentage specified in the Local Construction Agreement to the Maintenance Journeyperson's rate.
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> PAY(apprentice_rate = maintenance_journeyperson_rate * local_construction_agreement_percentage (llm))
reasoning: This rule specifies the calculation method for a specific class of employee's wages, which is a direct aspect of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Skill Premium Payment
rule_text: Appropriate skill premiums to be paid in accordance with past maintenance jobsite practice.
summary: Skill premiums must be paid based on the established practices of past maintenance jobsites.
logical_representation: IF past_jobsite_practice (llm) == 'has_skill_premium' -> PAY(skill_premium)
reasoning: This rule dictates an additional payment (premium) based on skill, which modifies the total pay for time worked. This falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Compressed Work Week Rate Calculation
rule_text: Compressed Work Week Rates will be calculated pursuant to Article 17.000 of the Agreement.
summary: Pay rates for a compressed work week schedule must be calculated according to the rules in Article 17.000.
logical_representation: IF schedule_type == 'COMPRESSED' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Article 17.000')
reasoning: The rule concerns how pay is calculated for a specific work schedule (CWW), which is a key part of managing and compensating labor worked time.

name: Benefit Code B Calculation Basis
rule_text: B Calculated on straight time and overtime hours worked.
summary: Benefits under code 'B' are calculated based on the total number of straight time and overtime hours worked.
logical_representation: IF benefit_code (llm) == 'B' -> CALCULATE_BENEFIT_ON(ST_hours_worked + OT_hours_worked)
reasoning: This rule specifies the time buckets (hours worked) used for benefit calculations, which is integral to the overall compensation for labor time.

name: Benefit Code C Calculation Basis
rule_text: C Calculated on total hours paid.
summary: Benefits under code 'C' are calculated based on the total hours paid to an employee, which may include hours not worked (e.g., show-up time).
logical_representation: IF benefit_code (llm) == 'C' -> CALCULATE_BENEFIT_ON(total_paid_hours (llm))
reasoning: This rule defines the basis for benefit calculation (total hours paid), linking it to labor time accounting.

name: Benefit Code D Calculation Basis
rule_text: D Calculated on total wages.
summary: Benefits under code 'D' are calculated as a percentage of the employee's total wages.
logical_representation: IF benefit_code (llm) == 'D' -> CALCULATE_BENEFIT_ON(total_wages (llm))
reasoning: This rule determines how benefits are calculated based on earnings from worked time, a core aspect of labor compensation.

name: Employer Payroll Responsibility
rule_text: EMPLOYERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR OPERATING THEIR OWN PAYROLL IN AN ACCURATE AND TIMELY FASHION PURSUANT TO THE COLLECTIVE AGREEMENT WAGE AND BENEFIT FORMULA.
summary: Employers must manage their payroll accurately and on time, following the wage and benefit rules outlined in the collective agreement.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('Employer must operate payroll accurately and timely per agreement formulas')
reasoning: This is a procedural rule governing the administration of pay for time worked, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the most appropriate category.

name: Union Dues Deduction
rule_text: APPROPRIATE UNION DUES DEDUCTIONS ARE TO BE MADE PURSUANT TO THE LOCAL AGREEMENTS.
summary: Employers are required to deduct union dues as specified in the relevant local agreements.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('Employer must deduct union dues per local agreements')
reasoning: Union dues are typically calculated based on wages earned for time worked, so this rule is directly related to the overall pay calculation process under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Employer Fund Contributions
rule_text: Employers will make appropriate contributions to the following funds for those participating trades which have the provision contained within their respective Industrial Construction Reference Agreement: - Building Trades of Alberta - Audiometric Testing - Construction Employee Family Assistance Program (CEFAP) - Case Managed Aftercare (CMAC) - Rapid Site Access Program (RSAP) - Workforce Development Trust Fund (WFDT)
summary: Employers must contribute to several specific funds (e.g., Building Trades of Alberta, CEFAP, RSAP) for trades whose Industrial Construction Reference Agreement includes these provisions.
logical_representation: IF position_classification requires_fund_contribution_per_reference_agreement (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(contributions_to_specified_funds)
reasoning: These contributions are a component of the total labor cost, typically calculated based on hours worked or wages paid. They are part of the overall compensation for labor, fitting under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Employer Contribution Remittance
rule_text: Employers are responsible for ensuring all employer contributions required for maintenance activities under this agreement are forwarded to the appropriate organization.
summary: Employers have the responsibility to send all required contributions for maintenance work to the correct organizations.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('Employer must remit all required contributions to the correct organization')
reasoning: This is a procedural rule governing the handling of monetary contributions that are part of the overall cost of labor, which is tied to LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Source for Benefit Definitions
rule_text: The Parties agree that the application of the 100% of Appropriate Benefits will be based upon the respective Local Union's Construction Reference Agreement.
summary: The definition and application of "100% of Appropriate Benefits" are determined by the Local Union's Construction Reference Agreement.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('Benefit application is defined by the Local Union Construction Reference Agreement')
reasoning: This rule dictates how benefits, a key component of compensation for worked time, are to be determined.

name: Benefit Calculation Basis Parity
rule_text: Benefit contributions based on hours earned in construction will be paid on hours earned in maintenance and contributions based on hours worked in construction will be paid on hours worked in maintenance.
summary: The method for calculating benefit contributions in maintenance must mirror the method used in construction: if construction benefits are based on hours earned, maintenance benefits are too; if based on hours worked, maintenance benefits follow suit.
logical_representation: IF construction_benefit_basis (llm) == 'hours_earned' -> SET maintenance_benefit_basis (llm) = 'hours_earned' AND IF construction_benefit_basis (llm) == 'hours_worked' -> SET maintenance_benefit_basis (llm) = 'hours_worked'
reasoning: This rule directly defines the calculation logic for benefits based on labor time (hours earned vs. hours worked), making it a LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Owner Sets Work Schedules
rule_text: Owner at its sole discretion will set all work schedules;
summary: The client (Owner) has the sole authority to determine all work schedules for the contractor.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT('Owner sets schedule_type')
reasoning: This rule directly pertains to the definition and control of work hours and schedules, which is the core of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Election Day Work Stoppage
rule_text: All work scheduled on a Provincial, Federal or Municipal, Election Day will end at 16:00 hrs;
summary: On any government election day (provincial, federal, or municipal), all work must stop at 4:00 PM.
logical_representation: IF is_election_day (llm) == true -> MAX(WORK_END_TIME('16:00'))
reasoning: This rule establishes a specific condition affecting the duration of a workday, which falls under the category of how work time is managed.

name: Union Rate Changes
rule_text: For Union positions: rates are subject to change as required by the applicable Collective Agreement or government legislation..
summary: Billing rates for union positions can be changed if required by a new collective agreement or government legislation.
logical_representation: IF is_union_position (llm) == true AND (collective_agreement_change (llm) == true OR government_legislation_change (llm) == true) -> ACTION(UPDATE_RATES)
reasoning: This rule governs the conditions under which labor pay rates are modified, which is a fundamental aspect of labor billing and time.

name: Billable Orientation and On-boarding
rule_text: Orientation / on-boarding hours are all billable (facilities to be provided by NWR)
summary: All hours spent by workers in orientation or on-boarding are billable to the client.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) IN ['ONBOARDING', 'ORIENTATION'] -> PAY(ST)
reasoning: This rule defines a non-productive activity (on-boarding) as billable worked time, classifying it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Billable Fit Testing
rule_text: Fit testing, if required
summary: If fit testing is required for workers, the time and cost associated with it are billable.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'FIT_TESTING' -> PAY(ST)
reasoning: This rule specifies that time spent on fit testing is a billable activity, which relates to the calculation of payable hours.

name: Billable Welder Testing
rule_text: Welder testing (including labour hours) if required
summary: If welder testing is required, the labor hours for the testing are billable.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'WELDER_TESTING' -> PAY(ST)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific non-production activity (welder testing) as billable labor hours, placing it under the category of worked time.

name: Non-Billable Pre-Mobilization Training
rule_text: No hours may be charged to Owner for Supplier Group members that arrive at Site without the required training.
summary: Workers arriving at the site without the mandatory pre-mobilization training cannot have their hours billed to the client until they are compliant.
logical_representation: IF has_required_training (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(PAY)
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition under which labor hours are not billable, directly impacting the calculation of worked time.

name: Billable Site-Specific Training
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing in this Subsection, any Site specific training will be to Owner's account.
summary: Any training that is specific to the client's site will be paid for by the client.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'SITE_SPECIFIC_TRAINING' -> PAY(ST)
reasoning: This rule defines a type of training as billable hours, which falls under the classification of how worked time is accounted for and paid.

name: Overtime Application
rule_text: Overtime - applies to all positions including non-manuals, as per overtime definitions in NMA or BM Agreement
summary: Overtime rules, as defined in the NMA or Boilermaker Agreement, apply to all employees, including non-manual staff.
logical_representation: APPLY_PAY_RULES(governing_agreement (llm), OT_DEFINITIONS)
reasoning: This rule dictates the applicability of overtime pay, a core component of categorizing and paying for worked hours.

name: Double Time Application
rule_text: Double Time - applies to all union positions including non-manuals as per NMA or BM Agreement
summary: Double time pay, as defined by the NMA or Boilermaker Agreement, applies to all union positions, including non-manual staff.
logical_representation: IF is_union_position (llm) == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES(governing_agreement (llm), DT_DEFINITIONS)
reasoning: This rule specifies the conditions for applying double time rates, which is fundamental to the calculation of pay for worked time.

name: Statutory Holiday Pay
rule_text: Stat Holidays - follow terms of NMA or BM Agreement
summary: Pay for statutory holidays is governed by the terms of the NMA or Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES(governing_agreement (llm))
reasoning: This rule concerns special pay conditions for a specific type of day (statutory holiday), which is a key part of worked time and compensation rules.

name: Governing Agreement for Payments
rule_text: All required payments per NMA applies to all positions including non-manuals, except for Boilermaker non-manuals which follow Boilermaker agreement
summary: All required payments are governed by the NMA for all staff, with the exception of Boilermaker non-manual staff, who are governed by the Boilermaker agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' AND is_non_manual_employee (llm) == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Boilermaker Agreement') ELSE -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA')
reasoning: This rule establishes which collective agreement dictates payment terms, a foundational rule for all labor billing and thus classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Meal Allowance
rule_text: Meal Break/allowance As per NMA, for all positions (manual and non-manual), except for Boilermaker manual and non-manuals, which follow Boilermaker Agreement
summary: Entitlement to meal breaks and allowances is determined by the NMA for all positions, except for Boilermakers (both manual and non-manual), whose entitlement is determined by the Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Boilermaker Agreement', 'MEAL_ALLOWANCE') ELSE -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA', 'MEAL_ALLOWANCE')
reasoning: This rule explicitly governs the conditions for receiving a meal allowance, which is the definition of the LABOR_MEAL_ALLOWANCE topic.

name: Living Out Allowance (LOA)
rule_text: LOA/day As per NMA, for all positions (manual and non-manual), except for Boilermaker manual and non-manuals, which follow Boilermaker Agreement, at a minimum
summary: Daily Living Out Allowance (LOA) is paid according to the NMA for all positions, except for Boilermakers (both manual and non-manual), who are paid according to the Boilermaker Agreement.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'BOILERMAKER' -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('Boilermaker Agreement', 'LOA') ELSE -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('NMA', 'LOA')
reasoning: This rule defines the entitlement and governing agreement for a daily living out allowance, which is synonymous with subsistence allowance, making LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE the correct topic.

name: Hiring Dispatch Procedure
rule_text: The Employer agrees to engage Employees through the services of the Union dispatch facilities in accordance with the following procedures:
summary: Employers are required to hire employees exclusively through the Union's dispatch services.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(HIRING_PROCEDURE('UNION_DISPATCH'))
reasoning: This rule establishes the fundamental condition for how labor is sourced and assigned for work, making it a prerequisite for any worked time. Therefore, LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the most appropriate classification.

name: Dispatch Order
rule_text: Employees shall be dispatched to Employers in consecutive order from the unemployed membership list at the Local Union Hall except as is provided below:
summary: Unless other specific rules apply, employees must be dispatched sequentially from the Union's unemployed list.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(DISPATCH_ORDER('CONSECUTIVE_FROM_LIST'))
reasoning: This rule dictates the sequence and priority of assigning work to individuals, which directly relates to the allocation of worked hours. Thus, LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the best fit.

name: Hiring Freedom for Commercial/Institutional Work
rule_text: For COMMERCIAL/INSTITUTIONAL work only the Employer has the freedom to select from the list of available unemployed members or transfer Employees from other work being performed for the same Employer, within the area jurisdiction of the Union(s).
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, the employer can freely select from the unemployed list or transfer existing employees from other company projects within the union's jurisdiction.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> ALLOW(SELECTIVE_HIRE) OR ALLOW(TRANSFER)
reasoning: This rule defines an exception to the standard work assignment process based on project type. It governs who is eligible to be assigned work, placing it under the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Name Hire Ratio - Local 496
rule_text: For work in Local 496 jurisdiction only, three out of every four workers hired may be name hired by the contractor off of the Union's out of work list.
summary: For projects within Local 496's jurisdiction, contractors are permitted to 'name hire' (specifically request) three out of every four workers from the union's out-of-work list.
logical_representation: IF union_local (Unsupported) == '496' -> CONSTRAINT(NAME_HIRE_RATIO(3/4))
reasoning: This rule sets a specific ratio for how labor can be sourced and assigned to a project, which is a condition for performing work. This makes LABOR_WORKED_TIME the most suitable category.

name: Contractor Rejection Notification
rule_text: Contractors will advise the union of the names of those workers on the out of work list that they will not accept as employees.
summary: Contractors must notify the union about any specific workers on the out-of-work list whom they are unwilling to hire.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(NOTIFY_UNION('UNACCEPTABLE_WORKERS'))
reasoning: This rule is part of the hiring and work assignment process. It affects which individuals are eligible to be dispatched for work, linking it to LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Name Hire/Transfer Limit - Small Industrial Projects
rule_text: On INDUSTRIAL work, where a project requires twenty-five (25) or less Employees, the Employer may transfer or name hire any combination of fourteen (14) Employees to the job site, however, no more than six (6) Employees may be name hired.
summary: On Industrial projects with 25 or fewer employees, the employer can bring on a total of 14 employees through transfers or specific name requests, with a maximum of 6 of those being name hires.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_employee_count (llm) <= 25 -> CONSTRAINT(MAX_TRANSFER_OR_NAME_HIRE(14)) AND CONSTRAINT(MAX_NAME_HIRE(6))
reasoning: This rule sets quantitative limits on how labor can be sourced for a project based on its size and type. As it governs the assignment of workers, it falls under the LABOR_WORKED_TIME category.

name: Name Hire/Transfer Allowance - Large Industrial Projects
rule_text: On INDUSTRIAL work, where a project requires twenty-five (25) or more Employees, the Employer may utilize the option in (b) above and in addition may name hire or transfer one (1) additional Employee for every five (5) list hires
summary: On Industrial projects with 25 or more employees, the employer can use the initial 14 transfer/name hires, and then gets one additional transfer or name hire for every five employees hired from the union list.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND project_employee_count (llm) >= 25 -> ALLOW(TRANSFER_OR_NAME_HIRE_BASE(14)) AND ALLOW(ADDITIONAL_TRANSFER_OR_NAME_HIRE_RATIO(1/5_LIST_HIRES))
reasoning: This rule defines the ratio and allowance for sourcing labor outside the standard dispatch order for large projects. Since it controls the assignment of work, LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the appropriate topic.

name: Modular Yard Transfer Duration
rule_text: Employees transferred to the Modular Yard from the Fabrication Shop must remain employed in the Modular Yard for a minimum of thirty (30) calendar days before they can be transferred to a field project within the appropriate jurisdiction.
summary: An employee transferred from a Fabrication Shop to a Modular Yard must work in the yard for at least 30 calendar days before being eligible for another transfer to a field project.
logical_representation: IF transfer_source (llm) == 'FABRICATION_SHOP' AND transfer_destination (llm) == 'MODULAR_YARD' -> CONSTRAINT(MIN_DURATION_BEFORE_NEXT_TRANSFER(30_DAYS))
reasoning: This rule places a time-based restriction on the movement and assignment of labor between different types of work locations, directly impacting where and when an employee can work. This falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Foreman Hiring Exception
rule_text: Not withstanding 7.01 (b), (c) and (d), Employees may be transferred, or name hired to be employed as Foremen or General Foremen subject to the following:
summary: The standard limits on transfers and name hires do not apply when hiring Foremen or General Foremen, provided certain conditions are met.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true -> OVERRIDE(HIRING_LIMITS)
reasoning: This rule provides a specific exception to the general labor assignment rules for a particular role (Foreman). As it governs how work is assigned, LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the correct classification.

name: Foreman ICCS Certification Requirement
rule_text: for the purposes of this Clause, Employees transferred, or name hired as Foremen or General Foremen shall be Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) certified effective May 1, 2017.
summary: Effective May 1, 2017, any employee transferred or name-hired as a Foreman or General Foreman must have an Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) certification.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND date >= '2017-05-01' -> REQUIRE(CERTIFICATION('ICCS'))
reasoning: This rule sets a qualification prerequisite for being assigned work as a Foreman. This condition for employment and work assignment places it within the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Foreman Minimum Pay Duration
rule_text: he/she will at no time be paid less than the Foreman's rate for which they qualify under Clause 25.02 (b) for a minimum of four (4) months from date of hire or transfer or until laid off if less than four (4) months.
summary: A newly hired or transferred Foreman must be paid at the Foreman's rate for at least four months, or until they are laid off if the job lasts less than four months.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true -> PAY_GUARANTEE(RATE('FOREMAN'), DURATION(MIN(4_MONTHS, UNTIL_LAYOFF)))
reasoning: This is a direct rule about pay rate and duration guarantees for a specific role. It defines compensation for time worked, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the correct topic.

name: Hiring Non-Discrimination - Journeymen
rule_text: On hiring, there shall be no distinction between Alberta and UA classified Journeymen Steam Fitters/Pipe Fitters except as allowed for in Clause 25.02 (a).
summary: Employers cannot differentiate between Alberta-certified and UA-classified Journeymen Steam Fitter/Pipe Fitters during the hiring process, unless specified otherwise in Clause 25.02(a).
logical_representation: IF employee_class == 'JOURNEYMAN' AND position_classification == 'PIPEFITTER' -> CONSTRAINT(NO_DISTINCTION_ON_HIRING('ALBERTA_VS_UA_CERT'))
reasoning: This rule concerns equal eligibility for hiring and work assignment based on certifications. It is a condition of employment, which is foundational to worked time, so LABOR_WORKED_TIME is the appropriate category.

name: Special Skills Hiring Exception
rule_text: Where there is a demonstrable need for special skills, talents, or where job conditions warrant, on particular job site(s) then by mutual agreement between the Business Manager of the Union and the Employer, the Employer shall be entitled to additional name hires or transfers.
summary: If a job requires special skills or has unique conditions, the employer can arrange for additional name hires or transfers by reaching a mutual agreement with the Union's Business Manager.
logical_representation: IF special_skills_needed (llm) == true AND mutual_agreement (llm) == true -> ALLOW(ADDITIONAL_NAME_HIRE_OR_TRANSFER)
reasoning: This rule provides an exception to standard hiring procedures for the purpose of assigning specialized labor to a project. As it governs the sourcing of workers, it falls under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: No Interruption of Earnings on Transfer
rule_text: Where transfers are permitted above, such transfers shall be working within the jurisdiction of the Union and there shall be no interruption of the Employees' earnings while being transferred.
summary: When an employee is transferred between job sites within the union's jurisdiction, their pay must continue without interruption during the transfer.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TRANSFER' -> PAY_GUARANTEE('NO_EARNINGS_INTERRUPTION')
reasoning: This rule guarantees continuous pay during a specific non-productive work-related activity (transferring). It is a rule about compensation for time, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the correct topic.

name: Inter-Company Transfer Prohibition
rule_text: Under no circumstances shall any Employer transfer Employees from one company to another company, without terminating the Employees and complying with the hiring procedures as set out above.
summary: Employers are prohibited from transferring employees directly to another company. The employee must first be terminated and then re-hired through the proper union dispatch procedures.
logical_representation: IF transfer_target == 'ANOTHER_COMPANY' -> PROHIBIT(TRANSFER) AND REQUIRE(TERMINATION_AND_REHIRE)
reasoning: This rule enforces the standard hiring protocol, which is the gateway to being assigned worked hours. It prevents circumvention of the system for allocating work, thus it is categorized under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Union Clearance for Hiring
rule_text: Except as provided for in Clause 7.08, the Employer agrees not to engage any person until clearance is given by the Union office or a dispatch from the Union office is presented.
summary: An employer cannot hire anyone without first receiving clearance or a dispatch slip from the union office, unless the union fails to supply workers as per Clause 7.08.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(HIRING_REQUIRES_UNION_CLEARANCE)
reasoning: This rule is a critical control in the process of assigning labor. It dictates a necessary step before any work can begin, making it a procedural rule related to LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Apprentice to Journeyman Ratio
rule_text: The Employer will maintain a minimum ratio of 25% of the number of Journeymen employed on all projects that have more than 14 journeymen employed by that Employer.
summary: On projects with more than 14 journeymen, the employer must maintain a workforce where apprentices make up at least 25% of the number of journeymen.
logical_representation: IF count(JOURNEYMAN) > 14 -> REQUIRE(RATIO(APPRENTICE/JOURNEYMAN >= 0.25))
reasoning: This rule mandates a specific composition of the workforce, dictating the allocation of work opportunities between different classes of employees. This is a rule governing the assignment of labor, fitting under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Online Orientation Pay
rule_text: If an Employer requires an employee to complete an employer online orientation, the Employer shall estimate a reasonable amount of time to complete the orientation. The Employer shall pay an allowance for completing the course equal to the time estimated, to a maximum of four (4) hours, multiplied by the employee's base rate only and payable with the first pay period following the start of work.
summary: If an employee must complete an online orientation, they will be paid an allowance for the estimated time it takes, up to a 4-hour maximum, at their base rate. This is paid with their first paycheck.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'ONBOARDING' -> PAY(MAX(4_HOURS, estimated_time (llm)) * BASE_RATE)
reasoning: This rule directly specifies payment for a required, non-productive activity (orientation). It defines compensation for a block of time, clearly falling under the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Online Orientation Pay Exclusions
rule_text: Payment for online orientation will not attract VSP or any benefit contributions.
summary: The payment received for completing online orientation is not subject to VSP or benefit contributions.
logical_representation: IF activity_type (Unsupported) == 'ONBOARDING' -> EXCLUDE_FROM_CALCULATION(['VSP', 'BENEFITS'])
reasoning: This rule clarifies the calculation of pay for a specific activity, defining what premiums or benefits apply to the compensated time. This is a core aspect of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Hiring from Other Sources
rule_text: Where the Employer has requested the Union office to furnish workers to perform work within the scope of this Agreement, and the required number of workers are not furnished within two (2) working days, after the date for which the workers are requested, the Employer shall have the right to procure the required number of workers from other available sources
summary: If the union cannot provide the requested number of workers within two working days, the employer is then permitted to hire workers from other sources.
logical_representation: IF union_supply_failed (llm) == true FOR 2_DAYS -> ALLOW(HIRING_FROM_OTHER_SOURCES)
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions under which an employer can bypass the standard union dispatch process. It is a critical exception in the rules for assigning labor, placing it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Layoff Priority - Union Members Last
rule_text: In reducing the number of Employees required, members of the appropriate Union(s) shall be the last to be laid off, depending on which jurisdictional area the Employer's project is located in.
summary: When layoffs occur, members of the relevant union must be the last employees to be laid off from the project.
logical_representation: IF employee_status (Unsupported) == 'LAID_OFF' -> PRIORITY(LAST, employee_membership_status (llm) == 'LOCAL_MEMBER')
reasoning: Layoff rules determine the cessation of work and pay for individuals. They are the inverse of hiring rules and are fundamentally about the allocation and termination of worked time, making LABOR_WORKED_TIME the correct topic.

name: Voluntary Layoff Order
rule_text: In such cases, this option will be offered to Local Union members first, travel card members second, and workers on permits third.
summary: When voluntary layoffs are offered, the option is given first to local union members, then to travel card members, and finally to workers on permits.
logical_representation: IF layoff_type (llm) == 'VOLUNTARY' -> SEQUENCE(1: 'LOCAL_MEMBER', 2: 'TRAVEL_CARD', 3: 'PERMIT')
reasoning: This rule establishes the priority for employees to cease work voluntarily. It is a procedural rule governing the reduction of the workforce, which relates to the management of worked time, thus falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Mandatory Layoff Sequence
rule_text:
Within these parameters, lay-offs will be carried out in the following sequence following any voluntary lay-offs as noted above:

REDUCTION IN CREWS

-  FIRST: Potential members (Permits)
-  SECOND: Travel Card members (Members of Sister United Association Locals)
-  THIRD: Members of the appropriate Union
summary: After any voluntary layoffs, mandatory layoffs must follow a specific sequence: first, permit workers are laid off; second, travel card members from other locals; and third, members of the local union.
logical_representation: IF layoff_type (llm) == 'MANDATORY' -> SEQUENCE(1: 'PERMIT', 2: 'TRAVEL_CARD', 3: 'LOCAL_MEMBER')
reasoning: This rule defines the mandatory order for workforce reduction. It is a key rule governing the termination of an individual's worked hours on a project, placing it squarely in the LABOR_WORKED_TIME category.

name: Reporting Pay (Show-Up Time)
rule_text: Members of the Union dispatched from the Union office reporting for work at the time and place specified by the Employer and who are not engaged by the Employer shall receive a minimum of two (2) hours locally or four (4) hours beyond 300 km reporting pay, plus travel allowance and expense, if applicable.
summary: If a dispatched union member reports to a job site as instructed but is not hired, they must be paid. They receive 2 hours of pay if the site is local, or 4 hours of pay if it is over 300 km away, plus any applicable travel allowances.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'NOT_ENGAGED' -> PAY(MIN(2_HOURS)) OR IF project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > 300 -> PAY(MIN(4_HOURS))
reasoning: This rule guarantees a minimum payment of hours when a worker reports for duty but no work is provided. This is a direct rule about the compensation of time, making it a clear case for the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Reporting Pay Ineligibility
rule_text: This Clause does not apply where the Employer has notified the Union(s) in a reasonable time that the Employee is not eligible for hire.
summary: Reporting pay is not required if the employer has provided the union with reasonable advance notice that the dispatched employee is not eligible for the job.
logical_representation: IF union_notified_of_ineligibility (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(REPORTING_PAY)
reasoning: This rule provides an exception to a guaranteed hours payment. It is a condition that negates a worked time entitlement, so it falls under the LABOR_WORKED_TIME classification.

name: Industrial H&W and ISIT Contribution Basis (Local 488)
rule_text: - 1) Calculate the Health and Welfare and "ISIT" contribution on hours earned
summary: For Industrial Work under Local 488, employer contributions for Health and Welfare (H&W) and ISIT funds are calculated based on total hours earned, not just hours worked.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND fund_type (llm) IN ['H&W', 'ISIT'] -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).EARNED)
reasoning: This rule specifies the calculation basis (hours earned) for monetary benefits, directly relating to how worked time is compensated.

name: Monthly Union Dues Calculation
rule_text: - 2) Monthly Union Dues = 3x base rate (maximum Journeyman Rate).
summary: Monthly union dues are calculated as three times the employee's base hourly rate, capped at the journeyman's base rate.
logical_representation: CALCULATE(monthly_union_dues) = 3 * MIN(base_rate (llm), journeyman_base_rate (llm))
reasoning: This rule defines a specific monetary deduction from employee wages, which is an integral part of their overall compensation structure.

name: Fraternal & Building Dues Deduction
rule_text: - 3) Fraternal & Building dues 18¢ are earned and to be deducted from wages and remitted at same time and in same manner as Union dues, per the most recent ratified ICI Collective Agreement.
summary: An amount of $0.18 per hour earned must be deducted from employee wages for Fraternal & Building dues and remitted with the regular union dues.
logical_representation: FOR each hour_earned -> DEDUCT($0.18) FOR fund_type('Fraternal & Building Dues')
reasoning: This rule specifies a per-hour monetary deduction, which is a component of the employee's net pay calculation based on hours worked/earned.

name: BTA Dues Deduction
rule_text: - 4) BTA dues of 6¢ per hour earned to be deducted from wages and remitted at same time and in same manner as Union dues.
summary: An amount of $0.06 per hour earned must be deducted from employee wages for BTA dues and remitted with the regular union dues.
logical_representation: FOR each hour_earned -> DEDUCT($0.06) FOR fund_type('BTA Dues')
reasoning: This rule defines a specific per-hour monetary deduction based on hours earned, directly affecting the employee's final pay.

name: Certified B Pressure Welder Premium
rule_text: - 5) B Pressure Welder with Alloy Certificates receive an additional $3.25 per hour worked.
summary: B Pressure Welders who hold Alloy Certificates are entitled to an additional premium of $3.25 for each hour they work.
logical_representation: IF position_classification == 'B_PRESSURE_WELDER' AND certification (llm) == 'ALLOY' -> PREMIUM($3.25) per hour_worked
reasoning: This rule establishes a wage premium based on a specific skill certification and hours worked, which is a direct modification of the labor rate.

name: UAW&O and National Wellness Contribution Basis
rule_text: - 6) UA National Wellness & Organization will be paid on hours worked .
summary: Employer contributions for the UA National Wellness & Organization fund are calculated based on hours worked.
logical_representation: IF fund_type (llm) IN ['UAW&O', 'NATIONAL_WELLNESS'] -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).WORKED)
reasoning: This rule specifies the calculation basis (hours worked) for a monetary benefit, which is part of how labor time is compensated.

name: Commercial/Institutional H&W Contribution Basis (Local 488)
rule_text: - 1) Calculate the Health and Welfare contribution on hours worked .
summary: For Commercial & Institutional Work under Local 488, employer contributions for the Health and Welfare (H&W) fund are calculated based on total hours worked.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND fund_type (llm) == 'H&W' -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).WORKED)
reasoning: This rule dictates the calculation basis (hours worked) for a monetary benefit contribution, tying compensation directly to labor time.

name: Commercial/Institutional ISIT Contribution Basis (Local 488)
rule_text: - 2) Calculate "ISIT" contribution on hours earned .
summary: For Commercial & Institutional Work under Local 488, employer contributions for the ISIT fund are calculated based on total hours earned.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' AND fund_type (llm) == 'ISIT' -> CALCULATE_CONTRIBUTION(basis=hours_basis (llm).EARNED)
reasoning: This rule determines how a specific monetary benefit is calculated based on hours, which is fundamental to labor compensation.

name: Instrument Mechanic H&W and ISIT Contribution Basis
