rule_text: 18.01 Employees who have completed the day's scheduled hours of work and left the jobsite to return home or to camp and who respond to a request to work additional time, shall be compensated as follows. (b) Employees who are called in and commence work shall be paid for a minimum of three (3) hours at the applicable overtime rate and any travel and transportation applicable.
summary: If an employee is called back to the jobsite after their shift and begins working, they are guaranteed a minimum payment of three hours at the overtime rate, plus any applicable travel and transportation costs.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND work_commenced (Unsupported) == true -> PAY(MIN(3) @ OT) AND PAY(TRAVEL)
reasoning: This rule defines a minimum payment for time worked under specific conditions (a call-out), which is a core concept of labor time calculation and compensation.

name: Call Out Pay for Actual Hours
rule_text: 18.02 Where an Employee works more than the three (3) hours set out in 18.01 (b) above, the Employee shall receive remuneration for the hours actually worked at the applicable overtime rates and any travel or transportation applicable.
summary: When call-out work lasts longer than the three-hour minimum, the employee will be paid for all hours actually worked at the overtime rate, rather than just the minimum.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND work_commenced (Unsupported) == true AND call_out_hours_worked (llm) > 3 -> PAY(call_out_hours_worked (llm) @ OT) AND PAY(TRAVEL)
reasoning: This rule clarifies the calculation of worked time beyond a minimum guarantee, specifying that actual hours are paid. This is a direct rule about how labor time is remunerated.

name: Rest Break Entitlement After Call Out
rule_text: 18.03 In the event that an Employee, responding to a call out does not get an eight (8) hour break, prior to the commencement of their regular workday, the Employee(s) shall be allowed an eight (8) hour rest break and be paid for a normally scheduled workday.
summary: If a call-out prevents an employee from having an eight-hour break before their next regular shift, they are entitled to an eight-hour rest break and will still be paid for that regular workday.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND rest_break_hours_prior_to_shift (llm) < 8 -> PROVIDE(REST_BREAK(8)) AND PAY(NORMAL_SCHEDULED_WORKDAY)
reasoning: This rule grants paid time (a normal workday's pay) as a consequence of a specific work event (insufficient rest after a call-out). It directly relates to compensation for time not worked, but due as an entitlement based on prior work, classifying it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Availability Requirement for Rest Break Pay
rule_text: To qualify for the normally scheduled days pay the Employee shall be available for work at the end of the eight (8) hour break.
summary: To receive pay for the normally scheduled workday that follows an insufficient rest break, the employee must be available to work immediately after their mandated eight-hour rest period ends.
logical_representation: IF is_call_out (llm) == true AND rest_break_hours_prior_to_shift (llm) < 8 AND is_available_for_work (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(PAY(NORMAL_SCHEDULED_WORKDAY))
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for a pay entitlement. It directly governs whether payment for a period of time is granted or forfeited, placing it within the scope of LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Shift Work Condition, Minimum Shifts Per Day
rule_text: when shift work is performed at least two (2) full shifts must be worked in any twenty-four (24) hour period
summary: To qualify as shift work, there must be at least two full shifts operating within a 24-hour period.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(number_of_shifts_in_24h (llm) >= 2)
reasoning: This rule establishes a condition for how time is categorized (as shift work vs. something else), which directly affects pay calculations.

name: Shift Work Penalty, Insufficient Duration
rule_text: Should each of the shifts outlined above not continue for a period of four (4) or five (5) consecutive working days, all hours worked shall be deemed overtime and paid at the applicable rates contained in this Agreement.
summary: If a shift schedule does not last for at least 5 consecutive days (or 4 for a 4x10 schedule), all hours worked on that shift must be paid as overtime.
logical_representation: IF (schedule_type == '5x8' AND shift_consecutive_days < 5) OR (schedule_type == '4x10' AND shift_consecutive_days < 4) -> PAY(ALL_HOURS_AS_OT)
reasoning: This rule directly dictates that time worked, which would normally be straight time, must be re-categorized and paid as overtime based on a specific condition.

name: Shift Premium on Partial Weeks
rule_text: Where a shift is commenced and has run for at least the four (4) or five (5) consecutive days referred to above, should the shift terminate in the middle of the week, or an Employee hires on in a week in which a shift ends, affected Employee(s) shall only be entitled to shift premium on regular hours of work.
summary: If a valid shift ends mid-week, or an employee starts mid-week on a shift that is ending, the shift premium is only paid on their regular (straight-time) hours for that week.
logical_representation: IF shift_end_midweek (llm) == true OR employee_status == 'NEW_HIRE' -> APPLY_PREMIUM(SHIFT_PREMIUM, ON_ST_HOURS_ONLY)
reasoning: This rule specifies how a pay premium (shift premium) is applied to hours worked, which is a core function of categorizing and calculating labor time and pay.

name: Shift Work Penalty Waiver, Mutual Agreement
rule_text: By mutual agreement, shifts may be established for periods of less than four (4) or five (5) consecutive regular working days and in such an event, the deemed overtime that would otherwise be payable shall not apply.
summary: The penalty of paying all hours as overtime for short shifts (less than 4 or 5 days) can be waived if there is mutual agreement to establish the shorter shift period.
logical_representation: IF (shift_consecutive_days < 4 OR shift_consecutive_days < 5) AND is_mutual_agreement (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(ALL_HOURS_AS_OT_PENALTY)
reasoning: This rule provides an exception to a significant pay rule (the overtime penalty), thereby changing how hours are categorized and paid.

name: First Shift Overtime Thresholds
rule_text: The first shift shall work a normal shift as set out in Clause 16.01 and/or 17.01 of this Agreement, with the applicable overtime rate after eight (8) hours of work or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week.
summary: For the first shift, overtime rates apply after 8 hours on a standard workday or after 10 hours on a compressed work week day.
logical_representation: IF (schedule_type == '5x8' AND daily_hours > 8) OR (schedule_type == '4x10' AND daily_hours > 10) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the daily thresholds for when straight time ends and overtime begins, which is a fundamental aspect of categorizing worked time.

name: Alternate Shift, Start Time Window
rule_text: Shift work other than the normal shift as outlined in Clause 19.03 may be utilized provided such shift(s) commence between 3.00 PM and 6.00 AM.
summary: Any shift other than the normal day shift is considered an alternate shift and must start between 3:00 PM and 6:00 AM.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(shift_start_time (llm) >= '15:00' AND shift_start_time (llm) <= '06:00')
reasoning: This rule defines the conditions under which a shift is categorized as an 'alternate shift', which has different pay rules.

name: Alternate Shift Premium, Effective May 2025
rule_text: The hourly rate for Employees on any alternate shift(s) as outlined above shall be $4.00 per hour effective May 4 th , 2025 greater than the applicable day time rate of pay.
summary: Effective May 4, 2025, employees working on an alternate shift receive a premium of $4.00 per hour above their regular daytime rate.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'ALTERNATE' AND validity_start_date >= '2025-05-04' AND validity_end_date <= '2026-05-02' -> PREMIUM($4.00)
reasoning: This is a direct rule about a pay premium applied to hours worked under specific shift conditions, with a specific effective date.

name: Alternate Shift Premium, Effective May 2026
rule_text: The hourly rate for Employees on any alternate shift(s) as outlined above shall be ... ($4.50 effective May 3, 2026) greater than the applicable day time rate of pay.
summary: Effective May 3, 2026, the premium for employees on an alternate shift increases to $4.50 per hour above their regular daytime rate.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'ALTERNATE' AND validity_start_date >= '2026-05-03' -> PREMIUM($4.50)
reasoning: This is a direct rule about a pay premium applied to hours worked under specific shift conditions, with a specific effective date.

name: Alternate Shift Rate Cap
rule_text: In no event shall this hourly rate be greater than the applicable overtime rate plus shift differential.
summary: The total straight-time hourly rate for an alternate shift (base rate plus shift premium) cannot exceed the employee's applicable overtime rate plus the shift differential.
logical_representation: IF shift_type == 'ALTERNATE' -> CONSTRAINT(total_hourly_rate (llm) <= ot_rate (llm) + shift_differential (llm))
reasoning: This rule places a cap on the calculation of pay for worked time, which is a key part of labor time rules.

name: Maximum One Straight Time Shift Per 24 Hours
rule_text: No Employee shall work more than one (1) straight time shift in each consecutive twenty-four (24) hour period.
summary: An employee is not allowed to work more than one straight-time shift in any 24-hour period.
logical_representation: CONSTRAINT(number_of_st_shifts_in_24h (llm) <= 1)
reasoning: This rule constrains how work can be scheduled and paid at straight time, implying any additional work would be overtime. It's about categorizing hours.

name: Pay During Insufficient Rest Period
rule_text: An Employee shall continue to receive the overtime rate, plus shift differential, after each shift until a break of eight (8) consecutive hours occurs, exclusive of travel allowance.
summary: If an employee does not receive a break of at least 8 consecutive hours between shifts, all hours worked until that break occurs will be paid at the overtime rate, plus shift differential.
logical_representation: IF hours_between_shifts (llm) < 8 -> PAY(OT_RATE + SHIFT_DIFFERENTIAL)
reasoning: This rule dictates that time is paid as overtime based on the duration of the rest period, directly impacting the categorization and pay of worked hours.

name: Lost Day Pay Due to Shift Change
rule_text: When an Employee loses a regular day through the implementation or termination of shift work, then the Employee shall be paid a regular days pay for the day lost.
summary: An employee who loses a regular workday because a shift schedule is being started or ended will be paid for that lost day at their regular rate.
logical_representation: IF is_day_lost_due_to_shift_change (llm) == true -> PAY(REGULAR_DAY_PAY)
reasoning: This rule provides a payment guarantee for time not worked but lost due to scheduling, which falls under labor time rules.

name: Irregular Single Shift Operation
rule_text: Where the owner/client may require work to be done on a single shift basis at start/quit times that may be at variance with the start/quit for a regular shift, single shift operations shall be permitted subject to the payment of shift differential.
summary: Single shifts with non-standard start and end times are permitted if the client requires them, provided a shift differential is paid.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true -> PAY(SHIFT_DIFFERENTIAL)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific type of work arrangement and ties it directly to a payment requirement (shift differential), which is part of labor time and pay calculation.

name: Irregular Single Shift Differential Application
rule_text: The shift differential shall be paid on all hours worked.
summary: For irregular single shifts, the shift differential must be paid on all hours worked during that shift.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true -> APPLY_PREMIUM(SHIFT_DIFFERENTIAL, ON_ALL_HOURS)
reasoning: This rule specifies how a pay premium is applied to hours worked in a special scenario.

name: Irregular Single Shift Daily Overtime
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day, or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week, and forty (40) hours per week and on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
summary: For irregular single shifts, overtime is paid for hours worked beyond 8 per day on a standard schedule, or beyond 10 per day on a compressed work week.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true AND ((schedule_type == '5x8' AND daily_hours > 8) OR (schedule_type == '4x10' AND daily_hours > 10)) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the daily overtime thresholds for a specific work condition.

name: Irregular Single Shift Weekly Overtime
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day, or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week, and forty (40) hours per week and on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
summary: For irregular single shifts, overtime is paid for all hours worked beyond 40 in a week.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true AND weekly_hours > 40 -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule defines the weekly overtime threshold for a specific work condition.

name: Irregular Single Shift Weekend and Holiday Overtime
rule_text: Overtime shall be payable on all hours in excess of eight (8) hours per day, or in excess of ten (10) hours per day during a compressed work week, and forty (40) hours per week and on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays.
summary: For irregular single shifts, all hours worked on Saturdays, Sundays, or Statutory Holidays are paid as overtime.
logical_representation: IF is_irregular_single_shift (Unsupported) == true AND (day_of_week IN ['SAT', 'SUN'] OR is_stat_holiday == true) -> TRANSITION(OT)
reasoning: This rule categorizes all time worked on specific days as overtime.

name: Overtime Meal Entitlement after 10 Hours
rule_text: Where Employees are required to work in excess of ten (10) hours in a single shift, they shall be provided immediately after ten (10) hours, with a suitable meal (hot where possible) and every four (4) hours thereafter until the shift is ended.
summary: Employees who work more than 10 hours in a single shift must be provided with a meal immediately after the 10th hour, and another meal every 4 hours thereafter until the shift concludes.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 -> PROVIDE(meal) AND IF (daily_hours - 10) % 4 == 0 -> PROVIDE(meal)
reasoning: This rule establishes the primary trigger (working over 10 hours) for an employee to receive a meal, which is a core component of meal allowance entitlements.

name: Payment for Overtime Meal and Consumption Time
rule_text: The cost of the meal(s) and the time consuming same shall be paid for at the straight time rates contained in this Agreement, to a maximum of one half (½) hour in duration.
summary: The employer pays for the overtime meal and also pays the employee at their straight-time rate for up to 30 minutes of time spent consuming it.
logical_representation: IF meal_provided (llm) == true -> PAY(cost_of_meal) AND PAY(ST, MAX(0.5))
reasoning: This rule details the financial compensation associated with the provided meal, including paying for the meal itself and the time to eat it, which falls under the meal allowance topic.

name: Overtime Meal Application with Subsistence
rule_text: Where the Employer is paying subsistence, this clause shall also apply.
summary: The overtime meal entitlement applies even when an employee is also receiving a subsistence allowance from the employer.
logical_representation: IF is_receiving_subsistence (llm) == true -> APPLY_RULE('20.01')
reasoning: This rule clarifies that one type of allowance (subsistence) does not negate the entitlement to another (overtime meal), making it a condition of the meal allowance.

name: Allowance When Meal Provision is Impractical
rule_text: On projects when it is impractical for the contractor to provide a meal the employee shall be paid a 15-minute paid break at the applicable rate of pay and the employer shall pay a meal allowance of $45.00 in lieu of the meal and the time to consume the meal.
summary: If it is impractical for the employer to provide a meal, the employee will receive a $45.00 meal allowance and a 15-minute paid break at their applicable pay rate instead.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 AND is_meal_provision_impractical (llm) == true -> PAY(0.25, applicable_rate) AND ALLOWANCE($45.00)
reasoning: This rule defines the specific monetary allowance and paid break provided as a substitute for a meal, directly relating to meal allowance policy.

name: Camp Accommodation Meal Exception
rule_text: Where a shift in excess of 10 hours but not longer than 12 hours is worked, when camp accommodations are provided and a full course hot supper is provided at the end of the shift, no meal allowance shall be payable.
summary: For shifts between 10 and 12 hours, if the employer provides camp accommodations and a full hot supper after the shift, no overtime meal allowance is required.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 10 AND daily_hours <= 12 AND camp_accommodations_provided (llm) == true AND hot_supper_provided (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance)
reasoning: This rule specifies conditions under which an employee is not entitled to a meal allowance, making it an exception rule within the meal allowance category.

name: Break Time Adjustment with Camp Accommodation
rule_text: When such shifts are worked, break times may be adjusted for efficiency and reasonableness. In such cases the Union will be notified prior to the breaks being adjusted.
summary: For shifts where the camp accommodation meal exception applies, break times can be adjusted for efficiency, provided the Union is notified beforehand.
logical_representation: IF camp_accommodations_provided (llm) == true AND daily_hours > 10 AND daily_hours <= 12 -> PERMIT(adjust_breaks) AND NOTIFY(union)
reasoning: This rule concerns the scheduling and modification of breaks within the workday, which falls under the management of worked time.

name: Unscheduled Overtime Meal Grace Period
rule_text: Recognizing emergency or unplanned situations may arise intermittently, if the Contractor has not scheduled in excess of the ten (10) hour shift, the Contractor shall be granted a one (1) hour extension where the Contractor need not supply a hot meal or make payment in lieu of
summary: For unplanned or emergency overtime that extends a shift beyond 10 hours, the employer has a one-hour grace period (up to the 11th hour) where they are not required to provide a meal or pay an allowance.
logical_representation: IF is_shift_overtime_scheduled (llm) == false AND daily_hours > 10 AND daily_hours <= 11 -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance)
reasoning: This rule creates a specific exception to the meal allowance obligation based on the unplanned nature of the work, directly modifying meal allowance rules.

name: Paid Break During Unscheduled Overtime
rule_text: however; a fifteen (15) minute rest break paid at the applicable rate will be taken at the tenth (10 th ) hour.
summary: During the one-hour grace period for unscheduled overtime, employees must still receive a 15-minute paid rest break at their applicable rate at the 10-hour mark.
logical_representation: IF is_shift_overtime_scheduled (llm) == false AND daily_hours >= 10 -> PROVIDE(paid_break, 0.25, applicable_rate)
reasoning: This rule mandates a paid rest break, which is a component of compensated work time, and therefore falls under the category of labor worked time.

name: Maximum Hours without Overtime Meal
rule_text: Under no circumstance shall any Employee work more than eleven (11) hours without adherence to Clause 20.01.
summary: An employee cannot, under any circumstances, work more than 11 hours without the main overtime meal rule (20.01) being applied. The one-hour grace period for unplanned work cannot extend beyond this limit.
logical_representation: IF daily_hours > 11 -> APPLY_RULE('20.01')
reasoning: This rule sets a hard limit after which meal allowance provisions are mandatory, functioning as a final condition for meal allowance entitlement.

name: Supervisor Work Extension Meal Exception
rule_text: Where a supervisor is required to; (i) start up to one (1) hour earlier, or (ii) finish up to one (1) hour later, or (iii) start up to one half (½) hour earlier and finish up to one half (½) hour later than the supervisor's crew, for the purposes of organizing work or facilitating a transition to another shift, the provisions of 20.01 will not apply unless those provisions are applicable to the rest of the crew.
summary: If a supervisor works extra time (e.g., up to one hour early or late) for organizational duties, they are not entitled to overtime meals unless the rest of their crew also qualifies for them.
logical_representation: IF is_foreman == true AND supervisor_extra_hours (llm) <= 1 AND crew_meal_eligibility (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(meal_allowance)
reasoning: This rule provides a role-specific exemption from the standard meal allowance provisions, making it an exception rule within the meal allowance topic.

name: Show Up Time Minimum Pay Guarantee
rule_text: 21.01 When an Employee reports to work at the regular starting time and such Employee is not put to work,  the  Employee  so  affected  shall  be  entitled  to  a  minimum  of  two  (2)  hours  pay  at  the applicable rate of pay.
summary: If an employee reports for their regular shift but is not put to work, they are entitled to a minimum of two hours of pay at their applicable rate.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'NOT_STARTED' -> MIN(2_HOURS_PAY)
reasoning: This rule establishes a minimum guaranteed payment for time when an employee shows up for work, which is a core concept of how labor time is accounted for and paid, fitting under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Show Up Time Jobsite Presence Condition
rule_text: 21.02 In  order  to  qualify  for  show  up  time,  Employees  must  remain  on  the  jobsite  unless  otherwise directed by the Employer.
summary: To be eligible for show-up pay, employees must remain on the jobsite unless their employer instructs them to leave.
logical_representation: IF employee_location_status (llm) != 'ON_JOBSITE' AND employer_directed_to_leave (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(SHOW_UP_PAY)
reasoning: This rule outlines a condition for receiving the minimum time guarantee (show-up pay), making it an integral part of the LABOR_WORKED_TIME rules.

name: Show Up Time Extended Wait Time Pay
rule_text: 21.02 ...Where the Employee(s) are directed to remain at the jobsite for more than two (2) hours, including wait times for company supplied transportation to leave site, they shall be paid for such time at the applicable rate.
summary: If employees are required by the employer to wait on the jobsite for more than two hours (including waiting for company transport), they must be paid for that entire waiting period.
logical_representation: IF wait_time_on_site_hours (llm) > 2 -> PAY(wait_time_on_site_hours (llm))
reasoning: This rule defines a condition under which waiting time becomes paid time, directly impacting the calculation of hours worked or paid, which is central to LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Show Up Time Entitlement to Daily Allowances
rule_text: 21.03 Employee(s)  affected  shall  be  paid  daily  travel,  transportation,  subsistence  or  receive  camp accommodation as is applicable.
summary: Employees who qualify for show-up pay are also entitled to receive their applicable daily travel, transportation, subsistence, or camp accommodation benefits for that day.
logical_representation: IF qualifies_for_show_up_time (llm) == true -> PROVIDE(APPLICABLE_DAILY_ALLOWANCES)
reasoning: The primary outcome of this rule is the provision of subsistence, travel, or accommodation allowances. Although triggered by a time-based event (show-up), the benefit itself falls squarely under LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE.

name: Show Up Time Cancellation Notice Exception
rule_text: 21.04 An Employee is not entitled to show up time if the Employer notifies the Employee that no work is available at least two (2) hours prior to the commencement of the normal workday.
summary: An employee is not eligible for show-up pay if their employer notifies them of a work cancellation at least two hours before the normal start of their workday.
logical_representation: IF cancellation_notice_hours_prior (llm) >= 2 -> FORFEIT(SHOW_UP_PAY)
reasoning: This rule specifies an exception condition that negates the minimum time payment guarantee. It's a conditional rule governing time-based pay, thus it belongs to LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Show Up Time Camp Worker Cancellation Notice
rule_text: 21.04 ...Employees working on a jobsite where they are accommodated in a camp facility will not be entitled to show up time if they are notified that no work is available, at breakfast time, and notices are posted on the bulletin boards in the camp kitchen.
summary: Employees living in a camp are not entitled to show-up pay if they are notified of no work at breakfast time via a notice posted on the camp kitchen bulletin board.
logical_representation: IF is_camp_based_employee (llm) == true AND cancellation_notice_timing (llm) == 'BREAKFAST_TIME' AND cancellation_notice_method (llm) == 'POSTED_NOTICE' -> FORFEIT(SHOW_UP_PAY)
reasoning: This is a specific exception to the show-up pay guarantee, which is a minimum time payment. The rule defines how this time-based entitlement can be forfeited, placing it under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Show Up Time Inclusion of Shift Premium
rule_text: 21.05 When an Employee reporting for work qualifies for show up time such time shall include the regular shift premium when applicable.
summary: If an employee qualifies for show-up time and their shift normally includes a premium, that premium must be included in the calculation of their show-up pay.
logical_representation: IF qualifies_for_show_up_time (llm) == true AND has_shift_premium (llm) == true -> APPLY_PAY_RULES(PREMIUM_INCLUDED_IN_RATE)
reasoning: This rule details the calculation method for a minimum time payment (show-up pay), specifying that the rate must include premiums. This directly relates to the rules for calculating pay for labor time, fitting it within LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Local Resident Definition
rule_text: A local resident is an individual who resides within a seventy-five (75) kilometer radius of the  centre  of  a  job  site  which  is  beyond  daily  commuting  distance  from  Edmonton  or Calgary or other locations where a hiring hall is located and, has resided within such radius of the site for a period of not less than six months prior to being engaged on the project.
summary: A 'local resident' is defined as someone who has lived for at least six months within a 75 km radius of a remote job site before being hired for the project.
logical_representation: IF job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND residency_duration_months (llm) >= 6 AND project_distance_from_hiring_hall (Unsupported) > daily_commuting_distance -> is_local_resident (Unsupported) = true
reasoning: This rule defines the criteria for being a 'local resident', which is the primary condition determining eligibility for various subsistence and travel-related allowances.

name: Local Resident Entitlement Exclusion (0-45km)
rule_text: Local Residents residing within a forty-five (45) km radius of the job site shall not be entitled to receive transportation or vehicle allowance, travel allowance, initial and return travel allowance, room and board, subsistence, camp accommodations, or rotational leave provisions.
summary: Local residents who live within a 45 km radius of the job site are not eligible for transportation, travel, accommodation, subsistence, or rotational leave benefits.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 45 -> FORFEIT(transportation_allowance) AND FORFEIT(travel_allowance) AND FORFEIT(room_and_board) AND FORFEIT(subsistence) AND FORFEIT(camp_accommodations) AND FORFEIT(rotational_leave)
reasoning: The rule explicitly removes entitlement to subsistence, accommodation, and travel allowances based on the employee's proximity to the job site, which is a core function of subsistence rules.

name: Industrial Local Resident Entitlement Exclusion (45-75km)
rule_text: INDUSTRIAL ONLY Local residents residing between a forty-five (45) km radius and a seventy-five (75) km radius of the job site shall not be entitled to receive initial and return travel allowance, room and board or subsistence, or camp accommodations, or rotational leave provisions
summary: On industrial projects, local residents living between 45 km and 75 km of the job site are not eligible for initial/return travel, room and board, subsistence, camp, or rotational leave benefits.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 -> FORFEIT(initial_return_travel) AND FORFEIT(room_and_board) AND FORFEIT(subsistence) AND FORFEIT(camp_accommodations) AND FORFEIT(rotational_leave)
reasoning: This rule explicitly removes entitlement to major subsistence and accommodation benefits for a specific group of workers, which is a core part of the subsistence allowance topic.

name: Industrial Local Resident Travel Allowance (45-75km)
rule_text: Local residents residing between a forty-five (45) km radius and a seventy-five (75) km radius of the job site... shall be paid a travel allowance of thirty-three dollars ($33.00) per day worked ($36.00 per day worked effective May 4/09) to cover transportation expenses and travel allowance
summary: On industrial projects, local residents living between 45 km and 75 km of the site receive a travel allowance of $33.00 per day worked, which increased to $36.00 per day worked effective May 4, 2009.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND validity_start_date >= '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($36.00/day_worked) | IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND validity_start_date < '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($33.00/day_worked)
reasoning: This rule provides a specific daily monetary allowance for travel, which is a form of subsistence compensation for non-camp-eligible workers.

name: Industrial Local Resident Travel Allowance with Employer Transport (45-75km)
rule_text: or if transportation is supplied by the Employer, a daily travel allowance of seventeen dollars ($17.00) ($19.00 per day worked effective May 4/09) will be paid for each day worked.
summary: On industrial projects, if the employer provides transportation for local residents living 45-75 km from the site, the daily travel allowance is reduced to $17.00, which increased to $19.00 effective May 4, 2009.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND transportation_provider (llm) == 'EMPLOYER' AND validity_start_date >= '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($19.00/day_worked) | IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 75 AND transportation_provider (llm) == 'EMPLOYER' AND validity_start_date < '2009-05-04' -> ALLOWANCE($17.00/day_worked)
reasoning: This rule modifies a daily travel allowance based on whether transportation is provided, directly relating to subsistence and travel compensation.

name: Fort McMurray Area Local Resident Definition
rule_text: For the purposes of determining local residents in the Fort McMurray area, residents of Anzac and Saprae Creek will be considered to be residents of Fort McMurray for projects north of Fort McMurray and residents of Fort McKay will be considered to be residents of Fort McMurray for projects located south of Fort McMurray
summary: For projects near Fort McMurray, residency rules are adjusted: Anzac/Saprae Creek residents count as Fort McMurray residents for projects to the north, and Fort McKay residents count as Fort McMurray residents for projects to the south.
logical_representation: IF (project_location (Unsupported) == 'NORTH_OF_FORT_MCMURRAY' AND employee_residence_location (llm) IN ['Anzac', 'Saprae Creek']) OR (project_location (Unsupported) == 'SOUTH_OF_FORT_MCMURRAY' AND employee_residence_location (llm) == 'Fort McKay') -> SET(residency_location_for_calculation, 'Fort McMurray')
reasoning: This rule provides a location-specific modification to the definition of 'local resident', which directly impacts eligibility for subsistence and travel allowances.

name: Local Resident Noon Meal from Camp Kitchen
rule_text: Where a Camp Kitchen is established, and where all workers generally on the project who are not Local Residents attend at the Camp Kitchen to eat their lunches a Local Resident Employee shall be provided the same noon meal without cost to himself.
summary: If a camp kitchen is available and used by non-local workers for lunch, local resident employees are also entitled to receive the same noon meal for free.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND camp_kitchen_status (llm) == 'ESTABLISHED_AND_USED' -> PROVIDE(noon_meal)
reasoning: This rule dictates the provision of a meal under specific circumstances, which is the core definition of the meal allowance topic.

name: Local Resident Hot Soup with Bagged Lunches
rule_text: In those instances where bagged lunches are provided to camp residents and hot soup is delivered to the jobsite, local residents shall be entitled to pick up hot soup as well.
summary: When camp residents receive bagged lunches and hot soup is delivered to the worksite, local residents are also entitled to get the hot soup.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND meal_provision_type (llm) == 'BAGGED_LUNCH_WITH_HOT_SOUP' -> PROVIDE(hot_soup)
reasoning: This rule provides an entitlement to a specific food item as part of a meal provision, directly falling under the meal allowance category.

name: Local Resident Overtime Meal Entitlement
rule_text: Where a Local Resident Employee is required to work overtime, he shall be entitled to overtime meals in accordance with this Agreement.
summary: Local resident employees who work overtime are entitled to overtime meals as specified elsewhere in the collective agreement.
logical_representation: IF is_local_resident (Unsupported) == true AND daily_overtime_hours > 0 -> APPLY_PAY_RULES('OVERTIME_MEALS')
reasoning: This rule establishes eligibility for overtime meals, which is a key component of meal allowance regulations.

name: Union Membership Requirement (Industrial)
rule_text: General  Foremen,  Foremen,  Journeymen,  and  Apprentices  must  be  members  of  the appropriate Union.
summary: On Industrial projects, all General Foremen, Foremen, Journeymen, and Apprentices must be members of the appropriate union.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND (employee_class IN ['JOURNEYMAN', 'APPRENTICE'] OR is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) -> REQUIREMENT(UNION_MEMBERSHIP)
reasoning: This rule establishes a fundamental condition for employment and labor provision, which is a prerequisite for any time worked to be valid under the agreement. Therefore, it falls under the scope of rules governing worked time.

name: Foreman UA Certification Requirement (Industrial)
rule_text: It is further recognized that all the Steam Fitter-Pipe Fitter General Foremen and Foremen must be a UA certified Journeymen as designated by the Joint Educational Trust Fund Trustees.
summary: On Industrial projects, all Steam Fitter-Pipe Fitter General Foremen and Foremen must be UA certified Journeymen.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND position_classification == 'STEAM_FITTER_PIPE_FITTER' AND (is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) -> REQUIREMENT(UA_CERTIFIED_JOURNEYMAN)
reasoning: This rule defines a mandatory qualification for a specific role. Since this qualification is necessary for a person to hold a position and for their time to be billed at that position's rate, it is categorized under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Foreman Wage Premium (Industrial)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $5.50 per hour above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, Foremen receive a minimum premium of $5.50 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_foreman == true -> PREMIUM($5.50)
reasoning: This rule directly specifies a wage premium, which is a core component of how worked time is calculated and paid. It is a classic LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium (Industrial)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $7.50 per hour, above the basic UA Journeyman Industrial rates as listed in Article 8.01 of this Agreement.
summary: On Industrial projects, General Foremen receive a minimum premium of $7.50 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_general_foreman (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($7.50)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium for a role, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs for worked time.

name: ICCS Premium (Industrial)
rule_text: Foremen and General Foremen who are Industrial Construction Crew Supervisor (ICCS) designated will be paid additional premiums of one ($1.50) dollar and fifty cents per hour.
summary: On Industrial projects, Foremen and General Foremen with an ICCS designation receive an additional premium of $1.50 per hour.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND (is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) AND iccs_designated (llm) == true -> PREMIUM($1.50)
reasoning: This rule adds another layer to the wage calculation for specific individuals, making it a clear LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: ICCS Premium Rate Cap
rule_text: In no event shall this hourly rate be greater than the applicable overtime rate plus the ICCS premium
summary: The total hourly rate for an ICCS-designated supervisor must not exceed the applicable overtime rate plus the $1.50 ICCS premium.
logical_representation: IF iccs_designated (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(hourly_rate (llm) <= overtime_rate (llm) + 1.50)
reasoning: This rule sets a ceiling on the total calculated wage under certain conditions, making it a rule that governs the final value of worked time.

name: Apprentice as Foreman Prohibition (Industrial)
rule_text: Apprentices shall not be elevated to the position of Foremen or be authorized to direct any portion of the working force.
summary: On Industrial projects, Apprentices cannot be promoted to Foreman or be authorized to supervise other workers.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> CONSTRAINT(CANNOT_BE_FOREMAN)
reasoning: This rule restricts roles based on employee classification, which directly affects crew composition, supervision, and ultimately, labor costs. It's a rule about who can perform and bill for certain types of work time.

name: Foreman Supervision Ratio (Industrial)
rule_text: The average number of Journeymen under the supervision of a Foreman shall be twelve (12).
summary: On Industrial projects, the average number of Journeymen supervised by a single Foreman should be twelve.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> TARGET_RATIO(journeyman_count (llm) / foreman_count (llm) == 12)
reasoning: This rule defines staffing ratios, which are critical for determining the required number of supervisors for a given crew size. This directly impacts labor costs and is therefore classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Second Foreman Requirement (Industrial)
rule_text: The Employer agrees that there shall be two (2) Foremen once there are fourteen (14) Journeymen on the job.
summary: On Industrial projects, a second Foreman is required as soon as there are 14 Journeymen on the job.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND journeyman_count (llm) >= 14 -> REQUIREMENT(foreman_count (llm) >= 2)
reasoning: This is a specific, mandatory staffing rule triggered by the number of workers. It directly dictates the number of paid supervisors, impacting labor costs for worked time.

name: Welder Foreman Requirement at 15 Welders (Industrial)
rule_text: On projects requiring a minimum of fifteen (15) Welders; there shall be a Qualified 'A' or 'B' Welder employed as a Welder Foreman when fifteen (15) welders are employed.
summary: On Industrial projects with at least 15 welders, a qualified Welder Foreman must be employed.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) >= 15 -> REQUIREMENT(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 1)
reasoning: This rule mandates the hiring of a specific supervisory role based on the number of trade-specific workers, directly impacting labor costs and crew composition.

name: Second Welder Foreman Requirement at 25 Welders (Industrial)
rule_text: An additional Welder Foreman will be employed when twenty-five (25) welders are employed
summary: On Industrial projects, a second Welder Foreman is required when 25 welders are employed.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) >= 25 -> REQUIREMENT(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 2)
reasoning: This rule sets another specific threshold for adding supervisory staff, which directly affects the calculation of total labor cost for the project.

name: Subsequent Welder Foreman Ratio (Industrial)
rule_text: and  one  (1)  Welder  Foreman  for  every  twenty  (20)  Welders  employed  thereafter.
summary: On Industrial projects, after the first 25 welders, one additional Welder Foreman is required for every additional 20 welders.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND welder_count (llm) > 25 -> REQUIREMENT(welder_foreman_count (llm) >= 2 + FLOOR((welder_count (llm) - 25) / 20))
reasoning: This rule establishes a scalable staffing formula for supervision based on crew size, directly impacting labor costs. It is a core LABOR_WORKED_TIME rule.

name: Welder Foreman Training Preference (Industrial)
rule_text: Whenever  possible  such  Welder  Foreman  shall  have  taken  and  passed  the  'Welder Foreman Training Program' as developed between the Parties.
summary: Whenever possible, Welder Foremen on Industrial projects should have completed the 'Welder Foreman Training Program'.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' AND is_welder_foreman (llm) == true -> PREFERENCE(TRAINING_COMPLETED('Welder Foreman Training Program'))
reasoning: This rule specifies a preferred qualification for a role. While not a strict mandate ('whenever possible'), it sets a standard for the position which relates to the quality and cost of labor, thus falling under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Union Membership Requirement (Commercial/Institutional)
rule_text: General Foremen, Foremen, Journeymen and Apprentices must be members of the appropriate Union
summary: All General Foremen, Foremen, Journeymen, and Apprentices on Commercial or Institutional projects must be members of the appropriate union.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND (employee_class IN ['JOURNEYMAN', 'APPRENTICE'] OR is_foreman == true OR is_general_foreman (llm) == true) -> REQUIREMENT(UNION_MEMBERSHIP)
reasoning: Similar to the Industrial rule, this establishes a fundamental condition for employment, making it a prerequisite for any worked time to be valid under the agreement.

name: Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 488)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $4.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 488, Foremen receive a minimum premium of $4.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_foreman == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' -> PREMIUM($4.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 488)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $4.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 488 of this Agreement.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 488, General Foremen receive a minimum premium of $6.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_general_foreman (llm) == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '488' -> PREMIUM($6.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 496)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $3.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 496, Foremen receive a minimum premium of $3.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_foreman == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '496' -> PREMIUM($3.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: General Foreman Wage Premium (Commercial/Institutional - Local 496)
rule_text: The minimum rate of wages for a Foreman shall be $3.00 per hour and the minimum rate of wages for a General Foreman shall be $6.00 per hour, above the basic Journeyman rates as listed in Schedule 8.01 Commercial & Institutional Local 496 of this Agreement
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects under Local 496, General Foremen receive a minimum premium of $6.00 per hour above the basic Journeyman rate.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND is_general_foreman (llm) == true AND union_local (Unsupported) == '496' -> PREMIUM($6.00)
reasoning: This rule defines a specific wage premium based on role, project type, and union local, directly impacting the calculation of labor costs.

name: Apprentice as Foreman Prohibition (Commercial/Institutional)
rule_text: Apprentices shall not be elevated to the position of Foremen.
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, Apprentices cannot be promoted to Foreman.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] AND employee_class == 'APPRENTICE' -> CONSTRAINT(CANNOT_BE_FOREMAN)
reasoning: This rule restricts roles based on employee classification, which affects crew composition and labor costs, placing it within the LABOR_WORKED_TIME topic.

name: Foreman Supervision Ratio (Commercial/Institutional)
rule_text: The average number of Journeymen under the supervision of a Foreman shall be twelve (12).
summary: On Commercial or Institutional projects, the average number of Journeymen supervised by a single Foreman should be twelve.
logical_representation: IF project_type IN ['COMMERCIAL', 'INSTITUTIONAL'] -> TARGET_RATIO(journeyman_count (llm) / foreman_count (llm) == 12)
reasoning: This rule defines staffing ratios, which are critical for determining the required number of supervisors for a given crew size. This directly impacts labor costs and is therefore classified under LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Daily Travel Free Zone
rule_text: A forty-five (45) kilometer radius free zone from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary; (Geodetic Monument) or around any place in which Employees are temporarily domiciled by the Employer shall be established. The location of the Geodetic Monument for Edmonton is 101 Street and Jasper Avenue and for Calgary, the Calgary Tower. No transportation or travel allowance shall be applicable within the free zone
summary: A 45 km radius 'free zone' is established around the centers of Edmonton, Calgary, or any employer-provided temporary housing. No travel allowance or transportation is provided for work within this zone.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 45 -> FORFEIT(travel_allowance) AND FORFEIT(transportation)
reasoning: This rule defines a geographic area where travel allowances are explicitly denied, which is a core condition for subsistence and travel-related entitlements.

name: Major Project Transportation Review in Free Zone
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, on major construction projects located within the free zone, around the cities of Edmonton and Calgary, but beyond the city bus transportation system of those cities, where it is expected that the total construction workforce will exceed 500, the  affected  parties  shall  meet  to  discuss  the  viability  of  implementing  a  system  of providing transportation to the site.
summary: For major construction projects (over 500 workers) inside the free zone but outside city bus routes, the parties must meet to discuss providing transportation to the site.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 45 AND is_on_bus_route (llm) == false AND workforce_size (llm) > 500 -> OBLIGATION(discuss_transportation_provision)
reasoning: This rule outlines an obligation related to providing transportation, which is a form of travel entitlement, falling under the broader category of subsistence and travel allowances.

name: Paid Travel Time for Long Bus Transit
rule_text: Workers shall be paid an allowance for time regularly and routinely in excess of forty five minutes each way, for travel within the applicable free zone.  The allowance shall be calculated on the regular straight time base rate of each worker.  The allowance will be paid only to workers who ride on the provided buses, and only for the days on which they ride the buses.
summary: If the bus transit time between a camp and a site within the free zone exceeds 45 minutes each way, workers who use the bus are paid for the excess time at their regular straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF is_using_provided_bus (llm) == true AND travel_time_each_way_minutes (llm) > 45 -> PAY((travel_time_each_way_minutes (llm) - 45) * 2 / 60 * base_rate)
reasoning: This rule provides payment calculated from an employee's hourly base rate for time spent in transit, which classifies it as a form of paid labor time.

name: Employer Daily Travel Options Beyond Free Zone
rule_text: For projects beyond the forty-five kilometer (45 km) free zone for which daily travel is required, the Employer will have the following options;  to provide transportation and pay travel allowance, or  reimburse the Employees, as a vehicle allowance, ( See Travel Allowance Memo at www.clra.org) per kilometer traveled, each way between the edge of the free zone and the project job site daily and pay travel allowance.
summary: For daily travel to projects beyond the 45 km free zone, the employer can either provide transportation plus a travel allowance, or pay employees both a vehicle allowance per kilometer and a travel allowance.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 45 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(transport) + ALLOWANCE(travel), ALLOWANCE(vehicle) + ALLOWANCE(travel))
reasoning: This rule outlines the employer's options for providing travel-related compensation, which falls under the category of subsistence and travel allowances.

name: Travel Allowance Calculation Method
rule_text: The travel allowance shall be calculated based on traveling at 80 km per hour, at the Employee's applicable base rate, from the point where the edge of the 45 km radius free zone intersects the road which takes the shortest, most appropriate route, to the project and return to the intersecting point.
summary: Travel allowance is calculated based on the time it would take to travel from the edge of the 45 km free zone to the project and back, at a speed of 80 km/h, paid at the employee's base rate.
logical_representation: IF distance_from_free_zone_edge_km (llm) > 0 -> PAY((distance_from_free_zone_edge_km (llm) * 2 / 80) * base_rate)
reasoning: The allowance is calculated based on hours of travel paid at the employee's base rate, making it a payment for time, which aligns with LABOR_WORKED_TIME.

name: Vehicle Allowance Rate Determination
rule_text: The Coordinating Committee and the Alberta Building Trades Council shall examine, during January of each year of the Collective Agreement, the information published by Canada Revenue Agency respecting the vehicle allowance amounts that will not be treated as taxable income, and that will be permitted as business expenses for Employers. Such information normally establishes a maximum rate for the first 5,000 km, and a lower rate for additional kilometres. The Coordinating Committee and the Council shall determine a rate that is midway between those two rates. The above vehicle allowance rate shall be adjusted, effective on the first pay period following May 1 of each year, to the rate so determined by the Coordinating Committee and the Council.
summary: The vehicle allowance rate is set annually by a committee, calculated as the midpoint between the two standard CRA rates for business vehicle expenses. The new rate is effective the first pay period after May 1st each year.
logical_representation: ANNUALLY -> UPDATE(vehicle_allowance_rate, (CRA_rate_1 + CRA_rate_2) / 2)
reasoning: This rule defines the process for setting a monetary allowance for vehicle use, which is a form of subsistence or expense reimbursement.

name: No Vehicle Allowance with Employer-Provided Transport
rule_text: Where the Employer provides the transportation the travel allowance would be paid but the vehicle allowance would not be payable.
summary: If the employer provides transportation, the employee receives the travel allowance (for time) but not the vehicle allowance (for mileage).
logical_representation: IF employer_provides_transport (llm) == true -> FORFEIT(vehicle_allowance)
reasoning: This rule sets a condition for the payment of an allowance, making it a rule governing subsistence and travel entitlements.

name: Employer Transport Standards
rule_text: Where the Employer supplies the transportation, such transportation shall, at a minimum, be a safe, clean, and modern means of transportation with sufficient seating for each person allowing adequate comfort for adults. School buses shall not be used for such transportation. Where the Employer is supplying transportation, and when the size of the crew is such that the capacity of a coach-type bus is required, such bus transportation will be provided. Pick up points shall be mutually agreed upon.
summary: Employer-provided transportation must be safe, clean, modern, and comfortable for adults. School buses are prohibited. Coach-style buses must be used for large crews. Pick-up points are to be mutually agreed upon.
logical_representation: IF employer_provides_transport (llm) == true -> CONSTRAINT(transport_quality: 'safe', 'clean', 'modern', 'no_school_buses')
reasoning: This rule defines the quality standards for a non-monetary benefit (transportation) related to remote work, which is part of the overall travel and accommodation entitlements.

name: Forfeiture of Travel Pay During Labour Disputes
rule_text: Employees who are transported to a job site but who refuse to start work at the prescribed time due to a picket line or other form of labour relations dispute will not be paid transportation or travel allowance for that day.
summary: If an employee is transported to a site but refuses to work due to a labor dispute like a picket line, they will not receive transportation or travel allowance for that day.
logical_representation: IF work_start_status (Unsupported) == 'REFUSED_DUE_TO_LABOR_DISPUTE' -> FORFEIT(transportation_allowance) AND FORFEIT(travel_allowance)
reasoning: This rule specifies a condition under which an employee forfeits their entitlement to travel-related allowances, directly impacting subsistence rules.

name: Paid Waiting Time for Delayed Transport
rule_text: When the transportation provided by the Employer for the conveyance of Employees is delayed by circumstances that are reasonably within the control of the Employer or the bussing company, the Employees shall be paid for all such time, providing the delay is in excess of 15 minutes, beyond the scheduled arrival time, up to a limit of two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rate.
summary: If employer-provided transportation is delayed by more than 15 minutes due to controllable reasons, employees will be paid for the waiting time at their straight-time rate, for up to a maximum of two hours.
logical_representation: IF is_delay_controllable (llm) == true AND transport_delay_minutes (llm) > 15 -> PAY(MIN(transport_delay_minutes (llm) / 60, 2) * straight_time_rate)
reasoning: This rule provides payment for non-productive time (waiting) based on an hourly rate, which classifies it as a labor worked time rule.

name: Compensation for Mid-day Job Transfers
rule_text: If an Employee is required by the Employer to move from one job to another during working hours, the Employer shall provide the transportation or pay vehicle allowance at the rate established by the formula in 29.02 (a) above per kilometre traveled if the Employee uses their own vehicle. The Employee shall not suffer any loss of pay as a result of transferring between projects during working hours.
summary: If an employee has to move between jobs during work hours, the employer must provide transport or pay a vehicle allowance. The travel time is paid, so the employee does not lose any wages.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'MID_DAY_TRANSFER' -> PAY(travel_time_hours * base_rate) AND (PROVIDE(transportation) OR ALLOWANCE(vehicle_per_km))
reasoning: This rule has two components: ensuring no loss of pay (LABOR_WORKED_TIME) and providing a vehicle allowance or transport (LABOR_SUBSISTENCE_ALLOWANCE). The primary topic is worked time as it guarantees pay for the duration of the transfer.

name: Premium Pay for Travel After Shift Without Break
rule_text: Employees required to travel out of a city or town to another job after working a shift, and before an eight (8) hour break occurs, shall be paid for all time traveled at the rate of time and one-half the normal rate. If still traveling the following day, the Employee shall be paid the normal rate for time traveled during the regular working day only.
summary: If an employee must travel to another job after a shift without an 8-hour break, the travel time is paid at time and a half. If travel continues into the next regular workday, that travel time is paid at the normal straight-time rate.
logical_representation: IF is_travel_after_shift_no_break (llm) == true -> PAY(travel_hours * 1.5 * base_rate) ELSE IF is_travel_during_next_workday (llm) == true -> PAY(travel_hours * 1.0 * base_rate)
reasoning: This rule specifies a premium pay rate (1.5x) for time spent traveling under specific circumstances, clearly placing it in the category of worked time and overtime rules.

name: Room or Camp Move Allowance
rule_text: Should an Employee residing in camp accommodation be requested by the Employer or the client's designated camp management personnel to move to another room or camp, they shall be paid two (2) hours at the applicable straight time rates to carry out the move.
summary: An employee living in a camp who is required to move to another room or camp will be paid for two hours at their straight-time rate for the inconvenience.
logical_representation: IF event (Unsupported) == 'REQUIRED_ROOM_MOVE' -> PAY(2 * straight_time_rate)
reasoning: The payment is specified as a number of hours at a specific pay rate, which aligns it with rules for paid labor time, even though no productive work is performed.

name: Travel Allowance for Remote Accommodation
rule_text: When an Employee is being paid subsistence allowance in accordance with Article 29.04 and when there is no suitable accommodation available within 45 km. of the project on which the Employee is engaged, the Employer shall determine the location of the nearest available suitable accommodation and shall determine the number of road kilometers beyond a 45 kilometer radius of the project that would be required to travel each way from the nearest available suitable accommodation, and shall calculate the travel allowance in accordance with those provisions as identified in Article 29.02.
summary: If an employee on subsistence cannot find suitable accommodation within 45 km of the project, the employer must pay a travel allowance for the daily commute distance beyond that 45 km radius, calculated as per Article 29.02.
logical_representation: IF is_suitable_accommodation_available (llm) == false AND job_location_radius_km (Unsupported) <= 45 -> ALLOWANCE(travel_allowance_for_remote_accommodation)
reasoning: This rule provides a travel allowance specifically triggered by accommodation availability for workers receiving subsistence, making it a subsistence-related rule.

name: Commercial/Institutional Daily Travel Beyond Free Zone
rule_text: For projects beyond the forty-five kilometre (45 km) free zone for which daily travel is required, then the Employer will provide transportation, plus a travel allowance to be negotiated in consultation with the Union, however, in the event no Agreement is reached with the Union then a decision shall be made by the Registered Employers' Organization, which decision shall be final and binding.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional projects beyond the 45 km free zone, the employer must provide transportation and a travel allowance. The allowance amount is negotiated with the Union, with a final decision made by the Employers' Organization if no agreement is reached.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 45 -> PROVIDE(transportation) AND ALLOWANCE(negotiated_travel_allowance)
reasoning: This rule mandates the provision of transportation and a monetary allowance for travel, which are core components of subsistence and travel entitlements.

name: Out-of-Town Subsistence Options (within 475km)
rule_text: When an Employee is directed or dispatched to work on an out-of-town job, the Employer will provide: (i) camp accommodation, which shall be available seven days per week; or (ii) mutually agreed room and board; or (iii) for each day worked, reimbursement toward the expense of the Employee's board and lodging... by way of a subsistence allowance...
summary: For out-of-town jobs within a 475km radius, the employer must provide one of three options: camp accommodation (available 7 days/week), mutually agreed room and board, or a daily subsistence allowance for each day worked.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 475 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(camp), PROVIDE(room_and_board), ALLOWANCE(daily_subsistence))
reasoning: This rule defines the primary options for accommodation and living-out allowances, which is the definition of subsistence.

name: Additional Subsistence Day for Remote Projects
rule_text: On a project/jobsite located over two hundred and fifty (250) radius kilometers from the geographic centers of either the City of Edmonton or Calgary (as applicable) one additional day's subsistence shall be paid for the use of accommodation for the night following the last day worked, provided that the Employee presents a bona-fide commercial receipt to their Employer for each occasion the accommodation is used. Where the Employer or their client is providing a free bus trip back to the city on the same day as the last shift of the week, this provision shall not be applicable.
summary: For projects over 250 km away, an employee gets an extra day of subsistence for accommodation on the night after their last shift of the week, if they provide a receipt. This does not apply if the employer provides a bus back to the city that same day.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 250 AND claim_type (Unsupported) == 'COMMERCIAL_RECEIPT' AND employer_provides_return_transport (llm) == false -> ALLOWANCE(subsistence * 1_day)
reasoning: This rule provides an additional day of a monetary living-out allowance under specific conditions, which is a subsistence rule.

name: Subsistence on Statutory Holidays
rule_text: Board and room will be supplied, or the daily expense allowance will be paid for any Statutory Holiday which falls on a scheduled workday other than a first or last day of a scheduled shift provided the Employee reports for work on the workday immediately preceding and following the Statutory Holiday.
summary: Subsistence or room and board is provided for a statutory holiday if it falls on a scheduled workday (and is not the first or last day of the shift) and the employee works the scheduled days immediately before and after the holiday.
logical_representation: IF is_stat_holiday == true AND is_first_or_last_day_of_shift (llm) == false AND worked_day_before_and_after (llm) == true -> ALLOWANCE(daily_subsistence)
reasoning: This rule specifies the conditions for receiving a daily living allowance on a statutory holiday, making it a subsistence rule.

name: Out-of-Town Subsistence Options (beyond 475km)
rule_text:
Applicable beyond a 475-kilometer radius of the Cities of Edmonton and Calgary (excluding National Parks and Northwest Territories)

When an Employee is directed or dispatched to work on an out-of-town job which will last at least five days, the Employer will provide, on a seven (7) days per week basis:

(i) camp accommodation; or
(ii) Mutually agreed room and board, or subsistence allowance as follows.
(iii) reimbursement toward the expense of the Employee's board and lodging...by way of a subsistence allowance...
summary: For jobs beyond a 475km radius lasting at least five days, the employer must provide one of the following on a 7-day-per-week basis: camp accommodation, mutually agreed room and board, or a daily subsistence allowance.
logical_representation: IF project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 AND job_duration_days (llm) >= 5 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(camp), PROVIDE(room_and_board), ALLOWANCE(daily_subsistence)) ON(7_day_basis)
reasoning: This rule defines the options for accommodation and living-out allowances for long-distance projects, which is the definition of subsistence.

name: Subsistence Forfeiture for Unexcused Absences
rule_text: Employees failing to report for work on the workday immediately preceding and following a weekend or Statutory Holiday will receive the above for days worked only.
summary: For jobs beyond 475km, if an employee has an unexcused absence on the workday before or after a weekend or statutory holiday, they will only receive subsistence for the days they actually worked, forfeiting it for the days off.
logical_representation: IF worked_day_before_and_after (llm) == false -> FORFEIT(subsistence_for_weekend_or_stat)
reasoning: This rule outlines conditions for forfeiture of a living allowance based on attendance, which directly relates to subsistence rules.

name: High-Cost Area Subsistence Options
rule_text: In certain situations, Employees may be dispatched or directed to work on projects which are in an area where the cost of available suitable single room accommodation and/or meals may be in excess of the daily rate of subsistence set out in this Article. In such a case, the Employer shall provide one of the following options:  provide suitable room and board; or  directly pick up the cost of the room and pay a meal allowance to be determined as is set out in this Article; or  the subsistence allowance shall be reviewed and, if necessary, adjusted...
summary: In high-cost areas where the standard subsistence rate is insufficient, the employer must choose one of three options: provide room and board directly, pay for the room and provide a meal allowance, or participate in a process to review and adjust the subsistence rate.
logical_representation: IF is_high_cost_area (llm) == true -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(room_and_board), PROVIDE(room) + ALLOWANCE(meal), ADJUST(subsistence_rate))
reasoning: This rule provides alternative methods for fulfilling the employer's accommodation and living expense obligations, which is a core part of subsistence.

name: Subsistence During Work Stoppages
rule_text: Employees unable to work due to legitimate illness, material shortage, job site conditions, or inclement weather and for whom it is not practical to return to their respective primary Alberta residence...shall receive their board and room or daily allowance for those work days they were scheduled to work, during the period such circumstances continue, up to a maximum of three (3) days.
summary: If work stops for reasons like illness, weather, or material shortages, employees who cannot practically return home will continue to receive their subsistence or room and board for scheduled workdays, up to a maximum of three days.
logical_representation: IF is_unable_to_work (llm) == true AND is_return_home_impractical (llm) == true -> ALLOWANCE(subsistence) FOR MAX(3_days)
reasoning: This rule governs the continuation of living allowances during periods of non-work, making it a subsistence rule.

name: Prorated Subsistence for Early Departure
rule_text: If an Employee who is being provided with subsistence allowance chooses to leave a jobsite prior to the normal quitting time without receiving consent from their Employer, the Employee will receive a prorated amount of subsistence based upon the number of hours the Employee worked in the workday, compared to the regularly scheduled hours of work for the day. If the Employee leaves prior to the normal quitting time with the consent of the Employer they will receive the normal daily subsistence allowance for that day.
summary: An employee who leaves work early without permission will have their daily subsistence allowance prorated based on hours worked. If they leave early with permission, they receive the full day's subsistence.
logical_representation: IF is_absence_preauthorized (Unsupported) == false -> PRORATED(subsistence, daily_hours / scheduled_daily_hours (llm)) ELSE ALLOWANCE(full_daily_subsistence)
reasoning: This rule dictates how a daily monetary allowance is calculated based on attendance and hours worked, which falls under subsistence.

name: Commercial/Institutional Out-of-Town Options (within 475km)
rule_text: Where Employees are employed in the area beyond that in which daily travel applies and up to a radius of 475 km from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary... the Employer may elect to provide:  camp accommodations... or  mutually agreed room and board; or  subsistence allowance as follows: An amount to be negotiated...
summary: For Commercial/Institutional work beyond daily travel zones but within 475km, the employer can provide camp, agreed room and board, or a negotiated subsistence allowance.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 45 AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) <= 475 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(camp), PROVIDE(room_and_board), ALLOWANCE(negotiated_subsistence))
reasoning: This rule specifies the employer's options for providing living-out entitlements, which is the definition of subsistence.

name: Commercial/Institutional Out-of-Town Options (beyond 475km)
rule_text: Beyond a 475 kilometer radius from the center of the cities of Edmonton or Calgary, as may be appropriate, the Employer, where their Employees do not return daily, has the same elections as above, but on the basis of seven (7) days per week.
summary: For Commercial/Institutional work beyond 475km where employees do not return home daily, the employer has the same options (camp, room and board, or negotiated subsistence) but must provide them on a 7-day-per-week basis.
logical_representation: IF (project_type == 'COMMERCIAL' OR project_type == 'INSTITUTIONAL') AND project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) > 475 -> EMPLOYER_CHOICE(PROVIDE(camp), PROVIDE(room_and_board), ALLOWANCE(negotiated_subsistence)) ON(7_day_basis)
reasoning: This rule defines the provision of living-out entitlements for long-distance projects, which is a core subsistence rule.

name: Initial and Return Transportation Allowance - Industrial
rule_text: Employees directed or dispatched to a project/jobsite from which they do not return daily shall be paid travel allowance for initial travel and transportation to the project and return, upon termination of the job or their employment, based upon a radius from the cities of Edmonton or Calgary, as applicable, as follows: (i) up to 200 kilometres - $$$ each way; (ii) 200 kilometres to 300 kilometres - $$$ each way; (iii) 300 kilometres to 375 kilometres - $$$ each way; (iv) over 375 kilometres to 475 kilometres $$$ each way, or actual airfare... (vi) over 475 kilometres - as mutually agreed...
summary: For industrial jobs where employees don't return daily, they receive a fixed initial and return travel allowance. The amount is tiered based on the project's distance from Edmonton or Calgary.
logical_representation: IF project_type == 'INDUSTRIAL' -> CASE project_distance_from_city_hall_km (Unsupported) [ <= 200 -> ALLOWANCE($X), 201-300 -> ALLOWANCE($Y), ... ] FOR(initial_and_return_trip)
reasoning: This rule provides a monetary allowance to cover the costs of travel to and from a remote site, which is a form of subsistence or travel entitlement.

name: Employee Election for Transport vs Allowance
rule_text: When transportation is provided by the employer by way of air, bus, or other acceptable surface transportation, prior to the commencement and following the conclusion of a work cycle... an employee, at the time of dispatch, will be allowed to elect to use the such employer provided transportation or to receive collective agreement initial/return/rotation allowances.
summary: When the employer offers transportation for initial, return, or rotational travel, the employee can choose at the time of dispatch to either use the provided transport or receive the equivalent cash allowances as defined in the agreement.
logical_representation: IF employer_provides_transport (llm) == true -> EMPLOYEE_CHOICE(USE(transport), RECEIVE(allowance))
reasoning: This rule provides employees with a choice between a direct benefit (transport) and a monetary allowance, which is a key aspect of managing subsistence and travel entitlements.

name: Reimbursement when Employer Transport is Unavailable
rule_text: Notwithstanding the foregoing, an employee who has elected to use employer provided transportation and who is hired, laid off, or terminated on a day when such transportation is not available shall be reimbursed the cost of a one-way commercial bus ticket to Edmonton or Calgary, whichever is applicable, and transportation from the site to the nearest commercial bus terminal, or equivalent taxi fare.
summary: If an employee who chose employer-provided transport is hired or terminated on a day the transport isn't running, the employer must reimburse them for a one-way commercial bus ticket to Edmonton or Calgary and transport to the bus terminal.
logical_representation: IF is_transport_available (llm) == false AND (employee_status (Unsupported) == 'NEW_HIRE' OR employee_status (Unsupported) == 'LAID_OFF' OR employee_status (Unsupported) == 'TERMINATED') -> REIMBURSE(bus_ticket_cost + taxi_fare)
reasoning: This rule outlines a reimbursement for travel expenses when a provided benefit is unavailable, which falls under subsistence and travel cost management.

name: Vesting Period for Initial and Return Allowances
rule_text: Employees will qualify for, and receive initial transportation allowance to the job site after being employed at the site for either fifteen (15) calendar days or completion of the job, whichever is the lesser. Should the Employee remain on the job until completion of thirty (30) calendar days, or until completion of the dispatched job requirement, whichever may be the lesser, they shall receive the return transportation allowance to be paid with their final pay cheque.
summary: An employee qualifies for the initial travel allowance after 15 calendar days of employment or job completion (whichever is sooner). They qualify for the return travel allowance after 30 calendar days or job completion (whichever is sooner).
logical_representation: IF days_on_job (llm) >= 15 OR job_is_complete (llm) == true -> ENTITLED(initial_allowance); IF days_on_job (llm) >= 30 OR job_is_complete (llm) == true -> ENTITLED(return_allowance)
reasoning: This rule sets the time-based eligibility conditions for receiving travel allowances, which is a fundamental aspect of subsistence and allowance administration.

name: Rotational Leave and Allowance (300-475km) - Industrial
rule_text: On jobs located beyond a Three Hundred (300) km radius to a maximum of Four Hundred and Seventy-five (475) km from the centre of Edmonton or Calgary or other hiring hall location, the Employer shall: (i) Pay an allowance...after thirty-five (35) calendar days of employment on the job and thereafter for each subsequent thirty-five (35) calendar days of employment on the job. (ii) Allow employees five (5) working days leave...
summary: For industrial jobs between 300km and 475km, after every 35 calendar days of employment, the employee is entitled to a monetary allowance and five working days of leave.
